text: INTRODUCTION TO VOLUME NINE
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Among so many effective and artistic tales, it is difficult to give a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: preference to one over all the rest. Yet, certainly, even amid Verne's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remarkable works, his "Off on a Comet" must be given high rank. Perhaps
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this story will be remembered when even "Round the World in Eighty Days"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and "Michael Strogoff" have been obliterated by centuries of time. At
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: least, of the many books since written upon the same theme as Verne's,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no one has yet succeeded in equaling or even approaching it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In one way "Off on a Comet" shows a marked contrast to Verne's earlier
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: books. Not only does it invade a region more remote than even the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Trip to the Moon," but the author here abandons his usual scrupulously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scientific attitude. In order that he may escort us through the depths
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of immeasurable space, show us what astronomy really knows of conditions
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there and upon the other planets, Verne asks us to accept a situation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frankly impossible. The earth and a comet are brought twice into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: collision without mankind in general, or even our astronomers, becoming
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conscious of the fact. Moreover several people from widely scattered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: places are carried off by the comet and returned uninjured. Yet further,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the comet snatches for the convenience of its travelers, both air and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: water. Little, useful tracts of earth are picked up and, as it were,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: turned over and clapped down right side up again upon the comet's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surface. Even ships pass uninjured through this remarkable somersault.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: These events all belong frankly to the realm of fairyland.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: If the situation were reproduced in actuality, if ever a comet should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: come into collision with the earth, we can conceive two scientifically
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: possible results. If the comet were of such attenuation, such almost
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: infinitesimal mass as some of these celestial wanderers seem to be, we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: can imagine our earth self-protective and possibly unharmed. If, on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: other hand, the comet had even a hundredth part of the size and solidity
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and weight which Verne confers upon his monster so as to give his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: travelers a home--in that case the collision would be unspeakably
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disastrous--especially to the unlucky individuals who occupied the exact
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: point of contact.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But once granted the initial and the closing extravagance, the departure
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and return of his characters, the alpha and omega of his tale, how
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: closely the author clings to facts between! How closely he follows, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: imparts to his readers, the scientific probabilities of the universe
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beyond our earth, the actual knowledge so hard won by our astronomers!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Other authors who, since Verne, have told of trips through the planetary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and stellar universe have given free rein to fancy, to dreams of what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: might be found. Verne has endeavored to impart only what is known to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exist.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In the same year with "Off on a Comet," 1877, was published also
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the tale variously named and translated as "The Black Indies," "The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Underground City," and "The Child of the Cavern." This story, like
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Round the World in Eighty Days" was first issued in "feuilleton" by the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: noted Paris newspaper "Le Temps." Its success did not equal that of its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: predecessor in this style. Some critics indeed have pointed to this work
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as marking the beginning of a decline in the author's power of awaking
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: interest. Many of his best works were, however, still to follow. And, as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: regards imagination and the elements of mystery and awe, surely in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Underground City" with its cavern world, its secret, undiscoverable,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unrelenting foe, the "Harfang," bird of evil omen, and the "fire
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: maidens" of the ruined castle, surely with all these "imagination" is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: anything but lacking.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: From the realistic side, the work is painstaking and exact as all the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: author's works. The sketches of mines and miners, their courage and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their dangers, their lives and their hopes, are carefully studied. So
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: also is the emotional aspect of the deeps under ground, the blackness,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the endless wandering passages, the silence, and the awe._
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: BOOK I.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: CHAPTER I. A CHALLENGE
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nothing, sir, can induce me to surrender my claim."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am sorry, count, but in such a matter your views cannot modify mine."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But allow me to point out that my seniority unquestionably gives me a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prior right."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Mere seniority, I assert, in an affair of this kind, cannot possibly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entitle you to any prior claim whatever."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then, captain, no alternative is left but for me to compel you to yield
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at the sword's point."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "As you please, count; but neither sword nor pistol can force me to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: forego my pretensions. Here is my card."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And mine."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This rapid altercation was thus brought to an end by the formal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: interchange of the names of the disputants. On one of the cards was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inscribed:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Captain Hector Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Staff Officer, Mostaganem._
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the other was the title:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Count Wassili Timascheff,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On board the Schooner "Dobryna."_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It did not take long to arrange that seconds should be appointed, who
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would meet in Mostaganem at two o'clock that day; and the captain and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the count were on the point of parting from each other, with a salute of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: punctilious courtesy, when Timascheff, as if struck by a sudden thought,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: said abruptly: "Perhaps it would be better, captain, not to allow the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: real cause of this to transpire?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Far better," replied Servadac; "it is undesirable in every way for any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: names to be mentioned."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "In that case, however," continued the count, "it will be necessary to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: assign an ostensible pretext of some kind. Shall we allege a musical
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dispute? a contention in which I feel bound to defend Wagner, while you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are the zealous champion of Rossini?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am quite content," answered Servadac, with a smile; and with another
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: low bow they parted.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The scene, as here depicted, took place upon the extremity of a little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cape on the Algerian coast, between Mostaganem and Tenes, about two
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles from the mouth of the Shelif. The headland rose more than sixty
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: feet above the sea-level, and the azure waters of the Mediterranean, as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they softly kissed the strand, were tinged with the reddish hue of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ferriferous rocks that formed its base. It was the 31st of December. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: noontide sun, which usually illuminated the various projections of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast with a dazzling brightness, was hidden by a dense mass of cloud,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the fog, which for some unaccountable cause, had hung for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: last two months over nearly every region in the world, causing serious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: interruption to traffic between continent and continent, spread its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dreary veil across land and sea.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After taking leave of the staff-officer, Count Wassili Timascheff wended
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his way down to a small creek, and took his seat in the stern of a light
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: four-oar that had been awaiting his return; this was immediately pushed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: off from shore, and was soon alongside a pleasure-yacht, that was lying
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to, not many cable lengths away.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At a sign from Servadac, an orderly, who had been standing at a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: respectful distance, led forward a magnificent Arabian horse; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain vaulted into the saddle, and followed by his attendant, well
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mounted as himself, started off towards Mostaganem. It was half-past
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: twelve when the two riders crossed the bridge that had been recently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: erected over the Shelif, and a quarter of an hour later their steeds,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: flecked with foam, dashed through the Mascara Gate, which was one of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: five entrances opened in the embattled wall that encircled the town.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At that date, Mostaganem contained about fifteen thousand inhabitants,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: three thousand of whom were French. Besides being one of the principal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: district towns of the province of Oran, it was also a military station.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mostaganem rejoiced in a well-sheltered harbor, which enabled her to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: utilize all the rich products of the Mina and the Lower Shelif. It was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the existence of so good a harbor amidst the exposed cliffs of this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast that had induced the owner of the _Dobryna_ to winter in these
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: parts, and for two months the Russian standard had been seen floating
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from her yard, whilst on her mast-head was hoisted the pennant of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the French Yacht Club, with the distinctive letters M. C. W. T., the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: initials of Count Timascheff.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Having entered the town, Captain Servadac made his way towards Matmore,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the military quarter, and was not long in finding two friends on whom
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he might rely--a major of the 2nd Fusileers, and a captain of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 8th Artillery. The two officers listened gravely enough to Servadac's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: request that they would act as his seconds in an affair of honor, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could not resist a smile on hearing that the dispute between him and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: count had originated in a musical discussion. Surely, they suggested,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the matter might be easily arranged; a few slight concessions on either
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: side, and all might be amicably adjusted. But no representations on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their part were of any avail. Hector Servadac was inflexible.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No concession is possible," he replied, resolutely. "Rossini has been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deeply injured, and I cannot suffer the injury to be unavenged. Wagner
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is a fool. I shall keep my word. I am quite firm."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Be it so, then," replied one of the officers; "and after all, you know,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a sword-cut need not be a very serious affair."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Certainly not," rejoined Servadac; "and especially in my case, when I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have not the slightest intention of being wounded at all."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Incredulous as they naturally were as to the assigned cause of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quarrel, Servadac's friends had no alternative but to accept his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: explanation, and without farther parley they started for the staff
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abroad was an aide-de-camp of the Czar, had of course proposed swords
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as the most appropriate weapons, and the duel was to take place on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: following morning, the first of January, at nine o'clock, upon the cliff
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at a spot about a mile and a half from the mouth of the Shelif. With
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the assurance that they would not fail to keep their appointment with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: military punctuality, the two officers cordially wrung their friend's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hand and retired to the Zulma Cafe for a game at piquet. Captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For the last fortnight Servadac had not been occupying his proper
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lodgings in the military quarters; having been appointed to make a local
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: levy, he had been living in a gourbi, or native hut, on the Mostaganem
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast, between four and five miles from the Shelif. His orderly was his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sole companion, and by any other man than the captain the enforced exile
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would have been esteemed little short of a severe penance.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On his way to the gourbi, his mental occupation was a very laborious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: effort to put together what he was pleased to call a rondo, upon a model
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of versification all but obsolete. This rondo, it is unnecessary to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conceal, was to be an ode addressed to a young widow by whom he had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captivated, and whom he was anxious to marry, and the tenor of his muse
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was intended to prove that when once a man has found an object in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all respects worthy of his affections, he should love her "in all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: simplicity." Whether the aphorism were universally true was not very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: material to the gallant captain, whose sole ambition at present was to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: construct a roundelay of which this should be the prevailing sentiment.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He indulged the fancy that he might succeed in producing a composition
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which would have a fine effect here in Algeria, where poetry in that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: form was all but unknown.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I know well enough," he said repeatedly to himself, "what I want to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: say. I want to tell her that I love her sincerely, and wish to marry
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her; but, confound it! the words won't rhyme. Plague on it! Does nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rhyme with 'simplicity'? Ah! I have it now:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 'Lovers should, whoe'er they be,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Love in all simplicity.'
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But what next? how am I to go on? I say, Ben Zoof," he called aloud to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his orderly, who was trotting silently close in his rear, "did you ever
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: compose any poetry?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No, captain," answered the man promptly: "I have never made any verses,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but I have seen them made fast enough at a booth during the fete of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Montmartre."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Can you remember them?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Remember them! to be sure I can. This is the way they began:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 'Come in! come in! you'll not repent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The entrance money you have spent;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The wondrous mirror in this place
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Reveals your future sweetheart's face.'"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Bosh!" cried Servadac in disgust; "your verses are detestable trash."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "As good as any others, captain, squeaked through a reed pipe."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hold your tongue, man," said Servadac peremptorily; "I have made
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: another couplet.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 'Lovers should, whoe'er they be,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Love in all simplicity;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lover, loving honestly,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Offer I myself to thee.'"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Beyond this, however, the captain's poetical genius was impotent to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carry him; his farther efforts were unavailing, and when at six o'clock
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: composition.

text: CHAPTER II. CAPTAIN SERVADAC AND HIS ORDERLY
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At the time of which I write, there might be seen in the registers of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Minister of War the following entry:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: SERVADAC (_Hector_), born at St. Trelody in the district of Lesparre,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: department of the Gironde, July 19th, 18--.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Property:_ 1200 francs in rentes.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Length of service:_ Fourteen years, three months, and five days.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Service:_ Two years at school at St. Cyr; two years at L'Ecole
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: d'Application; two years in the 8th Regiment of the Line; two years in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the 3rd Light Cavalry; seven years in Algeria.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Campaigns:_ Soudan and Japan.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Rank:_ Captain on the staff at Mostaganem.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Decorations:_ Chevalier of the Legion of Honor, March 13th, 18--.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hector Servadac was thirty years of age, an orphan without lineage and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost without means. Thirsting for glory rather than for gold, slightly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scatter-brained, but warm-hearted, generous, and brave, he was eminently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: formed to be the protege of the god of battles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For the first year and a half of his existence he had been the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: foster-child of the sturdy wife of a vine-dresser of Medoc--a lineal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: descendant of the heroes of ancient prowess; in a word, he was one of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: those individuals whom nature seems to have predestined for remarkable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: things, and around whose cradle have hovered the fairy godmothers of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: adventure and good luck.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In appearance Hector Servadac was quite the type of an officer; he was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rather more than five feet six inches high, slim and graceful, with dark
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: curling hair and mustaches, well-formed hands and feet, and a clear blue
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eye. He seemed born to please without being conscious of the power he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: possessed. It must be owned, and no one was more ready to confess it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than himself, that his literary attainments were by no means of a high
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: order. "We don't spin tops" is a favorite saying amongst artillery
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: officers, indicating that they do not shirk their duty by frivolous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pursuits; but it must be confessed that Servadac, being naturally idle,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was very much given to "spinning tops." His good abilities, however,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and his ready intelligence had carried him successfully through the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: curriculum of his early career. He was a good draughtsman, an excellent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rider--having thoroughly mastered the successor to the famous "Uncle
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Tom" at the riding-school of St. Cyr--and in the records of his military
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: service his name had several times been included in the order of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: day.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The following episode may suffice, in a certain degree, to illustrate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his character. Once, in action, he was leading a detachment of infantry
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: through an intrenchment. They came to a place where the side-work of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: trench had been so riddled by shell that a portion of it had actually
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fallen in, leaving an aperture quite unsheltered from the grape-shot
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that was pouring in thick and fast. The men hesitated. In an instant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac mounted the side-work, laid himself down in the gap, and thus
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: filling up the breach by his own body, shouted, "March on!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And through a storm of shot, not one of which touched the prostrate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: officer, the troop passed in safety.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Since leaving the military college, Servadac, with the exception of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his two campaigns in the Soudan and Japan, had been always stationed in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Algeria. He had now a staff appointment at Mostaganem, and had lately
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been entrusted with some topographical work on the coast between Tenes
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the Shelif. It was a matter of little consequence to him that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gourbi, in which of necessity he was quartered, was uncomfortable and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ill-contrived; he loved the open air, and the independence of his life
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suited him well. Sometimes he would wander on foot upon the sandy shore,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and sometimes he would enjoy a ride along the summit of the cliff;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: altogether being in no hurry at all to bring his task to an end. His
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: occupation, moreover, was not so engrossing but that he could find
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: leisure for taking a short railway journey once or twice a week; so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that he was ever and again putting in an appearance at the general's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: receptions at Oran, and at the fetes given by the governor at Algiers.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was on one of these occasions that he had first met Madame de L----,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the lady to whom he was desirous of dedicating the rondo, the first four
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lines of which had just seen the light. She was a colonel's widow,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: young and handsome, very reserved, not to say haughty in her manner, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: either indifferent or impervious to the admiration which she inspired.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac had not yet ventured to declare his attachment; of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rivals he was well aware he had not a few, and amongst these not the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: least formidable was the Russian Count Timascheff. And although the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: young widow was all unconscious of the share she had in the matter, it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was she, and she alone, who was the cause of the challenge just given
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and accepted by her two ardent admirers.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: During his residence in the gourbi, Hector Servadac's sole companion
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was his orderly, Ben Zoof. Ben Zoof was devoted, body and soul, to his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: superior officer. His own personal ambition was so entirely absorbed in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his master's welfare, that it is certain no offer of promotion--even had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it been that of aide-de-camp to the Governor-General of Algiers--would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have induced him to quit that master's service. His name might seem
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to imply that he was a native of Algeria; but such was by no means the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: case. His true name was Laurent; he was a native of Montmartre in Paris,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and how or why he had obtained his patronymic was one of those anomalies
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which the most sagacious of etymologists would find it hard to explain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Born on the hill of Montmartre, between the Solferino tower and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mill of La Galette, Ben Zoof had ever possessed the most unreserved
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: admiration for his birthplace; and to his eyes the heights and district
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Montmartre represented an epitome of all the wonders of the world.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In all his travels, and these had been not a few, he had never
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beheld scenery which could compete with that of his native home.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: No cathedral--not even Burgos itself--could vie with the church at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Montmartre. Its race-course could well hold its own against that at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Pentelique; its reservoir would throw the Mediterranean into the shade;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its forests had flourished long before the invasion of the Celts; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its very mill produced no ordinary flour, but provided material
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for cakes of world-wide renown. To crown all, Montmartre boasted a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mountain--a veritable mountain; envious tongues indeed might pronounce
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it little more than a hill; but Ben Zoof would have allowed himself
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to be hewn in pieces rather than admit that it was anything less than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fifteen thousand feet in height.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof's most ambitious desire was to induce the captain to go with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: him and end his days in his much-loved home, and so incessantly were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac's ears besieged with descriptions of the unparalleled beauties
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and advantages of this eighteenth arrondissement of Paris, that he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could scarcely hear the name of Montmartre without a conscious thrill
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of aversion. Ben Zoof, however, did not despair of ultimately converting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the captain, and meanwhile had resolved never to leave him. When a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: private in the 8th Cavalry, he had been on the point of quitting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the army at twenty-eight years of age, but unexpectedly he had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appointed orderly to Captain Servadac. Side by side they fought in two
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: campaigns. Servadac had saved Ben Zoof's life in Japan; Ben Zoof had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rendered his master a like service in the Soudan. The bond of union thus
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: effected could never be severed; and although Ben Zoof's achievements
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had fairly earned him the right of retirement, he firmly declined all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: honors or any pension that might part him from his superior officer. Two
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stout arms, an iron constitution, a powerful frame, and an indomitable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: courage were all loyally devoted to his master's service, and fairly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entitled him to his _soi-disant_ designation of "The Rampart of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Montmartre." Unlike his master, he made no pretension to any gift
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of poetic power, but his inexhaustible memory made him a living
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: encyclopaedia; and for his stock of anecdotes and trooper's tales he was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: matchless.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Thoroughly appreciating his servant's good qualities, Captain Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: endured with imperturbable good humor those idiosyncrasies, which in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a less faithful follower would have been intolerable, and from time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to time he would drop a word of sympathy that served to deepen his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: subordinate's devotion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On one occasion, when Ben Zoof had mounted his hobby-horse, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was indulging in high-flown praises about his beloved eighteenth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: arrondissement, the captain had remarked gravely, "Do you know, Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof, that Montmartre only requires a matter of some thirteen thousand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: feet to make it as high as Mont Blanc?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof's eyes glistened with delight; and from that moment Hector
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac and Montmartre held equal places in his affection.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER III. INTERRUPTED EFFUSIONS
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Composed of mud and loose stones, and covered with a thatch of turf and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: straw, known to the natives by the name of "driss," the gourbi, though a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: grade better than the tents of the nomad Arabs, was yet far inferior
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to any habitation built of brick or stone. It adjoined an old stone
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hostelry, previously occupied by a detachment of engineers, and which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: now afforded shelter for Ben Zoof and the two horses. It still
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: contained a considerable number of tools, such as mattocks, shovels, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pick-axes.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Uncomfortable as was their temporary abode, Servadac and his attendant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made no complaints; neither of them was dainty in the matter either of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: board or lodging. After dinner, leaving his orderly to stow away the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remains of the repast in what he was pleased to term the "cupboard of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his stomach." Captain Servadac turned out into the open air to smoke his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pipe upon the edge of the cliff. The shades of night were drawing on.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: An hour previously, veiled in heavy clouds, the sun had sunk below the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: horizon that bounded the plain beyond the Shelif.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The sky presented a most singular appearance. Towards the north,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: although the darkness rendered it impossible to see beyond a quarter
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of a mile, the upper strata of the atmosphere were suffused with a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rosy glare. No well-defined fringe of light, nor arch of luminous rays,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: betokened a display of aurora borealis, even had such a phenomenon been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: possible in these latitudes; and the most experienced meteorologist
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would have been puzzled to explain the cause of this striking
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: illumination on this 31st of December, the last evening of the passing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: year.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But Captain Servadac was no meteorologist, and it is to be doubted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whether, since leaving school, he had ever opened his "Course of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Cosmography." Besides, he had other thoughts to occupy his mind. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prospects of the morrow offered serious matter for consideration. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain was actuated by no personal animosity against the count; though
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rivals, the two men regarded each other with sincere respect; they had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: simply reached a crisis in which one of them was _de trop;_ which of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them, fate must decide.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At eight o'clock, Captain Servadac re-entered the gourbi, the single
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: apartment of which contained his bed, a small writing-table, and some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: trunks that served instead of cupboards. The orderly performed his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: culinary operations in the adjoining building, which he also used as a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bed-room, and where, extended on what he called his "good oak mattress,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he would sleep soundly as a dormouse for twelve hours at a stretch. Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof had not yet received his orders to retire, and ensconcing himself
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in a corner of the gourbi, he endeavored to doze--a task which the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unusual agitation of his master rendered somewhat difficult. Captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac was evidently in no hurry to betake himself to rest, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seating himself at his table, with a pair of compasses and a sheet of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tracing-paper, he began to draw, with red and blue crayons, a variety
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of colored lines, which could hardly be supposed to have much connection
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with a topographical survey. In truth, his character of staff-officer
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was now entirely absorbed in that of Gascon poet. Whether he imagined
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the compasses would bestow upon his verses the measure of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mathematical accuracy, or whether he fancied that the parti-colored
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lines would lend variety to his rhythm, it is impossible to determine;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be that as it may, he was devoting all his energies to the compilation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his rondo, and supremely difficult he found the task.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hang it!" he ejaculated, "whatever induced me to choose this meter? It
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is as hard to find rhymes as to rally fugitive in a battle. But, by all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the powers! it shan't be said that a French officer cannot cope with a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: piece of poetry. One battalion has fought--now for the rest!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Perseverance had its reward. Presently two lines, one red, the other
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: blue, appeared upon the paper, and the captain murmured:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Words, mere words, cannot avail,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Telling true heart's tender tale."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What on earth ails my master?" muttered Ben Zoof; "for the last hour he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: has been as fidgety as a bird returning after its winter migration."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac suddenly started from his seat, and as he paced the room with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all the frenzy of poetic inspiration, read out:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Empty words cannot convey
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: All a lover's heart would say."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, to be sure, he is at his everlasting verses again!" said Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to himself, as he roused himself in his corner. "Impossible to sleep in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: such a noise;" and he gave vent to a loud groan.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How now, Ben Zoof?" said the captain sharply. "What ails you?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nothing, sir, only the nightmare."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Curse the fellow, he has quite interrupted me!" ejaculated the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ben Zoof!" he called aloud.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Here, sir!" was the prompt reply; and in an instant the orderly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was upon his feet, standing in a military attitude, one hand to his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: forehead, the other closely pressed to his trouser-seam.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Stay where you are! don't move an inch!" shouted Servadac; "I have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: just thought of the end of my rondo." And in a voice of inspiration,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accompanying his words with dramatic gestures, Servadac began to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: declaim:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Listen, lady, to my vows--
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: O, consent to be my spouse;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Constant ever I will be,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Constant...."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: No closing lines were uttered. All at once, with unutterable violence,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the captain and his orderly were dashed, face downwards, to the ground.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: CHAPTER IV. A CONVULSION OF NATURE
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whence came it that at that very moment the horizon underwent so strange
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and sudden a modification, that the eye of the most practiced mariner
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could not distinguish between sea and sky?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whence came it that the billows raged and rose to a height hitherto
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unregistered in the records of science?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whence came it that the elements united in one deafening crash; that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth groaned as though the whole framework of the globe were ruptured;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the waters roared from their innermost depths; that the air
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shrieked with all the fury of a cyclone?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whence came it that a radiance, intenser than the effulgence of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Northern Lights, overspread the firmament, and momentarily dimmed the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: splendor of the brightest stars?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whence came it that the Mediterranean, one instant emptied of its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: waters, was the next flooded with a foaming surge?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whence came it that in the space of a few seconds the moon's disc
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reached a magnitude as though it were but a tenth part of its ordinary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distance from the earth?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whence came it that a new blazing spheroid, hitherto unknown to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astronomy, now appeared suddenly in the firmament, though it were but to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lose itself immediately behind masses of accumulated cloud?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: What phenomenon was this that had produced a cataclysm so tremendous in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: effect upon earth, sky, and sea?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Was it possible that a single human being could have survived the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: convulsion? and if so, could he explain its mystery?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER V. A MYSTERIOUS SEA
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Violent as the commotion had been, that portion of the Algerian coast
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which is bounded on the north by the Mediterranean, and on the west by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the right bank of the Shelif, appeared to have suffered little change.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It is true that indentations were perceptible in the fertile plain,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the surface of the sea was ruffled with an agitation that was quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unusual; but the rugged outline of the cliff was the same as heretofore,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the aspect of the entire scene appeared unaltered. The stone
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hostelry, with the exception of some deep clefts in its walls, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sustained little injury; but the gourbi, like a house of cards destroyed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by an infant's breath, had completely subsided, and its two inmates lay
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: motionless, buried under the sunken thatch.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was two hours after the catastrophe that Captain Servadac regained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consciousness; he had some trouble to collect his thoughts, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: first sounds that escaped his lips were the concluding words of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rondo which had been so ruthlessly interrupted;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Constant ever I will be,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Constant...."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: His next thought was to wonder what had happened; and in order to find
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an answer, he pushed aside the broken thatch, so that his head appeared
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: above the _debris_. "The gourbi leveled to the ground!" he exclaimed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "surely a waterspout has passed along the coast."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He felt all over his body to perceive what injuries he had sustained,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but not a sprain nor a scratch could he discover. "Where are you, Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof?" he shouted.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Here, sir!" and with military promptitude a second head protruded from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the rubbish.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Have you any notion what has happened, Ben Zoof?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I've a notion, captain, that it's all up with us."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nonsense, Ben Zoof; it is nothing but a waterspout!"
