title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very good, sir," was the philosophical reply, immediately followed by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the query, "Any bones broken, sir?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "None whatever," said the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Both men were soon on their feet, and began to make a vigorous clearance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the ruins, beneath which they found that their arms, cooking
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: utensils, and other property, had sustained little injury.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "By-the-by, what o'clock is it?" asked the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It must be eight o'clock, at least," said Ben Zoof, looking at the sun,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which was a considerable height above the horizon. "It is almost time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for us to start."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To start! what for?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To keep your appointment with Count Timascheff."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "By Jove! I had forgotten all about it!" exclaimed Servadac. Then
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: looking at his watch, he cried, "What are you thinking of, Ben Zoof? It
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is scarcely two o'clock."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Two in the morning, or two in the afternoon?" asked Ben Zoof, again
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: regarding the sun.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac raised his watch to his ear. "It is going," said he; "but, by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all the wines of Medoc, I am puzzled. Don't you see the sun is in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: west? It must be near setting."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Setting, captain! Why, it is rising finely, like a conscript at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sound of the reveille. It is considerably higher since we have been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: talking."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Incredible as it might appear, the fact was undeniable that the sun was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rising over the Shelif from that quarter of the horizon behind which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it usually sank for the latter portion of its daily round. They were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: utterly bewildered. Some mysterious phenomenon must not only have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: altered the position of the sun in the sidereal system, but must even
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have brought about an important modification of the earth's rotation on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her axis.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac consoled himself with the prospect of reading an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: explanation of the mystery in next week's newspapers, and turned his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attention to what was to him of more immediate importance. "Come, let
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: us be off," said he to his orderly; "though heaven and earth be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: topsy-turvy, I must be at my post this morning."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To do Count Timascheff the honor of running him through the body,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: added Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: If Servadac and his orderly had been less preoccupied, they would have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: noticed that a variety of other physical changes besides the apparent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: alteration in the movement of the sun had been evolved during the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: atmospheric disturbances of that New Year's night. As they descended
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the steep footpath leading from the cliff towards the Shelif, they were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unconscious that their respiration became forced and rapid, like that of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a mountaineer when he has reached an altitude where the air has become
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: less charged with oxygen. They were also unconscious that their voices
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were thin and feeble; either they must themselves have become rather
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deaf, or it was evident that the air had become less capable of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: transmitting sound.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The weather, which on the previous evening had been very foggy, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entirely changed. The sky had assumed a singular tint, and was soon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: covered with lowering clouds that completely hid the sun. There were,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: indeed, all the signs of a coming storm, but the vapor, on account of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the insufficient condensation, failed to fall.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The sea appeared quite deserted, a most unusual circumstance along this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast, and not a sail nor a trail of smoke broke the gray monotony
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of water and sky. The limits of the horizon, too, had become much
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumscribed. On land, as well as on sea, the remote distance had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: completely disappeared, and it seemed as though the globe had assumed a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more decided convexity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At the pace at which they were walking, it was very evident that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain and his attendant would not take long to accomplish the three
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles that lay between the gourbi and the place of rendezvous. They
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: did not exchange a word, but each was conscious of an unusual buoyancy,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which appeared to lift up their bodies and give as it were, wings to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their feet. If Ben Zoof had expressed his sensations in words, he would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have said that he felt "up to anything," and he had even forgotten to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: taste so much as a crust of bread, a lapse of memory of which the worthy
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: soldier was rarely guilty.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As these thoughts were crossing his mind, a harsh bark was heard to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: left of the footpath, and a jackal was seen emerging from a large grove
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of lentisks. Regarding the two wayfarers with manifest uneasiness, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beast took up its position at the foot of a rock, more than thirty feet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in height. It belonged to an African species distinguished by a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: black spotted skin, and a black line down the front of the legs. At
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: night-time, when they scour the country in herds, the creatures are
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: somewhat formidable, but singly they are no more dangerous than a dog.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Though by no means afraid of them, Ben Zoof had a particular aversion
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to jackals, perhaps because they had no place among the fauna of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beloved Montmartre. He accordingly began to make threatening gestures,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: when, to the unmitigated astonishment of himself and the captain, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: animal darted forward, and in one single bound gained the summit of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rock.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Good Heavens!" cried Ben Zoof, "that leap must have been thirty feet at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: least."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "True enough," replied the captain; "I never saw such a jump."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meantime the jackal had seated itself upon its haunches, and was staring
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at the two men with an air of impudent defiance. This was too much for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof's forbearance, and stooping down he caught up a huge stone,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: when to his surprise, he found that it was no heavier than a piece of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: petrified sponge. "Confound the brute!" he exclaimed, "I might as well
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: throw a piece of bread at him. What accounts for its being as light as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Nothing daunted, however, he hurled the stone into the air. It missed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its aim; but the jackal, deeming it on the whole prudent to decamp,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disappeared across the trees and hedges with a series of bounds, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could only be likened to those that might be made by an india-rubber
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: kangaroo. Ben Zoof was sure that his own powers of propelling must equal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: those of a howitzer, for his stone, after a lengthened flight through
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the air, fell to the ground full five hundred paces the other side of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the rock.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The orderly was now some yards ahead of his master, and had reached
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a ditch full of water, and about ten feet wide. With the intention of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clearing it, he made a spring, when a loud cry burst from Servadac. "Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof, you idiot! What are you about? You will break your back!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And well might he be alarmed, for Ben Zoof had sprung to a height of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: forty feet into the air. Fearful of the consequences that would attend
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the descent of his servant to _terra firma_, Servadac bounded forwards,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to be on the other side of the ditch in time to break his fall. But the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: muscular effort that he made carried him in his turn to an altitude of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thirty feet; in his ascent he passed Ben Zoof, who had already commenced
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his downward course; and then, obedient to the laws of gravitation, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: descended with increasing rapidity, and alighted upon the earth without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: experiencing a shock greater than if he had merely made a bound of four
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: or five feet high.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof burst into a roar of laughter. "Bravo!" he said, "we should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: make a good pair of clowns."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But the captain was inclined to take a more serious view of the matter.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For a few seconds he stood lost in thought, then said solemnly, "Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof, I must be dreaming. Pinch me hard; I must be either asleep or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mad."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It is very certain that something has happened to us," said Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I have occasionally dreamed that I was a swallow flying over the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Montmartre, but I never experienced anything of this kind before; it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: must be peculiar to the coast of Algeria."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac was stupefied; he felt instinctively that he was not dreaming,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and yet was powerless to solve the mystery. He was not, however, the man
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to puzzle himself for long over any insoluble problem. "Come what may,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he presently exclaimed, "we will make up our minds for the future to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surprised at nothing."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Right, captain," replied Ben Zoof; "and, first of all, let us settle
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: our little score with Count Timascheff."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Beyond the ditch lay a small piece of meadow land, about an acre in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extent. A soft and delicious herbage carpeted the soil, whilst trees
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: formed a charming framework to the whole. No spot could have been chosen
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more suitable for the meeting between the two adversaries.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac cast a hasty glance round. No one was in sight. "We are the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: first on the field," he said.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Not so sure of that, sir," said Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What do you mean?" asked Servadac, looking at his watch, which he had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: set as nearly as possible by the sun before leaving the gourbi; "it is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not nine o'clock yet."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Look up there, sir. I am much mistaken if that is not the sun;" and as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof spoke, he pointed directly overhead to where a faint white disc
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was dimly visible through the haze of clouds.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nonsense!" exclaimed Servadac. "How can the sun be in the zenith, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the month of January, in lat. 39 degrees N.?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Can't say, sir. I only know the sun is there; and at the rate he has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been traveling, I would lay my cap to a dish of couscous that in less
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than three hours he will have set."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hector Servadac, mute and motionless, stood with folded arms. Presently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he roused himself, and began to look about again. "What means all this?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he murmured. "Laws of gravity disturbed! Points of the compass reversed!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The length of day reduced one half! Surely this will indefinitely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: postpone my meeting with the count. Something has happened; Ben Zoof and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I cannot both be mad!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The orderly, meantime, surveyed his master with the greatest equanimity;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no phenomenon, however extraordinary, would have drawn from him a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: single exclamation of surprise. "Do you see anyone, Ben Zoof?" asked the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain, at last.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No one, sir; the count has evidently been and gone." "But supposing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that to be the case," persisted the captain, "my seconds would have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: waited, and not seeing me, would have come on towards the gourbi. I can
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only conclude that they have been unable to get here; and as for Count
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Timascheff--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without finishing his sentence. Captain Servadac, thinking it just
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: probable that the count, as on the previous evening, might come by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: water, walked to the ridge of rock that overhung the shore, in order
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to ascertain if the _Dobryna_ were anywhere in sight. But the sea was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deserted, and for the first time the captain noticed that, although
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the wind was calm, the waters were unusually agitated, and seethed and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: foamed as though they were boiling. It was very certain that the yacht
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would have found a difficulty in holding her own in such a swell.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Another thing that now struck Servadac was the extraordinary contraction
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the horizon. Under ordinary circumstances, his elevated position
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would have allowed him a radius of vision at least five and twenty miles
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in length; but the terrestrial sphere seemed, in the course of the last
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: few hours, to have become considerably reduced in volume, and he could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: now see for a distance of only six miles in every direction.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meantime, with the agility of a monkey, Ben Zoof had clambered to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: top of a eucalyptus, and from his lofty perch was surveying the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: country to the south, as well as towards both Tenes and Mostaganem. On
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: descending, be informed the captain that the plain was deserted.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We will make our way to the river, and get over into Mostaganem," said
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Shelif was not more than a mile and a half from the meadow, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no time was to be lost if the two men were to reach the town before
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nightfall. Though still hidden by heavy clouds, the sun was evidently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: declining fast; and what was equally inexplicable, it was not following
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the oblique curve that in these latitudes and at this time of year might
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be expected, but was sinking perpendicularly on to the horizon.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As he went along, Captain Servadac pondered deeply. Perchance some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unheard-of phenomenon had modified the rotary motion of the globe; or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perhaps the Algerian coast had been transported beyond the equator
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into the southern hemisphere. Yet the earth, with the exception of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: alteration in its convexity, in this part of Africa at least, seemed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have undergone no change of any very great importance. As far as the eye
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could reach, the shore was, as it had ever been, a succession of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cliffs, beach, and arid rocks, tinged with a red ferruginous hue. To
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the south--if south, in this inverted order of things, it might still
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be called--the face of the country also appeared unaltered, and some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: leagues away, the peaks of the Merdeyah mountains still retained their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accustomed outline.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Presently a rift in the clouds gave passage to an oblique ray of light
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that clearly proved that the sun was setting in the east.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, I am curious to know what they think of all this at Mostaganem,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: said the captain. "I wonder, too, what the Minister of War will say when
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he receives a telegram informing him that his African colony has become,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not morally, but physically disorganized; that the cardinal points
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are at variance with ordinary rules, and that the sun in the month of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: January is shining down vertically upon our heads."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof, whose ideas of discipline were extremely rigid, at once
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suggested that the colony should be put under the surveillance of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: police, that the cardinal points should be placed under restraint, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the sun should be shot for breach of discipline.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meantime, they were both advancing with the utmost speed. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: decompression of the atmosphere made the specific gravity of their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bodies extraordinarily light, and they ran like hares and leaped like
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: chamois. Leaving the devious windings of the footpath, they went as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a crow would fly across the country. Hedges, trees, and streams were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cleared at a bound, and under these conditions Ben Zoof felt that he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could have overstepped Montmartre at a single stride. The earth seemed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as elastic as the springboard of an acrobat; they scarcely touched it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with their feet, and their only fear was lest the height to which they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were propelled would consume the time which they were saving by their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: short cut across the fields.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was not long before their wild career brought them to the right bank
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the Shelif. Here they were compelled to stop, for not only had the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bridge completely disappeared, but the river itself no longer existed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Of the left bank there was not the slightest trace, and the right bank,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which on the previous evening had bounded the yellow stream, as it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: murmured peacefully along the fertile plain, had now become the shore of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a tumultuous ocean, its azure waters extending westwards far as the eye
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could reach, and annihilating the tract of country which had hitherto
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: formed the district of Mostaganem. The shore coincided exactly with what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had been the right bank of the Shelif, and in a slightly curved line
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ran north and south, whilst the adjacent groves and meadows all retained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their previous positions. But the river-bank had become the shore of an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unknown sea.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Eager to throw some light upon the mystery, Servadac hurriedly made his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: way through the oleander bushes that overhung the shore, took up some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: water in the hollow of his hand, and carried it to his lips. "Salt
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as brine!" he exclaimed, as soon as he had tasted it. "The sea has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: undoubtedly swallowed up all the western part of Algeria."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It will not last long, sir," said Ben Zoof. "It is, probably, only a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: severe flood."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain shook his head. "Worse than that, I fear, Ben Zoof," he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: replied with emotion. "It is a catastrophe that may have very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: serious consequences. What can have become of all my friends and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fellow-officers?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof was silent. Rarely had he seen his master so much agitated;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and though himself inclined to receive these phenomena with philosophic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: indifference, his notions of military duty caused his countenance to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reflect the captain's expression of amazement.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But there was little time for Servadac to examine the changes which a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: few hours had wrought. The sun had already reached the eastern horizon,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and just as though it were crossing the ecliptic under the tropics,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it sank like a cannon ball into the sea. Without any warning, day gave
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: place to night, and earth, sea, and sky were immediately wrapped in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: profound obscurity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER VI. THE CAPTAIN MAKES AN EXPLORATION
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hector Servadac was not the man to remain long unnerved by any untoward
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: event. It was part of his character to discover the why and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wherefore of everything that came under his observation, and he would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have faced a cannon ball the more unflinchingly from understanding the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dynamic force by which it was propelled. Such being his temperament, it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: may well be imagined that he was anxious not to remain long in ignorance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the cause of the phenomena which had been so startling in their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequences.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We must inquire into this to-morrow," he exclaimed, as darkness fell
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suddenly upon him. Then, after a pause, he added: "That is to say, if
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there is to be a to-morrow; for if I were to be put to the torture, I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could not tell what has become of the sun."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "May I ask, sir, what we are to do now?" put in Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Stay where we are for the present; and when daylight appears--if it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ever does appear--we will explore the coast to the west and south, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: return to the gourbi. If we can find out nothing else, we must at least
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discover where we are."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Meanwhile, sir, may we go to sleep?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Certainly, if you like, and if you can."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Nothing loath to avail himself of his master's permission, Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: crouched down in an angle of the shore, threw his arms over his eyes,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and very soon slept the sleep of the ignorant, which is often sounder
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than the sleep of the just. Overwhelmed by the questions that crowded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon his brain, Captain Servadac could only wander up and down the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shore. Again and again he asked himself what the catastrophe could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: portend. Had the towns of Algiers, Oran, and Mostaganem escaped the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inundation? Could he bring himself to believe that all the inhabitants,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his friends, and comrades had perished; or was it not more probable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the Mediterranean had merely invaded the region of the mouth of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Shelif? But this supposition did not in the least explain the other
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: physical disturbances. Another hypothesis that presented itself to his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mind was that the African coast might have been suddenly transported to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the equatorial zone. But although this might get over the difficulty
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the altered altitude of the sun and the absence of twilight, yet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it would neither account for the sun setting in the east, nor for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: length of the day being reduced to six hours.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We must wait till to-morrow," he repeated; adding, for he had become
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distrustful of the future, "that is to say, if to-morrow ever comes."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although not very learned in astronomy, Servadac was acquainted with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the position of the principal constellations. It was therefore a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: considerable disappointment to him that, in consequence of the heavy
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clouds, not a star was visible in the firmament. To have ascertained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the pole-star had become displaced would have been an undeniable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proof that the earth was revolving on a new axis; but not a rift
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appeared in the lowering clouds, which seemed to threaten torrents of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It happened that the moon was new on that very day; naturally,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: therefore, it would have set at the same time as the sun. What, then,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was the captain's bewilderment when, after he had been walking for about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an hour and a half, he noticed on the western horizon a strong glare
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that penetrated even the masses of the clouds.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The moon in the west!" he cried aloud; but suddenly bethinking himself,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he added: "But no, that cannot be the moon; unless she had shifted very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: much nearer the earth, she could never give a light as intense as this."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As he spoke the screen of vapor was illuminated to such a degree that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the whole country was as it were bathed in twilight. "What can this be?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: soliloquized the captain. "It cannot be the sun, for the sun set in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: east only an hour and a half ago. Would that those clouds would disclose
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what enormous luminary lies behind them! What a fool I was not to have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: learnt more astronomy! Perhaps, after all, I am racking my brain over
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: something that is quite in the ordinary course of nature."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But, reason as he might, the mysteries of the heavens still remained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impenetrable. For about an hour some luminous body, its disc evidently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of gigantic dimensions, shed its rays upon the upper strata of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clouds; then, marvelous to relate, instead of obeying the ordinary laws
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of celestial mechanism, and descending upon the opposite horizon, it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seemed to retreat farther off, grew dimmer, and vanished.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The darkness that returned to the face of the earth was not more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: profound than the gloom which fell upon the captain's soul. Everything
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was incomprehensible. The simplest mechanical rules seemed falsified;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the planets had defied the laws of gravitation; the motions of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: celestial spheres were erroneous as those of a watch with a defective
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mainspring, and there was reason to fear that the sun would never again
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shed his radiance upon the earth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But these last fears were groundless. In three hours' time, without any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: intervening twilight, the morning sun made its appearance in the west,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and day once more had dawned. On consulting his watch, Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: found that night had lasted precisely six hours. Ben Zoof, who was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unaccustomed to so brief a period of repose, was still slumbering
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: soundly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Come, wake up!" said Servadac, shaking him by the shoulder; "it is time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to start."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Time to start?" exclaimed Ben Zoof, rubbing his eyes. "I feel as if I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had only just gone to sleep."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You have slept all night, at any rate," replied the captain; "it has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only been for six hours, but you must make it enough."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Enough it shall be, sir," was the submissive rejoinder.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And now," continued Servadac, "we will take the shortest way back to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the gourbi, and see what our horses think about it all."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "They will think that they ought to be groomed," said the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very good; you may groom them and saddle them as quickly as you like.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I want to know what has become of the rest of Algeria: if we cannot get
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: round by the south to Mostaganem, we must go eastwards to Tenes." And
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: forthwith they started. Beginning to feel hungry, they had no hesitation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in gathering figs, dates, and oranges from the plantations that formed a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: continuous rich and luxuriant orchard along their path. The district was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quite deserted, and they had no reason to fear any legal penalty.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In an hour and a half they reached the gourbi. Everything was just as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they had left it, and it was evident that no one had visited the place
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: during their absence. All was desolate as the shore they had quitted.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The preparations for the expedition were brief and simple. Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: saddled the horses and filled his pouch with biscuits and game; water,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he felt certain, could be obtained in abundance from the numerous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: affluents of the Shelif, which, although they had now become tributaries
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the Mediterranean, still meandered through the plain. Captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac mounted his horse Zephyr, and Ben Zoof simultaneously got
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astride his mare Galette, named after the mill of Montmartre. They
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: galloped off in the direction of the Shelif, and were not long in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discovering that the diminution in the pressure of the atmosphere
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had precisely the same effect upon their horses as it had had upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: themselves. Their muscular strength seemed five times as great as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hitherto; their hoofs scarcely touched the ground, and they seemed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: transformed from ordinary quadrupeds into veritable hippogriffs.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Happily, Servadac and his orderly were fearless riders; they made no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attempt to curb their steeds, but even urged them to still greater
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exertions. Twenty minutes sufficed to carry them over the four or five
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles that intervened between the gourbi and the mouth of the Shelif;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: then, slackening their speed, they proceeded at a more leisurely pace to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the southeast, along what had once been the right bank of the river, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which, although it still retained its former characteristics, was now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the boundary of a sea, which extending farther than the limits of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: horizon, must have swallowed up at least a large portion of the province
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Oran. Captain Servadac knew the country well; he had at one time been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: engaged upon a trigonometrical survey of the district, and consequently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had an accurate knowledge of its topography. His idea now was to draw up
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a report of his investigations: to whom that report should be delivered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was a problem he had yet to solve.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: During the four hours of daylight that still remained, the travelers
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rode about twenty-one miles from the river mouth. To their vast
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surprise, they did not meet a single human being. At nightfall they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: again encamped in a slight bend of the shore, at a point which on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: previous evening had faced the mouth of the Mina, one of the left-hand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: affluents of the Shelif, but now absorbed into the newly revealed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ocean. Ben Zoof made the sleeping accommodation as comfortable as the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumstances would allow; the horses were clogged and turned out to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: feed upon the rich pasture that clothed the shore, and the night passed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: without special incident.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At sunrise on the following morning, the 2nd of January, or what,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: according to the ordinary calendar, would have been the night of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 1st, the captain and his orderly remounted their horses, and during the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: six-hours' day accomplished a distance of forty-two miles. The right
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bank of the river still continued to be the margin of the land, and only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in one spot had its integrity been impaired. This was about twelve miles
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the Mina, and on the site of the annex or suburb of Surkelmittoo.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Here a large portion of the bank had been swept away, and the hamlet,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with its eight hundred inhabitants, had no doubt been swallowed up by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the encroaching waters. It seemed, therefore, more than probable that a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: similar fate had overtaken the larger towns beyond the Shelif.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In the evening the explorers encamped, as previously, in a nook of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shore which here abruptly terminated their new domain, not far from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: where they might have expected to find the important village of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Memounturroy; but of this, too, there was now no trace. "I had quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reckoned upon a supper and a bed at Orleansville to-night," said
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, as, full of despondency, he surveyed the waste of water.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Quite impossible," replied Ben Zoof, "except you had gone by a boat.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But cheer up, sir, cheer up; we will soon devise some means for getting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: across to Mostaganem."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "If, as I hope," rejoined the captain, "we are on a peninsula, we are
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more likely to get to Tenes; there we shall hear the news."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Far more likely to carry the news ourselves," answered Ben Zoof, as he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: threw himself down for his night's rest.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Six hours later, only waiting for sunrise, Captain Servadac set himself
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in movement again to renew his investigations. At this spot the shore,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that hitherto had been running in a southeasterly direction, turned
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abruptly to the north, being no longer formed by the natural bank of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Shelif, but consisting of an absolutely new coast-line. No land was in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sight. Nothing could be seen of Orleansville, which ought to have been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: about six miles to the southwest; and Ben Zoof, who had mounted the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: highest point of view attainable, could distinguish sea, and nothing but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea, to the farthest horizon.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Quitting their encampment and riding on, the bewildered explorers kept
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: close to the new shore. This, since it had ceased to be formed by the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: original river bank, had considerably altered its aspect. Frequent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: landslips occurred, and in many places deep chasms rifted the ground;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: great gaps furrowed the fields, and trees, half uprooted, overhung the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: water, remarkable by the fantastic distortions of their gnarled trunks,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: looking as though they had been chopped by a hatchet.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The sinuosities of the coast line, alternately gully and headland,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had the effect of making a devious progress for the travelers, and at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sunset, although they had accomplished more than twenty miles, they had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only just arrived at the foot of the Merdeyah Mountains, which, before
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the cataclysm, had formed the extremity of the chain of the Little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Atlas. The ridge, however, had been violently ruptured, and now rose
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perpendicularly from the water.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the following morning Servadac and Ben Zoof traversed one of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mountain gorges; and next, in order to make a more thorough acquaintance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the limits and condition of the section of Algerian territory of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which they seemed to be left as the sole occupants, they dismounted, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proceeded on foot to the summit of one of the highest peaks. From this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elevation they ascertained that from the base of the Merdeyah to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mediterranean, a distance of about eighteen miles, a new coast line had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: come into existence; no land was visible in any direction; no isthmus
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: existed to form a connecting link with the territory of Tenes, which had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entirely disappeared. The result was that Captain Servadac was driven
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the irresistible conclusion that the tract of land which he had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surveying was not, as he had at first imagined, a peninsula; it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: actually an island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Strictly speaking, this island was quadrilateral, but the sides were so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irregular that it was much more nearly a triangle, the comparison of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sides exhibiting these proportions: The section of the right bank of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Shelif, seventy-two miles; the southern boundary from the Shelif to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: chain of the Little Atlas, twenty-one miles; from the Little Atlas to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Mediterranean, eighteen miles; and sixty miles of the shore of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mediterranean itself, making in all an entire circumference of about 171
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What does it all mean?" exclaimed the captain, every hour growing more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and more bewildered.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The will of Providence, and we must submit," replied Ben Zoof, calm and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: undisturbed. With this reflection, the two men silently descended the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mountain and remounted their horses. Before evening they had reached
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Mediterranean. On their road they failed to discern a vestige of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little town of Montenotte; like Tenes, of which not so much as a ruined
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cottage was visible on the horizon, it seemed to be annihilated.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the following day, the 6th of January, the two men made a forced
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: march along the coast of the Mediterranean, which they found less
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: altered than the captain had at first supposed; but four villages had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entirely disappeared, and the headlands, unable to resist the shock of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the convulsion, had been detached from the mainland.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The circuit of the island had been now completed, and the explorers,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: after a period of sixty hours, found themselves once more beside the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ruins of their gourbi. Five days, or what, according to the established
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: order of things, would have been two days and a half, had been occupied
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in tracing the boundaries of their new domain; and they had ascertained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beyond a doubt that they were the sole human inhabitants left upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, sir, here you are, Governor General of Algeria!" exclaimed Ben
