title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof, as they reached the gourbi.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "With not a soul to govern," gloomily rejoined the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How so? Do you not reckon me?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Pshaw! Ben Zoof, what are you?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What am I? Why, I am the population."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain deigned no reply, but, muttering some expressions of regret
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for the fruitless trouble he had taken about his rondo, betook himself
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to rest.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER VII. BEN ZOOF WATCHES IN VAIN
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In a few minutes the governor general and his population were asleep.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The gourbi being in ruins, they were obliged to put up with the best
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accommodation they could find in the adjacent erection. It must be owned
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the captain's slumbers were by no means sound; he was agitated by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the consciousness that he had hitherto been unable to account for his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: strange experiences by any reasonable theory. Though far from being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: advanced in the knowledge of natural philosophy, he had been instructed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to a certain degree, in its elementary principles; and, by an effort
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of memory, he managed to recall some general laws which he had almost
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: forgotten. He could understand that an altered inclination of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth's axis with regard to the ecliptic would introduce a change of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: position in the cardinal points, and bring about a displacement of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the sea; but the hypothesis entirely failed to account, either for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shortening of the days, or for the diminution in the pressure of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: atmosphere. He felt that his judgment was utterly baffled; his only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remaining hope was that the chain of marvels was not yet complete, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that something farther might throw some light upon the mystery.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof's first care on the following morning was to provide a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: good breakfast. To use his own phrase, he was as hungry as the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whole population of three million Algerians, of whom he was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: representative, and he must have enough to eat. The catastrophe which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had overwhelmed the country had left a dozen eggs uninjured, and upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: these, with a good dish of his famous couscous, he hoped that he and his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: master might have a sufficiently substantial meal. The stove was ready
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for use, the copper skillet was as bright as hands could make it, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the beads of condensed steam upon the surface of a large stone al-caraza
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gave evidence that it was supplied with water. Ben Zoof at once lighted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a fire, singing all the time, according to his wont, a snatch of an old
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: military refrain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ever on the lookout for fresh phenomena, Captain Servadac watched the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: preparations with a curious eye. It struck him that perhaps the air,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in its strangely modified condition, would fail to supply sufficient
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: oxygen, and that the stove, in consequence, might not fulfill its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: function. But no; the fire was lighted just as usual, and fanned into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vigor by Ben Zoof applying his mouth in lieu of bellows, and a bright
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: flame started up from the midst of the twigs and coal. The skillet was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: duly set upon the stove, and Ben Zoof was prepared to wait awhile for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the water to boil. Taking up the eggs, he was surprised to notice that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they hardly weighed more than they would if they had been mere shells;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but he was still more surprised when he saw that before the water had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been two minutes over the fire it was at full boil.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "By jingo!" he exclaimed, "a precious hot fire!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac reflected. "It cannot be that the fire is hotter," he said,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "the peculiarity must be in the water." And taking down a centigrade
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thermometer, which hung upon the wall, he plunged it into the skillet.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Instead of 100 degrees, the instrument registered only 66 degrees.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Take my advice, Ben Zoof," he said; "leave your eggs in the saucepan a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: good quarter of an hour."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Boil them hard! That will never do," objected the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You will not find them hard, my good fellow. Trust me, we shall be able
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to dip our sippets into the yolks easily enough."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain was quite right in his conjecture, that this new phenomenon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was caused by a diminution in the pressure of the atmosphere. Water
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: boiling at a temperature of 66 degrees was itself an evidence that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: column of air above the earth's surface had become reduced by one-third
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of its altitude. The identical phenomenon would have occurred at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the summit of a mountain 35,000 feet high; and had Servadac been in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: possession of a barometer, he would have immediately discovered the fact
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that only now for the first time, as the result of experiment, revealed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: itself to him--a fact, moreover, which accounted for the compression of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the blood-vessels which both he and Ben Zoof had experienced, as well
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as for the attenuation of their voices and their accelerated breathing.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And yet," he argued with himself, "if our encampment has been projected
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to so great an elevation, how is it that the sea remains at its proper
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: level?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Once again Hector Servadac, though capable of tracing consequences, felt
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself totally at a loss to comprehend their cause; hence his agitation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and bewilderment!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After their prolonged immersion in the boiling water, the eggs were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: found to be only just sufficiently cooked; the couscous was very much in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the same condition; and Ben Zoof came to the conclusion that in future
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he must be careful to commence his culinary operations an hour earlier.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He was rejoiced at last to help his master, who, in spite of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perplexed preoccupation, seemed to have a very fair appetite for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: breakfast.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, captain?" said Ben Zoof presently, such being his ordinary way of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: opening conversation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, Ben Zoof?" was the captain's invariable response to his servant's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: formula.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What are we to do now, sir?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We can only for the present wait patiently where we are. We are
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: encamped upon an island, and therefore we can only be rescued by sea."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But do you suppose that any of our friends are still alive?" asked Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh, I think we must indulge the hope that this catastrophe has not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extended far. We must trust that it has limited its mischief to some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: small portion of the Algerian coast, and that our friends are all alive
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and well. No doubt the governor general will be anxious to investigate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the full extent of the damage, and will send a vessel from Algiers to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: explore. It is not likely that we shall be forgotten. What, then, you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have to do, Ben Zoof, is to keep a sharp lookout, and to be ready, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: case a vessel should appear, to make signals at once."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But if no vessel should appear!" sighed the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then we must build a boat, and go in search of those who do not come in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: search of us."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very good. But what sort of a sailor are you?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Everyone can be a sailor when he must," said Servadac calmly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof said no more. For several succeeding days he scanned the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: horizon unintermittently with his telescope. His watching was in vain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: No ship appeared upon the desert sea. "By the name of a Kabyle!" he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: broke out impatiently, "his Excellency is grossly negligent!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although the days and nights had become reduced from twenty-four hours
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to twelve, Captain Servadac would not accept the new condition of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: things, but resolved to adhere to the computations of the old calendar.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Notwithstanding, therefore, that the sun had risen and set twelve times
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: since the commencement of the new year, he persisted in calling the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: following day the 6th of January. His watch enabled him to keep an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accurate account of the passing hours.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In the course of his life, Ben Zoof had read a few books. After
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pondering one day, he said: "It seems to me, captain, that you have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: turned into Robinson Crusoe, and that I am your man Friday. I hope I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have not become a negro."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No," replied the captain. "Your complexion isn't the fairest in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: world, but you are not black yet."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, I had much sooner be a white Friday than a black one," rejoined
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Still no ship appeared; and Captain Servadac, after the example of all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: previous Crusoes, began to consider it advisable to investigate the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: resources of his domain. The new territory of which he had become the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: monarch he named Gourbi Island. It had a superficial area of about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nine hundred square miles. Bullocks, cows, goats, and sheep existed in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: considerable numbers; and as there seemed already to be an abundance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of game, it was hardly likely that a future supply would fail them. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: condition of the cereals was such as to promise a fine ingathering of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wheat, maize, and rice; so that for the governor and his population,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with their two horses, not only was there ample provision, but even if
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: other human inhabitants besides themselves should yet be discovered,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there was not the remotest prospect of any of them perishing by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: starvation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: From the 6th to the 13th of January the rain came down in torrents; and,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what was quite an unusual occurrence at this season of the year, several
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: heavy storms broke over the island. In spite, however, of the continual
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: downfall, the heavens still remained veiled in cloud. Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moreover, did not fail to observe that for the season the temperature
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was unusually high; and, as a matter still more surprising, that it kept
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: steadily increasing, as though the earth were gradually and continuously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approximating to the sun. In proportion to the rise of temperature, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: light also assumed greater intensity; and if it had not been for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the screen of vapor interposed between the sky and the island, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irradiation which would have illumined all terrestrial objects would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have been vivid beyond all precedent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But neither sun, moon, nor star ever appeared; and Servadac's irritation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and annoyance at being unable to identify any one point of the firmament
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: may be more readily imagined than described. On one occasion Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: endeavored to mitigate his master's impatience by exhorting him to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: assume the resignation, even if he did not feel the indifference, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he himself experienced; but his advice was received with so angry a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rebuff that he retired in all haste, abashed, to resume his watchman's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: duty, which he performed with exemplary perseverance. Day and night,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the shortest possible intervals of rest, despite wind, rain, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: storm, he mounted guard upon the cliff--but all in vain. Not a speck
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appeared upon the desolate horizon. To say the truth, no vessel could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have stood against the weather. The hurricane raged with tremendous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fury, and the waves rose to a height that seemed to defy calculation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Never, even in the second era of creation, when, under the influence of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: internal heat, the waters rose in vapor to descend in deluge back upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the world, could meteorological phenomena have been developed with more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impressive intensity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But by the night of the 13th the tempest appeared to have spent its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fury; the wind dropped; the rain ceased as if by a spell; and Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: who for the last six days had confined himself to the shelter of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: roof, hastened to join Ben Zoof at his post upon the cliff. Now, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thought, there might be a chance of solving his perplexity; perhaps now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the huge disc, of which he had had an imperfect glimpse on the night of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the 31st of December, might again reveal itself; at any rate, he hoped
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for an opportunity of observing the constellations in a clear firmament
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: above.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The night was magnificent. Not a cloud dimmed the luster of the stars,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which spangled the heavens in surpassing brilliancy, and several nebulae
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which hitherto no astronomer had been able to discern without the aid of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a telescope were clearly visible to the naked eye.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: By a natural impulse, Servadac's first thought was to observe the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: position of the pole-star. It was in sight, but so near to the horizon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as to suggest the utter impossibility of its being any longer the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: central pivot of the sidereal system; it occupied a position through
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which it was out of the question that the axis of the earth indefinitely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prolonged could ever pass. In his impression he was more thoroughly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: confirmed when, an hour later, he noticed that the star had approached
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: still nearer the horizon, as though it had belonged to one of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: zodiacal constellations.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The pole-star being manifestly thus displaced, it remained to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discovered whether any other of the celestial bodies had become a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fixed center around which the constellations made their apparent daily
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revolutions. To the solution of this problem Servadac applied himself
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the most thoughtful diligence. After patient observation, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: satisfied himself that the required conditions were answered by a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certain star that was stationary not far from the horizon. This
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was Vega, in the constellation Lyra, a star which, according to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: precession of the equinoxes, will take the place of our pole-star 12,000
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: years hence. The most daring imagination could not suppose that a period
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of 12,000 years had been crowded into the space of a fortnight; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: therefore the captain came, as to an easier conclusion, to the opinion
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the earth's axis had been suddenly and immensely shifted; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the fact that the axis, if produced, would pass through a point
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so little removed above the horizon, he deduced the inference that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mediterranean must have been transported to the equator.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lost in bewildering maze of thought, he gazed long and intently upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: heavens. His eyes wandered from where the tail of the Great Bear, now a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: zodiacal constellation, was scarcely visible above the waters, to where
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the stars of the southern hemisphere were just breaking on his view. A
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cry from Ben Zoof recalled him to himself.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The moon!" shouted the orderly, as though overjoyed at once again
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beholding what the poet has called:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The kind companion of terrestrial night;"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and he pointed to a disc that was rising at a spot precisely opposite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the place where they would have expected to see the sun. "The moon!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: again he cried.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But Captain Servadac could not altogether enter into his servant's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enthusiasm. If this were actually the moon, her distance from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth must have been increased by some millions of miles. He was rather
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disposed to suspect that it was not the earth's satellite at all,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but some planet with its apparent magnitude greatly enlarged by its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approximation to the earth. Taking up the powerful field-glass which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he was accustomed to use in his surveying operations, he proceeded to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: investigate more carefully the luminous orb. But he failed to trace
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any of the lineaments, supposed to resemble a human face, that mark the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lunar surface; he failed to decipher any indications of hill and plain;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nor could he make out the aureole of light which emanates from what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astronomers have designated Mount Tycho. "It is not the moon," he said
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: slowly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Not the moon?" cried Ben Zoof. "Why not?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It is not the moon," again affirmed the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why not?" repeated Ben Zoof, unwilling to renounce his first
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impression.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Because there is a small satellite in attendance." And the captain drew
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his servant's attention to a bright speck, apparently about the size of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: one of Jupiter's satellites seen through a moderate telescope, that was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clearly visible just within the focus of his glass.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Here, then, was a fresh mystery. The orbit of this planet was assuredly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: interior to the orbit of the earth, because it accompanied the sun
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in its apparent motion; yet it was neither Mercury nor Venus, because
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: neither one nor the other of these has any satellite at all.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain stamped and stamped again with mingled vexation, agitation,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and bewilderment. "Confound it!" he cried, "if this is neither Venus nor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mercury, it must be the moon; but if it is the moon, whence, in the name
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of all the gods, has she picked up another moon for herself?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain was in dire perplexity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER VIII. VENUS IN PERILOUS PROXIMITY
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The light of the returning sun soon extinguished the glory of the stars,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and rendered it necessary for the captain to postpone his observations.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He had sought in vain for further trace of the huge disc that had so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: excited his wonder on the 1st, and it seemed most probable that, in its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irregular orbit, it had been carried beyond the range of vision.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The weather was still superb. The wind, after veering to the west, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sunk to a perfect calm. Pursuing its inverted course, the sun rose and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: set with undeviating regularity; and the days and nights were still
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: divided into periods of precisely six hours each--a sure proof that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sun remained close to the new equator which manifestly passed through
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gourbi Island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meanwhile the temperature was steadily increasing. The captain kept his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thermometer close at hand where he could repeatedly consult it, and on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the 15th he found that it registered 50 degrees centigrade in the shade.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: No attempt had been made to rebuild the gourbi, but the captain and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof managed to make up quarters sufficiently comfortable in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: principal apartment of the adjoining structure, where the stone walls,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that at first afforded a refuge from the torrents of rain, now formed an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: equally acceptable shelter from the burning sun. The heat was becoming
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: insufferable, surpassing the heat of Senegal and other equatorial
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: regions; not a cloud ever tempered the intensity of the solar rays;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and unless some modification ensued, it seemed inevitable that all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vegetation should become scorched and burnt off from the face of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In spite, however, of the profuse perspirations from which he suffered,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof, constant to his principles, expressed no surprise at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unwonted heat. No remonstrances from his master could induce him to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abandon his watch from the cliff. To withstand the vertical beams of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that noontide sun would seem to require a skin of brass and a brain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of adamant; but yet, hour after hour, he would remain conscientiously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scanning the surface of the Mediterranean, which, calm and deserted, lay
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: outstretched before him. On one occasion, Servadac, in reference to his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: orderly's indomitable perseverance, happened to remark that he thought
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he must have been born in the heart of equatorial Africa; to which Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof replied, with the utmost dignity, that he was born at Montmartre,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which was all the same. The worthy fellow was unwilling to own that,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: even in the matter of heat, the tropics could in any way surpass his own
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: much-loved home.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This unprecedented temperature very soon began to take effect upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: products of the soil. The sap rose rapidly in the trees, so that in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: course of a few days buds, leaves, flowers, and fruit had come to full
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: maturity. It was the same with the cereals; wheat and maize sprouted and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ripened as if by magic, and for a while a rank and luxuriant pasturage
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clothed the meadows. Summer and autumn seemed blended into one. If
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac had been more deeply versed in astronomy, he would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perhaps have been able to bring to bear his knowledge that if the axis
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the earth, as everything seemed to indicate, now formed a right angle
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the plane of the ecliptic, her various seasons, like those of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: planet Jupiter, would become limited to certain zones, in which they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would remain invariable. But even if he had understood the _rationale_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the change, the convulsion that had brought it about would have been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as much a mystery as ever.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The precocity of vegetation caused some embarrassment. The time for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the corn and fruit harvest had fallen simultaneously with that of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: haymaking; and as the extreme heat precluded any prolonged exertions,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it was evident "the population" of the island would find it difficult to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: provide the necessary amount of labor. Not that the prospect gave
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them much concern: the provisions of the gourbi were still far from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exhausted, and now that the roughness of the weather had so happily
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: subsided, they had every encouragement to hope that a ship of some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sort would soon appear. Not only was that part of the Mediterranean
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: systematically frequented by the government steamers that watched the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast, but vessels of all nations were constantly cruising off the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shore.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In spite, however, of all their sanguine speculations, no ship appeared.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof admitted the necessity of extemporizing a kind of parasol for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself, otherwise he must literally have been roasted to death upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exposed summit of the cliff.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meanwhile, Servadac was doing his utmost--it must be acknowledged, with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: indifferent success--to recall the lessons of his school-days. He would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: plunge into the wildest speculations in his endeavors to unravel
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the difficulties of the new situation, and struggled into a kind of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conviction that if there had been a change of manner in the earth's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rotation on her axis, there would be a corresponding change in her
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revolution round the sun, which would involve the consequence of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: length of the year being either diminished or increased.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Independently of the increased and increasing heat, there was another
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very conclusive demonstration that the earth had thus suddenly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approximated towards the sun. The diameter of the solar disc was now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exactly twice what it ordinarily looks to the naked eye; in fact, it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: precisely such as it would appear to an observer on the surface of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: planet Venus. The most obvious inference would therefore be that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth's distance from the sun had been diminished from 91,000,000 to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 66,000,000 miles. If the just equilibrium of the earth had thus been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: destroyed, and should this diminution of distance still continue, would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there not be reason to fear that the terrestrial world would be carried
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: onwards to actual contact with the sun, which must result in its total
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: annihilation?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The continuance of the splendid weather afforded Servadac every facility
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for observing the heavens. Night after night, constellations in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their beauty lay stretched before his eyes--an alphabet which, to his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mortification, not to say his rage, he was unable to decipher. In the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: apparent dimensions of the fixed stars, in their distance, in their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: relative position with regard to each other, he could observe no change.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although it is established that our sun is approaching the constellation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Hercules at the rate of more than 126,000,000 miles a year, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: although Arcturus is traveling through space at the rate of fifty-four
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles a second--three times faster than the earth goes round the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sun,--yet such is the remoteness of those stars that no appreciable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: change is evident to the senses. The fixed stars taught him nothing.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Far otherwise was it with the planets. The orbits of Venus and Mercury
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are within the orbit of the earth, Venus rotating at an average distance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of 66,130,000 miles from the sun, and Mercury at that of 35,393,000.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After pondering long, and as profoundly as he could, upon these figures,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac came to the conclusion that, as the earth was now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: receiving about double the amount of light and heat that it had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: receiving before the catastrophe, it was receiving about the same as the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: planet Venus; he was driven, therefore, to the estimate of the measure
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in which the earth must have approximated to the sun, a deduction in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which he was confirmed when the opportunity came for him to observe
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Venus herself in the splendid proportions that she now assumed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: That magnificent planet which--as Phosphorus or Lucifer, Hesperus or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Vesper, the evening star, the morning star, or the shepherd's star--has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: never failed to attract the rapturous admiration of the most indifferent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observers, here revealed herself with unprecedented glory, exhibiting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all the phases of a lustrous moon in miniature. Various indentations in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the outline of its crescent showed that the solar beams were refracted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into regions of its surface where the sun had already set, and proved,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beyond a doubt, that the planet had an atmosphere of her own; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certain luminous points projecting from the crescent as plainly marked
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the existence of mountains. As the result of Servadac's computations, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: formed the opinion that Venus could hardly be at a greater distance than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 6,000,000 miles from the earth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And a very safe distance, too," said Ben Zoof, when his master told him
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the conclusion at which he had arrived.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "All very well for two armies, but for a couple of planets not quite so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: safe, perhaps, as you may imagine. It is my impression that it is more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than likely we may run foul of Venus," said the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Plenty of air and water there, sir?" inquired the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes; as far as I can tell, plenty," replied Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then why shouldn't we go and visit Venus?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac did his best to explain that as the two planets were of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: about equal volume, and were traveling with great velocity in opposite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: directions, any collision between them must be attended with the most
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disastrous consequences to one or both of them. But Ben Zoof failed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: see that, even at the worst, the catastrophe could be much more serious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than the collision of two railway trains.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain became exasperated. "You idiot!" he angrily exclaimed;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "cannot you understand that the planets are traveling a thousand times
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: faster than the fastest express, and that if they meet, either one
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: or the other must be destroyed? What would become of your darling
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Montmartre then?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain had touched a tender chord. For a moment Ben Zoof stood with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clenched teeth and contracted muscles; then, in a voice of real concern,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he inquired whether anything could be done to avert the calamity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nothing whatever; so you may go about your own business," was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain's brusque rejoinder.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: All discomfited and bewildered, Ben Zoof retired without a word.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: During the ensuing days the distance between the two planets continued
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to decrease, and it became more and more obvious that the earth, on her
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: new orbit, was about to cross the orbit of Venus. Throughout this time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth had been making a perceptible approach towards Mercury, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that planet--which is rarely visible to the naked eye, and then only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at what are termed the periods of its greatest eastern and western
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elongations--now appeared in all its splendor. It amply justified the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: epithet of "sparkling" which the ancients were accustomed to confer
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon it, and could scarcely fail to awaken a new interest. The periodic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: recurrence of its phases; its reflection of the sun's rays, shedding
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon it a light and a heat seven times greater than that received by the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth; its glacial and its torrid zones, which, on account of the great
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inclination of the axis, are scarcely separable; its equatorial bands;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its mountains eleven miles high;--were all subjects of observation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: worthy of the most studious regard.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But no danger was to be apprehended from Mercury; with Venus only did
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: collision appear imminent. By the 18th of January the distance between
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that planet and the earth had become reduced to between two and three
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: millions of miles, and the intensity of its light cast heavy shadows
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from all terrestrial objects. It might be observed to turn upon its own
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: axis in twenty-three hours twenty-one minutes--an evidence, from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unaltered duration of its days, that the planet had not shared in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disturbance. On its disc the clouds formed from its atmospheric vapor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were plainly perceptible, as also were the seven spots, which, according
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to Bianchini, are a chain of seas. It was now visible in broad daylight.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Buonaparte, when under the Directory, once had his attention called to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Venus at noon, and immediately hailed it joyfully, recognizing it as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his own peculiar star in the ascendant. Captain Servadac, it may well be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: imagined, did not experience the same gratifying emotion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 20th, the distance between the two bodies had again sensibly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diminished. The captain had ceased to be surprised that no vessel
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had been sent to rescue himself and his companion from their strange
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: imprisonment; the governor general and the minister of war were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: doubtless far differently occupied, and their interests far otherwise
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: engrossed. What sensational articles, he thought, must now be teeming to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the newspapers! What crowds must be flocking to the churches! The end
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the world approaching! the great climax close at hand! Two days more,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the earth, shivered into a myriad atoms, would be lost in boundless
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: space!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: These dire forebodings, however, were not destined to be realized.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gradually the distance between the two planets began to increase; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: planes of their orbits did not coincide, and accordingly the dreaded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: catastrophe did not ensue. By the 25th, Venus was sufficiently remote to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: preclude any further fear of collision. Ben Zoof gave a sigh of relief
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: when the captain communicated the glad intelligence.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Their proximity to Venus had been close enough to demonstrate that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beyond a doubt that planet has no moon or satellite such as Cassini,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Short, Montaigne of Limoges, Montbarron, and some other astronomers have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: imagined to exist. "Had there been such a satellite," said Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "we might have captured it in passing. But what can be the meaning," he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: added seriously, "of all this displacement of the heavenly bodies?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What is that great building at Paris, captain, with a top like a cap?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: asked Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Do you mean the Observatory?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, the Observatory. Are there not people living in the Observatory
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: who could explain all this?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very likely; but what of that?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Let us be philosophers, and wait patiently until we can hear their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: explanation."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac smiled. "Do you know what it is to be a philosopher, Ben Zoof?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he asked.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am a soldier, sir," was the servant's prompt rejoinder, "and I have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: learnt to know that 'what can't be cured must be endured.'"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain made no reply, but for a time, at least, he desisted from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: puzzling himself over matters which he felt he was utterly incompetent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to explain. But an event soon afterwards occurred which awakened his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: keenest interest.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deliberately into his master's apartment, and, in reply to a question as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to what he wanted, announced with the utmost composure that a ship was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in sight.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you donkey! you speak as unconcernedly as though you were telling me
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that my dinner was ready."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the cliff. It was quite true that a vessel was in sight, hardly more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than six miles from the shore; but owing to the increase in the earth's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: convexity, and the consequent limitation of the range of vision, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rigging of the topmasts alone was visible above the water. This was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: "The _Dobryna_!" exclaimed Servadac, keeping his eye unmoved at his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: telescope.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The _Dobryna_!" repeated the captain, positively. "She is under sail;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but she is Count Timascheff's yacht."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He was right. If the count were on board, a strange fatality was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bringing him to the presence of his rival. But no longer now could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac regard him in the light of an adversary; circumstances had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: changed, and all animosity was absorbed in the eagerness with which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he hailed the prospect of obtaining some information about the recent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: startling and inexplicable events. During the twenty-seven days that she
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and accordingly would convey to Gourbi Island some intelligence from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: one or other of those countries. He reckoned, therefore, not only upon

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: rescue of himself and his orderly.
