author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: They were not long in ascertaining that on the farther side of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: its waters.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whilst examining the rocky shore, the captain observed, to his great
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surprise, long and well-defined rows of seaweed, which undoubtedly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: betokened that there had been a very considerable ebb and flow of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: waters--a thing unknown in the Mediterranean, where there is scarcely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any perceptible tide. What, however, seemed most remarkable, was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: manifest evidence that ever since the highest flood (which was caused,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in all probability, by the proximity of the body of which the huge
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disc had been so conspicuous on the night of the 31st of December) the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: phenomenon had been gradually lessening, and in fact was now reduced to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the normal limits which had characterized it before the convulsion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without doing more than note the circumstance, Servadac turned his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entire attention to the _Dobryna_, which, now little more than a mile
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from shore, could not fail to see and understand his signals. Slightly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: changing her course, she first struck her mainsail, and, in order to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: facilitate the movements of her helmsman, soon carried nothing but her
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: two topsails, brigantine and jib. After rounding the peak, she steered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: direct for the channel to which Servadac by his gestures was pointing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her, and was not long in entering the creek. As soon as the anchor,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: imbedded in the sandy bottom, had made good its hold, a boat was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lowered. In a few minutes more Count Timascheff had landed on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island. Captain Servadac hastened towards him.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "First of all, count," he exclaimed impetuously, "before we speak one
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: other word, tell me what has happened."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count, whose imperturbable composure presented a singular contrast
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the French officer's enthusiastic vivacity, made a stiff bow, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in his Russian accent replied: "First of all, permit me to express my
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surprise at seeing you here. I left you on a continent, and here I have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the honor of finding you on an island."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I assure you, count, I have never left the place."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am quite aware of it. Captain Servadac, and I now beg to offer you my
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sincere apologies for failing to keep my appointment with you."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Never mind, now," interposed the captain; "we will talk of that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by-and-by. First, tell me what has happened."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The very question I was about to put to you, Captain Servadac."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Do you mean to say you know nothing of the cause, and can tell me
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nothing of the extent, of the catastrophe which has transformed this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: part of Africa into an island?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nothing more than you know yourself."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But surely, Count Timascheff, you can inform me whether upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: northern shore of the Mediterranean--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Are you certain that this is the Mediterranean?" asked the count
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: significantly, and added, "I have discovered no sign of land."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain stared in silent bewilderment. For some moments he seemed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perfectly stupefied; then, recovering himself, he began to overwhelm the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: count with a torrent of questions. Had he noticed, ever since the 1st
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of January, that the sun had risen in the west? Had he noticed that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: days had been only six hours long, and that the weight of the atmosphere
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was so much diminished? Had he observed that the moon had quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disappeared, and that the earth had been in imminent hazard of running
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: foul of the planet Venus? Was he aware, in short, that the entire
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: motions of the terrestrial sphere had undergone a complete modification?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To all these inquiries, the count responded in the affirmative. He
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was acquainted with everything that had transpired; but, to Servadac's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: increasing astonishment, he could throw no light upon the cause of any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the phenomena.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "On the night of the 31st of December," he said, "I was proceeding by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea to our appointed place of meeting, when my yacht was suddenly caught
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: on the crest of an enormous wave, and carried to a height which it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is beyond my power to estimate. Some mysterious force seemed to have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brought about a convulsion of the elements. Our engine was damaged, nay
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disabled, and we drifted entirely at the mercy of the terrible hurricane
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that raged during the succeeding days. That the _Dobryna_ escaped at all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is little less than a miracle, and I can only attribute her safety
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the fact that she occupied the center of the vast cyclone, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequently did not experience much change of position."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He paused, and added: "Your island is the first land we have seen."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then let us put out to sea at once and ascertain the extent of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disaster," cried the captain, eagerly. "You will take me on board,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: count, will you not?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "My yacht is at your service, sir, even should you require to make a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tour round the world."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A tour round the Mediterranean will suffice for the present, I think,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: said the captain, smiling.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count shook his head.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am not sure," said he, "but what the tour of the Mediterranean will
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prove to be the tour of the world."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac made no reply, but for a time remained silent and absorbed in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thought.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After the silence was broken, they consulted as to what course was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: best to pursue; and the plan they proposed was, in the first place, to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discover how much of the African coast still remained, and to carry on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the tidings of their own experiences to Algiers; or, in the event of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: southern shore having actually disappeared, they would make their way
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: northwards and put themselves in communication with the population on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the river banks of Europe.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Before starting, it was indispensable that the engine of the _Dobryna_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should be repaired: to sail under canvas only would in contrary winds
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and rough seas be both tedious and difficult. The stock of coal on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: board was adequate for two months' consumption; but as it would at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the expiration of that time be exhausted, it was obviously the part
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of prudence to employ it in reaching a port where fuel could be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: replenished.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The damage sustained by the engine proved to be not very serious; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in three days after her arrival the _Dobryna_ was again ready to put to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac employed the interval in making the count acquainted with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all he knew about his small domain. They made an entire circuit of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the island, and both agreed that it must be beyond the limits of that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumscribed territory that they must seek an explanation of what had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so strangely transpired.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was on the last day of January that the repairs of the schooner were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: completed. A slight diminution in the excessively high temperature which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had prevailed for the last few weeks, was the only apparent change in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the general order of things; but whether this was to be attributed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any alteration in the earth's orbit was a question which would still
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: require several days to decide. The weather remained fine, and although
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a few clouds had accumulated, and might have caused a trifling fall
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the barometer, they were not sufficiently threatening to delay the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: departure of the _Dobryna_.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Doubts now arose, and some discussion followed, whether or not it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: desirable for Ben Zoof to accompany his master. There were various
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reasons why he should be left behind, not the least important being that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the schooner had no accommodation for horses, and the orderly would have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: found it hard to part with Zephyr, and much more with his own favorite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Galette; besides, it was advisable that there should be some one left to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: receive any strangers that might possibly arrive, as well as to keep an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eye upon the herds of cattle which, in the dubious prospect before them,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: might prove to be the sole resource of the survivors of the catastrophe.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Altogether, taking into consideration that the brave fellow would incur
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no personal risk by remaining upon the island, the captain was induced
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with much reluctance to forego the attendance of his servant, hoping
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very shortly to return and to restore him to his country, when he had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ascertained the reason of the mysteries in which they were enveloped.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 31st, then, Ben Zoof was "invested with governor's powers," and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: took an affecting leave of his master, begging him, if chance should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carry him near Montmartre, to ascertain whether the beloved "mountain"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had been left unmoved.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Farewells over, the _Dobryna_ was carefully steered through the creek,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and was soon upon the open sea.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER X. A SEARCH FOR ALGERIA
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The _Dobryna_, a strong craft of 200 tons burden, had been built in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: famous shipbuilding yards in the Isle of Wight. Her sea going qualities
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were excellent, and would have amply sufficed for a circumnavigation of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the globe. Count Timascheff was himself no sailor, but had the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: greatest confidence in leaving the command of his yacht in the hands of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope, a man of about thirty years of age, and an excellent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seaman. Born on the count's estates, the son of a serf who had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: emancipated long before the famous edict of the Emperor Alexander,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Procope was sincerely attached, by a tie of gratitude as well as of duty
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and affection, to his patron's service. After an apprenticeship on a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: merchant ship he had entered the imperial navy, and had already reached
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the rank of lieutenant when the count appointed him to the charge of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his own private yacht, in which he was accustomed to spend by far the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: greater part of his time, throughout the winter generally cruising in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Mediterranean, whilst in the summer he visited more northern waters.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The ship could not have been in better hands. The lieutenant was well
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: informed in many matters outside the pale of his profession, and his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attainments were alike creditable to himself and to the liberal friend
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: who had given him his education. He had an excellent crew, consisting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Tiglew the engineer, four sailors named Niegoch, Tolstoy, Etkef, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Panofka, and Mochel the cook. These men, without exception, were all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sons of the count's tenants, and so tenaciously, even out at sea, did
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they cling to their old traditions, that it mattered little to them what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: physical disorganization ensued, so long as they felt they were sharing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the experiences of their lord and master. The late astounding events,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, had rendered Procope manifestly uneasy, and not the less
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so from his consciousness that the count secretly partook of his own
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: anxiety.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Steam up and canvas spread, the schooner started eastwards. With a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: favorable wind she would certainly have made eleven knots an hour
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had not the high waves somewhat impeded her progress. Although only a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moderate breeze was blowing, the sea was rough, a circumstance to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be accounted for only by the diminution in the force of the earth's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attraction rendering the liquid particles so buoyant, that by the mere
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: effect of oscillation they were carried to a height that was quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unprecedented. M. Arago has fixed twenty-five or twenty-six feet as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the maximum elevation ever attained by the highest waves, and his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astonishment would have been very great to see them rising fifty or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: even sixty feet. Nor did these waves in the usual way partially unfurl
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: themselves and rebound against the sides of the vessel; they might
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rather be described as long undulations carrying the schooner (its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: weight diminished from the same cause as that of the water) alternately
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to such heights and depths, that if Captain Servadac had been subject to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seasickness he must have found himself in sorry plight. As the pitching,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, was the result of a long uniform swell, the yacht did not labor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: much harder than she would against the ordinary short strong waves of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Mediterranean; the main inconvenience that was experienced was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diminution in her proper rate of speed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For a few miles she followed the line hitherto presumably occupied by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the coast of Algeria; but no land appeared to the south. The changed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: positions of the planets rendered them of no avail for purposes of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nautical observation, nor could Lieutenant Procope calculate his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: latitude and longitude by the altitude of the sun, as his reckonings
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would be useless when applied to charts that had been constructed for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the old order of things; but nevertheless, by means of the log, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gave him the rate of progress, and by the compass which indicated the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: direction in which they were sailing, he was able to form an estimate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his position that was sufficiently free from error for his immediate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: need.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Happily the recent phenomena had no effect upon the compass; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: magnetic needle, which in these regions had pointed about 22 degrees
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the north pole, had never deviated in the least--a proof that,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: although east and west had apparently changed places, north and south
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: continued to retain their normal position as cardinal points. The log
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the compass, therefore, were able to be called upon to do the work
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the sextant, which had become utterly useless.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the first morning of the cruise Lieutenant Procope, who, like most
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Russians, spoke French fluently, was explaining these peculiarities
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to Captain Servadac; the count was present, and the conversation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perpetually recurred, as naturally it would, to the phenomena which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remained so inexplicable to them all.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It is very evident," said the lieutenant, "that ever since the 1st of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: January the earth has been moving in a new orbit, and from some unknown
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cause has drawn nearer to the sun."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No doubt about that," said Servadac; "and I suppose that, having
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: crossed the orbit of Venus, we have a good chance of running into the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: orbit of Mercury."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And finish up by a collision with the sun!" added the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "There is no fear of that, sir. The earth has undoubtedly entered upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a new orbit, but she is not incurring any probable risk of being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: precipitated onto the sun."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Can you satisfy us of that?" asked the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I can, sir. I can give you a proof which I think you will own is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conclusive. If, as you suppose, the earth is being drawn on so as to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be precipitated against the sun, the great center of attraction of our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: system, it could only be because the centrifugal and centripetal forces
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that cause the planets to rotate in their several orbits had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entirely suspended: in that case, indeed, the earth would rush onwards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: towards the sun, and in sixty-four days and a half the catastrophe you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dread would inevitably happen."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And what demonstration do you offer," asked Servadac eagerly, "that it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will not happen?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Simply this, captain: that since the earth entered her new orbit
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: half the sixty-four days has already elapsed, and yet it is only just
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: recently that she has crossed the orbit of Venus, hardly one-third of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the distance to be traversed to reach the sun."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant paused to allow time for reflection, and added:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Moreover, I have every reason to believe that we are not so near the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sun as we have been. The temperature has been gradually diminishing;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the heat upon Gourbi Island is not greater now than we might ordinarily
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: expect to find in Algeria. At the same time, we have the problem still
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unsolved that the Mediterranean has evidently been transported to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: equatorial zone."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Both the count and the captain expressed themselves reassured by his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: representations, and observed that they must now do all in their power
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to discover what had become of the vast continent of Africa, of which,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they were hitherto failing so completely to find a vestige.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Twenty-four hours after leaving the island, the _Dobryna_ had passed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: over the sites where Tenes, Cherchil, Koleah, and Sidi-Feruch once had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been, but of these towns not one appeared within range of the telescope.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ocean reigned supreme. Lieutenant Procope was absolutely certain that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he had not mistaken his direction; the compass showed that the wind
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had never shifted from the west, and this, with the rate of speed as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: estimated by the log, combined to assure him that at this date, the 2d
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of February, the schooner was in lat. 36 degrees 49 min N. and long. 3
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: degrees 25 min E., the very spot which ought to have been occupied by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Algerian capital. But Algiers, like all the other coast-towns, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: apparently been absorbed into the bowels of the earth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac, with clenched teeth and knitted brow, stood sternly,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost fiercely, regarding the boundless waste of water. His pulse beat
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fast as he recalled the friends and comrades with whom he had spent the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: last few years in that vanished city. All the images of his past life
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: floated upon his memory; his thoughts sped away to his native France,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only to return again to wonder whether the depths of ocean would reveal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any traces of the Algerian metropolis.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Is it not impossible," he murmured aloud, "that any city should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disappear so completely? Would not the loftiest eminences of the city
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at least be visible? Surely some portion of the Casbah must still rise
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: above the waves? The imperial fort, too, was built upon an elevation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of 750 feet; it is incredible that it should be so totally submerged.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Unless some vestiges of these are found, I shall begin to suspect that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the whole of Africa has been swallowed in some vast abyss."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Another circumstance was most remarkable. Not a material object of any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: kind was to be noticed floating on the surface of the water; not one
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: branch of a tree had been seen drifting by, nor one spar belonging to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: one of the numerous vessels that a month previously had been moored
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the magnificent bay which stretched twelve miles across from Cape
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Matafuz to Point Pexade. Perhaps the depths might disclose what the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surface failed to reveal, and Count Timascheff, anxious that Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should have every facility afforded him for solving his doubts, called
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for the sounding-line. Forthwith, the lead was greased and lowered.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To the surprise of all, and especially of Lieutenant Procope, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: line indicated a bottom at a nearly uniform depth of from four to five
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fathoms; and although the sounding was persevered with continuously for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more than two hours over a considerable area, the differences of level
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were insignificant, not corresponding in any degree to what would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: expected over the site of a city that had been terraced like the seats
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of an amphitheater. Astounding as it seemed, what alternative was left
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but to suppose that the Algerian capital had been completely leveled by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the flood?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The sea-bottom was composed of neither rock, mud, sand, nor shells;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the sounding-lead brought up nothing but a kind of metallic dust, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: glittered with a strange iridescence, and the nature of which it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impossible to determine, as it was totally unlike what had ever been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: known to be raised from the bed of the Mediterranean.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You must see, lieutenant, I should think, that we are not so near the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast of Algeria as you imagined."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant shook his head. After pondering awhile, he said: "If
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: we were farther away I should expect to find a depth of two or three
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hundred fathoms instead of five fathoms. Five fathoms! I confess I am
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: puzzled."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For the next thirty-six hours, until the 4th of February, the sea was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: examined and explored with the most unflagging perseverance. Its depth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remained invariable, still four, or at most five, fathoms; and although
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its bottom was assiduously dredged, it was only to prove it barren of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: marine production of any type.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The yacht made its way to lat. 36 degrees, and by reference to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: charts it was tolerably certain that she was cruising over the site of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Sahel, the ridge that had separated the rich plain of the Mitidja
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the sea, and of which the highest peak, Mount Boujereah, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reached an altitude of 1,200 feet; but even this peak, which might have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been expected to emerge like an islet above the surface of the sea,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was nowhere to be traced. Nothing was to be done but to put about, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: return in disappointment towards the north.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Thus the _Dobryna_ regained the waters of the Mediterranean without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discovering a trace of the missing province of Algeria.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XI. AN ISLAND TOMB
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: No longer, then, could there be any doubt as to the annihilation of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a considerable portion of the colony. Not merely had there been a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: submersion of the land, but the impression was more and more confirmed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the very bowels of the earth must have yawned and closed again upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a large territory. Of the rocky substratum of the province it became
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more evident than ever that not a trace remained, and a new soil
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of unknown formation had certainly taken the place of the old sandy
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea-bottom. As it altogether transcended the powers of those on board to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elucidate the origin of this catastrophe, it was felt to be incumbent on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them at least to ascertain its extent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After a long and somewhat wavering discussion, it was at length decided
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the schooner should take advantage of the favorable wind and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: weather, and proceed at first towards the east, thus following the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: outline of what had formerly represented the coast of Africa, until that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast had been lost in boundless sea.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Not a vestige of it all remained; from Cape Matafuz to Tunis it had all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gone, as though it had never been. The maritime town of Dellis, built
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: like Algiers, amphitheater-wise, had totally disappeared; the highest
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: points were quite invisible; not a trace on the horizon was left of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Jurjura chain, the topmost point of which was known to have an altitude
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of more than 7,000 feet.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Unsparing of her fuel, the _Dobryna_ made her way at full steam towards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Cape Blanc. Neither Cape Negro nor Cape Serrat was to be seen. The town
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Bizerta, once charming in its oriental beauty, had vanished utterly;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its marabouts, or temple-tombs, shaded by magnificent palms that fringed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the gulf, which by reason of its narrow mouth had the semblance of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lake, all had disappeared, giving place to a vast waste of sea, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: transparent waves of which, as still demonstrated by the sounding-line,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had ever the same uniform and arid bottom.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In the course of the day the schooner rounded the point where, five
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: weeks previously, Cape Blanc had been so conspicuous an object, and she
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was now stemming the waters of what once had been the Bay of Tunis. But
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bay there was none, and the town from which it had derived its name,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the Arsenal, the Goletta, and the two peaks of Bou-Kournein, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all vanished from the view. Cape Bon, too, the most northern promontory
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Africa and the point of the continent nearest to the island of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sicily, had been included in the general devastation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Before the occurrence of the recent prodigy, the bottom of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mediterranean just at this point had formed a sudden ridge across the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Straits of Libya. The sides of the ridge had shelved to so great an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extent that, while the depth of water on the summit had been little more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than eleven fathoms, that on either hand of the elevation was little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: short of a hundred fathoms. A formation such as this plainly indicated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that at some remote epoch Cape Bon had been connected with Cape Furina,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the extremity of Sicily, in the same manner as Ceuta has doubtless been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: connected with Gibraltar.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope was too well acquainted with the Mediterranean to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be unaware of this peculiarity, and would not lose the opportunity of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ascertaining whether the submarine ridge still existed, or whether the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea-bottom between Sicily and Africa had undergone any modification.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Both Timascheff and Servadac were much interested in watching the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: operations. At a sign from the lieutenant, a sailor who was stationed at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the foot of the fore-shrouds dropped the sounding-lead into the water,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and in reply to Procope's inquiries, reported--"Five fathoms and a flat
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bottom."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The next aim was to determine the amount of depression on either side of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the ridge, and for this purpose the _Dobryna_ was shifted for a distance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of half a mile both to the right and left, and the soundings taken
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at each station. "Five fathoms and a flat bottom," was the unvaried
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: announcement after each operation. Not only, therefore, was it evident
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the submerged chain between Cape Bon and Cape Furina no longer
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: existed, but it was equally clear that the convulsion had caused a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: general leveling of the sea-bottom, and that the soil, degenerated, as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it has been said, into a metallic dust of unrecognized composition,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bore no trace of the sponges, sea-anemones, star-fish, sea-nettles,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hydrophytes, and shells with which the submarine rocks of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mediterranean had hitherto been prodigally clothed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The _Dobryna_ now put about and resumed her explorations in a southerly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: direction. It remained, however, as remarkable as ever how completely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: throughout the voyage the sea continued to be deserted; all expectations
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of hailing a vessel bearing news from Europe were entirely falsified, so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that more and more each member of the crew began to be conscious of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: isolation, and to believe that the schooner, like a second Noah's ark,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carried the sole survivors of a calamity that had overwhelmed the earth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 9th of February the _Dobryna_ passed over the site of the city
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Dido, the ancient Byrsa--a Carthage, however, which was now more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: completely destroyed than ever Punic Carthage had been destroyed by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Scipio Africanus or Roman Carthage by Hassan the Saracen.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In the evening, as the sun was sinking below the eastern horizon,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac was lounging moodily against the taffrail. From the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: heaven above, where stars kept peeping fitfully from behind the moving
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clouds, his eye wandered mechanically to the waters below, where the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: long waves were rising and falling with the evening breeze.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: All at once, his attention was arrested by a luminous speck straight
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ahead on the southern horizon. At first, imagining that he was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: victim of some spectral illusion, he observed it with silent attention;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but when, after some minutes, he became convinced that what he saw was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: actually a distant light, he appealed to one of the sailors, by whom
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his impression was fully corroborated. The intelligence was immediately
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: imparted to Count Timascheff and the lieutenant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Is it land, do you suppose?" inquired Servadac, eagerly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I should be more inclined to think it is a light on board some ship,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: replied the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Whatever it is, in another hour we shall know all about it," said
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No, captain," interposed Lieutenant Procope; "we shall know nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: until to-morrow."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What! not bear down upon it at once?" asked the count in surprise.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No, sir; I should much rather lay to and wait till daylight. If we are
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: really near land, I should be afraid to approach it in the dark."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count expressed his approval of the lieutenant's caution, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thereupon all sail was shortened so as to keep the _Dobryna_ from making
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any considerable progress all through the hours of night. Few as those
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hours were, they seemed to those on board as if their end would never
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: come. Fearful lest the faint glimmer should at any moment cease to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: visible, Hector Servadac did not quit his post upon the deck; but the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: light continued unchanged. It shone with about the same degree of luster
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as a star of the second magnitude, and from the fact of its remaining
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stationary, Procope became more and more convinced that it was on land
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and did not belong to a passing vessel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At sunrise every telescope was pointed with keenest interest towards the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: center of attraction. The light, of course, had ceased to be visible,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but in the direction where it had been seen, and at a distance of about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ten miles, there was the distinct outline of a solitary island of very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: small extent; rather, as the count observed, it had the appearance of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: being the projecting summit of a mountain all but submerged. Whatever it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was, it was agreed that its true character must be ascertained, not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only to gratify their own curiosity, but for the benefit of all future
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: navigators. The schooner accordingly was steered directly towards it,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and in less than an hour had cast anchor within a few cables' lengths of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the shore.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The little island proved to be nothing more than an arid rock rising
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abruptly about forty feet above the water. It had no outlying reefs, a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumstance that seemed to suggest the probability that in the recent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: convulsion it had sunk gradually, until it had reached its present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: position of equilibrium.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without removing his eye from his telescope, Servadac exclaimed: "There
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is a habitation on the place; I can see an erection of some kind quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distinctly. Who can tell whether we shall not come across a human
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: being?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope looked doubtful. The island had all the appearance of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: being deserted, nor did a cannon-shot fired from the schooner have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the effect of bringing any resident to the shore. Nevertheless, it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: undeniable that there was a stone building situated on the top of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the rock, and that this building had much the character of an Arabian
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mosque.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The boat was lowered and manned by the four sailors; Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Timascheff and Procope were quickly rowed ashore, and lost no time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in commencing their ascent of the steep acclivity. Upon reaching the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: summit, they found their progress arrested by a kind of wall, or rampart
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of singular construction, its materials consisting mainly of vases,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fragments of columns, carved bas-reliefs, statues, and portions of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: broken stelae, all piled promiscuously together without any pretense
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to artistic arrangement. They made their way into the enclosure, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: finding an open door, they passed through and soon came to a second
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: door, also open, which admitted them to the interior of the mosque,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consisting of a single chamber, the walls of which were ornamented in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Arabian style by sculptures of indifferent execution. In the center
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was a tomb of the very simplest kind, and above the tomb was suspended a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: large silver lamp with a capacious reservoir of oil, in which floated a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: long lighted wick, the flame of which was evidently the light that had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attracted Servadac's attention on the previous night.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Must there not have been a custodian of the shrine?" they mutually
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: asked; but if such there had ever been, he must, they concluded, either
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have fled or have perished on that eventful night. Not a soul was there
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in charge, and the sole living occupants were a flock of wild cormorants
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which, startled at the entrance of the intruders, rose on wing, and took
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a rapid flight towards the south.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: An old French prayer-book was lying on the corner of the tomb; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: volume was open, and the page exposed to view was that which contained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the office for the celebration of the 25th of August. A sudden
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revelation dashed across Servadac's mind. The solemn isolation of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island tomb, the open breviary, the ritual of the ancient anniversary,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all combined to apprise him of the sanctity of the spot upon which he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stood.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The tomb of St. Louis!" he exclaimed, and his companions involuntarily
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: followed his example, and made a reverential obeisance to the venerated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: monument.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was, in truth, the very spot on which tradition asserts that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: canonized monarch came to die, a spot to which for six centuries and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more his countrymen had paid the homage of a pious regard. The lamp
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that had been kindled at the memorial shrine of a saint was now in all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: probability the only beacon that threw a light across the waters of the
