title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mediterranean, and even this ere long must itself expire.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was nothing more to explore. The three together quitted the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mosque, and descended the rock to the shore, whence their boat
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: re-conveyed them to the schooner, which was soon again on her southward
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: voyage; and it was not long before the tomb of St. Louis, the only spot
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that had survived the mysterious shock, was lost to view.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XII. AT THE MERCY OF THE WINDS
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As the affrighted cormorants had winged their flight towards the south,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there sprang up a sanguine hope on board the schooner that land might be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discovered in that direction. Thither, accordingly, it was determined to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proceed, and in a few hours after quitting the island of the tomb,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the _Dobryna_ was traversing the shallow waters that now covered the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: peninsula of Dakhul, which had separated the Bay of Tunis from the Gulf
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Hammamet. For two days she continued an undeviating course, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: after a futile search for the coast of Tunis, reached the latitude of 34
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: degrees.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Here, on the 11th of February, there suddenly arose the cry of "Land!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and in the extreme horizon, right ahead, where land had never been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: before, it was true enough that a shore was distinctly to be seen. What
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could it be? It could not be the coast of Tripoli; for not only would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that low-lying shore be quite invisible at such a distance, but it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certain, moreover, that it lay two degrees at least still further
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: south. It was soon observed that this newly discovered land was of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very irregular elevation, that it extended due east and west across
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the horizon, thus dividing the gulf into two separate sections and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: completely concealing the island of Jerba, which must lie behind. Its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: position was duly traced on the _Dobryna_'s chart.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How strange," exclaimed Hector Servadac, "that after sailing all this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: time over sea where we expected to find land, we have at last come upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: land where we thought to find sea!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Strange, indeed," replied Lieutenant Procope; "and what appears to me
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost as remarkable is that we have never once caught sight either of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: one of the Maltese tartans or one of the Levantine xebecs that traffic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so regularly on the Mediterranean."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Eastwards or westwards," asked the count--"which shall be our course?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: All farther progress to the south is checked."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Westwards, by all means," replied Servadac quickly. "I am longing to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: know whether anything of Algeria is left beyond the Shelif; besides,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as we pass Gourbi Island we might take Ben Zoof on board, and then
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: make away for Gibraltar, where we should be sure to learn something, at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: least, of European news."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: With his usual air of stately courtesy, Count Timascheff begged the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain to consider the yacht at his own disposal, and desired him to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: give the lieutenant instructions accordingly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope, however, hesitated, and after revolving matters
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for a few moments in his mind, pointed out that as the wind was blowing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: directly from the west, and seemed likely to increase, if they went to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the west in the teeth of the weather, the schooner would be reduced to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the use of her engine only, and would have much difficulty in making any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: headway; on the other hand, by taking an eastward course, not only would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they have the advantage of the wind, but, under steam and canvas, might
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hope in a few days to be off the coast of Egypt, and from Alexandria or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some other port they would have the same opportunity of getting tidings
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from Europe as they would at Gibraltar.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Intensely anxious as he was to revisit the province of Oran, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eager, too, to satisfy himself of the welfare of his faithful Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof, Servadac could not but own the reasonableness of the lieutenant's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: objections, and yielded to the proposal that the eastward course should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be adopted. The wind gave signs only too threatening of the breeze
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rising to a gale; but, fortunately, the waves did not culminate in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: breakers, but rather in a long swell which ran in the same direction as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the vessel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: During the last fortnight the high temperature had been gradually
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diminishing, until it now reached an average of 20 degrees Cent. (or 68
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: degrees Fahr.), and sometimes descended as low as 15 degrees. That this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diminution was to be attributed to the change in the earth's orbit was a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: question that admitted of little doubt. After approaching so near to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sun as to cross the orbit of Venus, the earth must now have receded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so far from the sun that its normal distance of ninety-one millions of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles was greatly increased, and the probability was great that it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approximating to the orbit of Mars, that planet which in its physical
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: constitution most nearly resembles our own. Nor was this supposition
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suggested merely by the lowering of the temperature; it was strongly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: corroborated by the reduction of the apparent diameter of the sun's disc
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the precise dimensions which it would assume to an observer actually
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stationed on the surface of Mars. The necessary inference that seemed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: follow from these phenomena was that the earth had been projected into a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: new orbit, which had the form of a very elongated ellipse.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Very slight, however, in comparison was the regard which these
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astronomical wonders attracted on board the _Dobryna_. All interest
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there was too much absorbed in terrestrial matters, and in ascertaining
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what changes had taken place in the configuration of the earth itself,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to permit much attention to be paid to its erratic movements through
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: space.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The schooner kept bravely on her way, but well out to sea, at a distance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of two miles from land. There was good need of this precaution, for so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: precipitous was the shore that a vessel driven upon it must inevitably
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have gone to pieces; it did not offer a single harbor of refuge, but,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: smooth and perpendicular as the walls of a fortress, it rose to a height
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of two hundred, and occasionally of three hundred feet. The waves dashed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: violently against its base. Upon the general substratum rested a massive
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conglomerate, the crystallizations of which rose like a forest of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gigantic pyramids and obelisks.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But what struck the explorers more than anything was the appearance of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: singular newness that pervaded the whole of the region. It all seemed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so recent in its formation that the atmosphere had had no opportunity of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: producing its wonted effect in softening the hardness of its lines, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rounding the sharpness of its angles, or in modifying the color of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its surface; its outline was clearly marked against the sky, and its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: substance, smooth and polished as though fresh from a founder's mold,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: glittered with the metallic brilliancy that is characteristic of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pyrites. It seemed impossible to come to any other conclusion but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the land before them, continent or island, had been upheaved by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: subterranean forces above the surface of the sea, and that it was mainly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: composed of the same metallic element as had characterized the dust so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frequently uplifted from the bottom.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The extreme nakedness of the entire tract was likewise very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extraordinary. Elsewhere, in various quarters of the globe, there may
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be sterile rocks, but there are none so adamant as to be altogether
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unfurrowed by the filaments engendered in the moist residuum of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: condensed vapor; elsewhere there may be barren steeps, but none so rigid
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as not to afford some hold to vegetation, however low and elementary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: may be its type; but here all was bare, and blank, and desolate--not a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: symptom of vitality was visible.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Such being the condition of the adjacent land, it could hardly be a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: matter of surprise that all the sea-birds, the albatross, the gull, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea-mew, sought continual refuge on the schooner; day and night they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perched fearlessly upon the yards, the report of a gun failing to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dislodge them, and when food of any sort was thrown upon the deck,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they would dart down and fight with eager voracity for the prize. Their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extreme avidity was recognized as a proof that any land where they could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: obtain a sustenance must be far remote.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Onwards thus for several days the _Dobryna_ followed the contour of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inhospitable coast, of which the features would occasionally change,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sometimes for two or three miles assuming the form of a simple arris,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sharply defined as though cut by a chisel, when suddenly the prismatic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lamellae soaring in rugged confusion would again recur; but all along
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there was the same absence of beach or tract of sand to mark its base,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: neither were there any of those shoals of rock that are ordinarily found
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in shallow water. At rare intervals there were some narrow fissures,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but not a creek available for a ship to enter to replenish its supply of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: water; and the wide roadsteads were unprotected and exposed to well-nigh
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: every point of the compass.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But after sailing two hundred and forty miles, the progress of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Dobryna_ was suddenly arrested. Lieutenant Procope, who had sedulously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inserted the outline of the newly revealed shore upon the maps,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: announced that it had ceased to run east and west, and had taken a turn
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: due north, thus forming a barrier to their continuing their previous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: direction. It was, of course, impossible to conjecture how far this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: barrier extended; it coincided pretty nearly with the fourteenth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: meridian of east longitude; and if it reached, as probably it did,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beyond Sicily to Italy, it was certain that the vast basin of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mediterranean, which had washed the shores alike of Europe, Asia, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Africa, must have been reduced to about half its original area.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was resolved to proceed upon the same plan as heretofore, following
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the boundary of the land at a safe distance. Accordingly, the head of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the _Dobryna_ was pointed north, making straight, as it was presumed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for the south of Europe. A hundred miles, or somewhat over, in that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: direction, and it was to be anticipated she would come in sight of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Malta, if only that ancient island, the heritage in succession of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Phoenicians, Carthaginians, Sicilians, Romans, Vandals, Greeks,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Arabians, and the knights of Rhodes, should still be undestroyed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But Malta, too, was gone; and when, upon the 14th, the sounding-line was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dropped upon its site, it was only with the same result so oftentimes
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: obtained before.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The devastation is not limited to Africa," observed the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Assuredly not," assented the lieutenant; adding, "and I confess I am
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost in despair whether we shall ever ascertain its limits. To what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quarter of Europe, if Europe still exists, do you propose that I should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: now direct your course?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To Sicily, Italy, France!" ejaculated Servadac, eagerly,--"anywhere
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: where we can learn the truth of what has befallen us."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How if we are the sole survivors?" said the count, gravely.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hector Servadac was silent; his own secret presentiment so thoroughly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coincided with the doubts expressed by the count, that he refrained from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: saying another word.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The coast, without deviation, still tended towards the north. No
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: alternative, therefore, remained than to take a westerly course and to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attempt to reach the northern shores of the Mediterranean. On the 16th
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the _Dobryna_ essayed to start upon her altered way, but it seemed as if
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the elements had conspired to obstruct her progress. A furious tempest
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: arose; the wind beat dead in the direction of the coast, and the danger
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: incurred by a vessel of a tonnage so light was necessarily very great.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope was extremely uneasy. He took in all sail, struck
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his topmasts, and resolved to rely entirely on his engine. But the peril
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seemed only to increase. Enormous waves caught the schooner and carried
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her up to their crests, whence again she was plunged deep into the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abysses that they left. The screw failed to keep its hold upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: water, but continually revolved with useless speed in the vacant air;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and thus, although the steam was forced on to the extremest limit
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consistent with safety, the vessel held her way with the utmost
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulty, and recoiled before the hurricane.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Still, not a single resort for refuge did the inaccessible shore
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: present. Again and again the lieutenant asked himself what would become
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of him and his comrades, even if they should survive the peril of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shipwreck, and gain a footing upon the cliff. What resources could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they expect to find upon that scene of desolation? What hope could they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entertain that any portion of the old continent still existed beyond
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that dreary barrier?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was a trying time, but throughout it all the crew behaved with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the greatest courage and composure; confident in the skill of their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: commander, and in the stability of their ship, they performed their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: duties with steadiness and unquestioning obedience.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But neither skill, nor courage, nor obedience could avail; all was in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vain. Despite the strain put upon her engine, the schooner, bare of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: canvas (for not even the smallest stay-sail could have withstood the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: violence of the storm), was drifting with terrific speed towards the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: menacing precipices, which were only a. few short miles to leeward.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Fully alive to the hopelessness of their situation, the crew were all on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deck.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "All over with us, sir!" said Procope to the count. "I have done
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: everything that man could do; but our case is desperate. Nothing short
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of a miracle can save us now. Within an hour we must go to pieces upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: yonder rocks."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Let us, then, commend ourselves to the providence of Him to Whom
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nothing is impossible," replied the count, in a calm, clear voice

text: that could be distinctly heard by all; and as he spoke, he reverently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: uncovered, an example in which he was followed by all the rest.

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: of food for any who might escape ashore. He ordered several cases of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: Less and less grew the distance from the shore, but no creek, no inlet,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could be discerned in the towering wall of cliff, which seemed about to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: topple over and involve them in annihilation. Except a change of wind
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: or, as Procope observed, a supernatural rifting of the rock, nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could bring deliverance now. But the wind did not veer, and in a few
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: being hurled upon the cliff, when a ringing shout was heard. "Quick,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: boys, quick! Hoist the jib, and right the tiller!"

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sudden and startling as the unexpected orders were, they were executed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: as if by magic.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant, who had shouted from the bow, rushed astern and took
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the helm, and before anyone had time to speculate upon the object of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: maneuvers, he shouted again, "Look out! sharp! watch the sheets!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: An involuntary cry broke forth from all on board. But it was no cry
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of terror. Right ahead was a narrow opening in the solid rock; it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hardly forty feet wide. Whether it was a passage or no, it mattered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little; it was at least a refuge; and, driven by wind and wave, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Dobryna_, under the dexterous guidance of the lieutenant, dashed in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: between its perpendicular walls.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then I take your bishop, major," said Colonel Murphy, as he made a move
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that he had taken since the previous evening to consider.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I was afraid you would," replied Major Oliphant, looking intently at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the chess-board.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Such was the way in which a long silence was broken on the morning of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the 17th of February by the old calendar.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Another day elapsed before another move was made. It was a protracted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: game; it had, in fact, already lasted some months--the players being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so deliberate, and so fearful of taking a step without the most mature
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consideration, that even now they were only making the twentieth move.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Both of them, moreover, were rigid disciples of the renowned Philidor,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: who pronounces that to play the pawns well is "the soul of chess"; and,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accordingly, not one pawn had been sacrificed without a most vigorous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: defense.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The men who were thus beguiling their leisure were two officers in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: British army--Colonel Heneage Finch Murphy and Major Sir John Temple
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Oliphant. Remarkably similar in personal appearance, they were hardly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: less so in personal character. Both of them were about forty years of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: age; both of them were tall and fair, with bushy whiskers and mustaches;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: both of them were phlegmatic in temperament, and both much addicted to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the wearing of their uniforms. They were proud of their nationality,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and exhibited a manifest dislike, verging upon contempt, of everything
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: foreign. Probably they would have felt no surprise if they had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: told that Anglo-Saxons were fashioned out of some specific clay, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: properties of which surpassed the investigation of chemical analysis.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without any intentional disparagement they might, in a certain way,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be compared to two scarecrows which, though perfectly harmless in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: themselves, inspire some measure of respect, and are excellently adapted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to protect the territory intrusted to their guardianship.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: English-like, the two officers had made themselves thoroughly at home in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the station abroad in which it had been their lot to be quartered. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: faculty of colonization seems to be indigenous to the native character;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: once let an Englishman plant his national standard on the surface of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moon, and it would not be long before a colony was established round it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The officers had a servant, named Kirke, and a company of ten soldiers
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the line. This party of thirteen men were apparently the sole
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: survivors of an overwhelming catastrophe, which on the 1st of January
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had transformed an enormous rock, garrisoned with well-nigh two thousand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: troops, into an insignificant island far out to sea. But although the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: transformation had been so marvelous, it cannot be said that either
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Colonel Murphy or Major Oliphant had made much demonstration of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astonishment.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "This is all very peculiar, Sir John," observed the colonel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, colonel; very peculiar," replied the major.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "England will be sure to send for us," said one officer.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No doubt she will," answered the other.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Accordingly, they came to the mutual resolution that they would "stick
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to their post."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To say the truth, it would have been a difficult matter for the gallant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: officers to do otherwise; they had but one small boat; therefore, it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: well that they made a virtue of necessity, and resigned themselves to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: patient expectation of the British ship which, in due time, would bring
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: relief.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: They had no fear of starvation. Their island was mined with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: subterranean stores, more than ample for thirteen men--nay, for thirteen
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Englishmen--for the next five years at least. Preserved meat, ale,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brandy--all were in abundance; consequently, as the men expressed it,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they were in this respect "all right."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Of course, the physical changes that had taken place had attracted the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: notice both of officers and men. But the reversed position of east and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: west, the diminution of the force of gravity, the altered rotation of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth, and her projection upon a new orbit, were all things that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gave them little concern and no uneasiness; and when the colonel and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: major had replaced the pieces on the board which had been disturbed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by the convulsion, any surprise they might have felt at the chess-men
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: losing some portion of their weight was quite forgotten in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: satisfaction of seeing them retain their equilibrium.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: One phenomenon, however, did not fail to make its due impression upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the men; this was the diminution in the length of day and night. Three
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: days after the catastrophe, Corporal Pim, on behalf of himself and his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comrades, solicited a formal interview with the officers. The request
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: having been granted, Pim, with the nine soldiers, all punctiliously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wearing the regimental tunic of scarlet and trousers of invisible green,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: presented themselves at the door of the colonel's room, where he and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his brother-officer were continuing their game. Raising his hand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: respectfully to his cap, which he wore poised jauntily over his right
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ear, and scarcely held on by the strap below his under lip, the corporal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: waited permission to speak.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After a lingering survey of the chess-board, the colonel slowly lifted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his eyes, and said with official dignity, "Well, men, what is it?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "First of all, sir," replied the corporal, "we want to speak to you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: about our pay, and then we wish to have a word with the major about our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rations."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Say on, then," said Colonel Murphy. "What is it about your pay?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Just this, sir; as the days are only half as long as they were, we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should like to know whether our pay is to be diminished in proportion."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The colonel was taken somewhat aback, and did not reply immediately,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: though by some significant nods towards the major, he indicated that he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thought the question very reasonable. After a few moments' reflection,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he replied, "It must, I think, be allowed that your pay was calculated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from sunrise to sunrise; there was no specification of what the interval
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should be. Your pay will continue as before. England can afford it."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A buzz of approval burst involuntarily from all the men, but military
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discipline and the respect due to their officers kept them in check from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any boisterous demonstration of their satisfaction.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And now, corporal, what is your business with me?" asked Major
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Oliphant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We want to know whether, as the days are only six hours long, we are to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have but two meals instead of four?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The officers looked at each other, and by their glances agreed that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: corporal was a man of sound common sense.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Eccentricities of nature," said the major, "cannot interfere with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: military regulations. It is true that there will be but an interval of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an hour and a half between them, but the rule stands good--four meals
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a day. England is too rich to grudge her soldiers any of her soldiers'
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: due. Yes; four meals a day."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hurrah!" shouted the soldiers, unable this time to keep their delight
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: within the bounds of military decorum; and, turning to the right-about,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they marched away, leaving the officers to renew the all-absorbing game.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: However confident everyone upon the island might profess to be that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: succor would be sent them from their native land--for Britain never
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abandons any of her sons--it could not be disguised that that succor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was somewhat tardy in making its appearance. Many and various were the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conjectures to account for the delay. Perhaps England was engrossed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with domestic matters, or perhaps she was absorbed in diplomatic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulties; or perchance, more likely than all, Northern Europe had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: received no tidings of the convulsion that had shattered the south. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whole party throve remarkably well upon the liberal provisions of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: commissariat department, and if the officers failed to show the same
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tendency to _embonpoint_ which was fast becoming characteristic of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: men, it was only because they deemed it due to their rank to curtail any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: indulgences which might compromise the fit of their uniform.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the whole, time passed indifferently well. An Englishman rarely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suffers from _ennui_, and then only in his own country, when required to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conform to what he calls "the humbug of society"; and the two officers,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with their similar tastes, ideas, and dispositions, got on together
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: admirably. It is not to be questioned that they were deeply affected by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a sense of regret for their lost comrades, and astounded beyond measure
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at finding themselves the sole survivors of a garrison of 1,895 men,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but with true British pluck and self-control, they had done nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more than draw up a report that 1,882 names were missing from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: muster-roll.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The island itself, the sole surviving fragment of an enormous pile of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rock that had reared itself some 1,600 feet above the sea, was not,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: strictly speaking, the only land that was visible; for about twelve
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles to the south there was another island, apparently the very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: counterpart of what was now occupied by the Englishmen. It was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only natural that this should awaken some interest even in the most
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: imperturbable minds, and there was no doubt that the two officers,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: during one of the rare intervals when they were not absorbed in their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: game, had decided that it would be desirable at least to ascertain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whether the island was deserted, or whether it might not be occupied by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some others, like themselves, survivors from the general catastrophe.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Certain it is that one morning, when the weather was bright and calm,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they had embarked alone in the little boat, and been absent for seven or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eight hours. Not even to Corporal Pim did they communicate the object
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of their excursion, nor say one syllable as to its result, and it could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only be inferred from their manner that they were quite satisfied with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what they had seen; and very shortly afterwards Major Oliphant was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observed to draw up a lengthy document, which was no sooner finished
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than it was formally signed and sealed with the seal of the 33rd
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Regiment. It was directed:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _To the First Lord of the Admiralty,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: London,_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and kept in readiness for transmission by the first ship that should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hail in sight. But time elapsed, and here was the 18th of February
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: without an opportunity having been afforded for any communication with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the British Government.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At breakfast that morning, the colonel observed to the major that he was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: under the most decided impression that the 18th of February was a royal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: anniversary; and he went on to say that, although he had received no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: definite instructions on the subject, he did not think that the peculiar
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumstances under which they found themselves should prevent them from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: giving the day its due military honors.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The major quite concurred; and it was mutually agreed that the occasion
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: must be honored by a bumper of port, and by a royal salute. Corporal Pim
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: must be sent for. The corporal soon made his appearance, smacking his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lips, having, by a ready intuition, found a pretext for a double morning
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ration of spirits.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The 18th of February, you know, Pim," said the colonel; "we must have a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: salute of twenty-one guns."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very good," replied Pim, a man of few words.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And take care that your fellows don't get their arms and legs blown
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: off," added the officer.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very good, sir," said the corporal; and he made his salute and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: withdrew.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Of all the bombs, howitzers, and various species of artillery with which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the fortress had been crowded, one solitary piece remained. This was a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cumbrous muzzle-loader of 9-inch caliber, and, in default of the smaller
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ordnance generally employed for the purpose, had to be brought into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: requisition for the royal salute.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A sufficient number of charges having been provided, the corporal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brought his men to the reduct, whence the gun's mouth projected over
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a sloping embrasure. The two officers, in cocked hats and full staff
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: uniform, attended to take charge of the proceedings. The gun was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: maneuvered in strict accordance with the rules of "The Artilleryman's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Manual," and the firing commenced.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Not unmindful of the warning he had received, the corporal was most
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: careful between each discharge to see that every vestige of fire was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extinguished, so as to prevent an untimely explosion while the men were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reloading; and accidents, such as so frequently mar public rejoicings,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were all happily avoided.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Much to the chagrin of both Colonel Murphy and Major Oliphant, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: effect of the salute fell altogether short of their anticipations. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: weight of the atmosphere was so reduced that there was comparatively
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little resistance to the explosive force of the gases, liberated at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cannon's mouth, and there was consequently none of the reverberation,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: like rolling thunder, that ordinarily follows the discharge of heavy
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: artillery.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Twenty times had the gun been fired, and it was on the point of being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: loaded for the last time, when the colonel laid his hand upon the arm of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the man who had the ramrod. "Stop!" he said; "we will have a ball this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: time. Let us put the range of the piece to the test."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A good idea!" replied the major. "Corporal, you hear the orders."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In quick time an artillery-wagon was on the spot, and the men lifted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: out a full-sized shot, weighing 200 lbs., which, under ordinary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumstances, the cannon would carry about four miles. It was proposed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by means of telescopes, to note the place where the ball first touched
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the water, and thus to obtain an approximation sufficiently accurate as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the true range.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Having been duly charged with powder and ball, the gun was raised to an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: angle of something under 45 degrees, so as to allow proper development
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the curve that the projectile would make, and, at a signal from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: major, the light was applied to the priming.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Heavens!" "By all that's good!" exclaimed both officers in one breath,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as, standing open-mouthed, they hardly knew whether they were to believe
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the evidence of their own senses. "Is it possible?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The diminution of the force of attraction at the earth's surface was so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: considerable that the ball had sped beyond the horizon.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Incredible!" ejaculated the colonel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Incredible!" echoed the major.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Six miles at least!" observed the one.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ay, more than that!" replied the other.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Awhile, they gazed at the sea and at each other in mute amazement. But
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the midst of their perplexity, what sound was that which startled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them? Was it mere fancy? Was it the reverberation of the cannon still
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: booming in their ears? Or was it not truly the report of another and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a distant gun in answer to their own? Attentively and eagerly they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: listened. Twice, thrice did the sound repeat itself. It was quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distinct. There could be no mistake.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I told you so," cried the colonel, triumphantly. "I knew our country
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would not forsake us; it is an English ship, no doubt."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In half an hour two masts were visible above the horizon. "See! Was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I not right? Our country was sure to send to our relief. Here is the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ship."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes," replied the major; "she responded to our gun."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It is to be hoped," muttered the corporal, "that our ball has done her
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no damage."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Before long the hull was full in sight. A long trail of smoke betokened
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her to be a steamer; and very soon, by the aid of the glass, it could be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ascertained that she was a schooner-yacht, and making straight for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island. A flag at her mast-head fluttered in the breeze, and towards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this the two officers, with the keenest attention, respectively adjusted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their focus.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Simultaneously the two telescopes were lowered. The colonel and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: major stared at each other in blank astonishment. "Russian!" they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gasped.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And true it was that the flag that floated at the head of yonder mast
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was the blue cross of Russia.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
