text: CHAPTER XIV. SENSITIVE NATIONALITY
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: When the schooner had approached the island, the Englishmen were able
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to make out the name "_Dobryna_" painted on the aft-board. A sinuous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irregularity of the coast had formed a kind of cove, which, though
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hardly spacious enough for a few fishing-smacks, would afford the yacht
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a temporary anchorage, so long as the wind did not blow violently from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: either west or south. Into this cove the _Dobryna_ was duly signaled,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and as soon as she was safely moored, she lowered her four-oar, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff and Captain Servadac made their way at once to land.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Colonel Heneage Finch Murphy and Major Sir John Temple Oliphant stood,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: grave and prim, formally awaiting the arrival of their visitors. Captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, with the uncontrolled vivacity natural to a Frenchman, was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: first to speak.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A joyful sight, gentlemen!" he exclaimed. "It will give us unbounded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pleasure to shake hands again with some of our fellow-creatures. You, no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: doubt, have escaped the same disaster as ourselves."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But the English officers, neither by word nor gesture, made the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: slightest acknowledgment of this familiar greeting.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What news can you give us of France, England, or Russia?" continued
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, perfectly unconscious of the stolid rigidity with which his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: advances were received. "We are anxious to hear anything you can tell
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: us. Have you had communications with Europe? Have you--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To whom have we the honor of speaking?" at last interposed Colonel
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Murphy, in the coldest and most measured tone, and drawing himself up to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his full height.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah! how stupid! I forgot," said Servadac, with the slightest possible
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shrug of the shoulders; "we have not been introduced."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Then, with a wave of his hand towards his companion, who meanwhile had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exhibited a reserve hardly less than that of the British officers, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: said:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Allow me to introduce you to Count Wassili Timascheff."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Major Sir John Temple Oliphant," replied the colonel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Russian and the Englishman mutually exchanged the stiffest of bows.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I have the pleasure of introducing Captain Servadac," said the count in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his turn.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And this is Colonel Heneage Finch Murphy," was the major's grave
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rejoinder.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: More bows were interchanged and the ceremony brought to its due
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conclusion. It need hardly be said that the conversation had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carried on in French, a language which is generally known both by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Russians and Englishmen--a circumstance that is probably in some measure
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: or English.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The formal preliminaries of etiquette being thus complete, there was no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: longer any obstacle to a freer intercourse. The colonel, signing to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the rock, nevertheless wore a general air of comfort. Major
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conversation was commenced.

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Irritated and disgusted at all the cold formalities, Hector Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: resolved to leave all the talking to the count; and he, quite aware that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Englishmen would adhere to the fiction that they could be supposed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to know nothing that had transpired previous to the introduction felt
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself obliged to recapitulate matters from the very beginning.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You must be aware, gentlemen," began the count, "that a most singular
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: catastrophe occurred on the 1st of January last. Its cause, its limits
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: we have utterly failed to discover, but from the appearance of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island on which we find you here, you have evidently experienced its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: devastating consequences."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Englishmen, in silence, bowed assent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Captain Servadac, who accompanies me," continued the count, "has been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: most severely tried by the disaster. Engaged as he was in an important
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mission as a staff-officer in Algeria--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A French colony, I believe," interposed Major Oliphant, half shutting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his eyes with an expression of supreme indifference.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac was on the point of making some cutting retort, but Count
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Timascheff, without allowing the interruption to be noticed, calmly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: continued his narrative:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It was near the mouth of the Shelif that a portion of Africa, on that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eventful night, was transformed into an island which alone survived; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rest of the vast continent disappeared as completely as if it had never
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The announcement seemed by no means startling to the phlegmatic colonel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Indeed!" was all he said.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And where were you?" asked Major Oliphant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I was out at sea, cruising in my yacht; hard by; and I look upon it as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a miracle, and nothing less, that I and my crew escaped with our lives."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I congratulate you on your luck," replied the major.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count resumed: "It was about a month after the great disruption
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that I was sailing--my engine having sustained some damage in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shock--along the Algerian coast, and had the pleasure of meeting with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: my previous acquaintance, Captain Servadac, who was resident upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island with his orderly, Ben Zoof."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ben who?" inquired the major.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Zoof! Ben Zoof!" ejaculated Servadac, who could scarcely shout loud
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enough to relieve his pent-up feelings.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ignoring this ebullition of the captain's spleen, the count went on to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: say: "Captain Servadac was naturally most anxious to get what news he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could. Accordingly, he left his servant on the island in charge of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: horses, and came on board the _Dobryna_ with me. We were quite at a loss
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to know where we should steer, but decided to direct our course to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what previously had been the east, in order that we might, if possible,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discover the colony of Algeria; but of Algeria not a trace remained."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The colonel curled his lip, insinuating only too plainly that to him it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was by no means surprising that a French colony should be wanting in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: element of stability. Servadac observed the supercilious look, and half
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rose to his feet, but, smothering his resentment, took his seat again
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: without speaking.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The devastation, gentlemen," said the count, who persistently refused
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to recognize the Frenchman's irritation, "everywhere was terrible and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: complete. Not only was Algeria lost, but there was no trace of Tunis,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: except one solitary rock, which was crowned by an ancient tomb of one of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the kings of France--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Louis the Ninth, I presume," observed the colonel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Saint Louis," blurted out Servadac, savagely.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Colonel Murphy slightly smiled.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Proof against all interruption, Count Timascheff, as if he had not heard
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it, went on without pausing. He related how the schooner had pushed her
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: way onwards to the south, and had reached the Gulf of Cabes; and how
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: she had ascertained for certain that the Sahara Sea had no longer an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: existence.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The smile of disdain again crossed the colonel's face; he could not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conceal his opinion that such a destiny for the work of a Frenchman
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could be no matter of surprise.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Our next discovery," continued the count, "was that a new coast
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had been upheaved right along in front of the coast of Tripoli, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: geological formation of which was altogether strange, and which extended
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the north as far as the proper place of Malta."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And Malta," cried Servadac, unable to control himself any longer;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Malta--town, forts, soldiers, governor, and all--has vanished just like
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Algeria."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For a moment a cloud rested upon the colonel's brow, only to give place
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to an expression of decided incredulity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The statement seems highly incredible," he said.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Incredible?" repeated Servadac. "Why is it that you doubt my word?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain's rising wrath did not prevent the colonel from replying
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coolly, "Because Malta belongs to England."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I can't help that," answered Servadac, sharply; "it has gone just as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: utterly as if it had belonged to China."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Colonel Murphy turned deliberately away from Servadac, and appealed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the count: "Do you not think you may have made some error, count, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reckoning the bearings of your yacht?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No, colonel, I am quite certain of my reckonings; and not only can
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I testify that Malta has disappeared, but I can affirm that a large
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: section of the Mediterranean has been closed in by a new continent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After the most anxious investigation, we could discover only one narrow
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: opening in all the coast, and it is by following that little channel
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that we have made our way hither. England, I fear, has suffered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: grievously by the late catastrophe. Not only has Malta been entirely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lost, but of the Ionian Islands that were under England's protection,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there seems to be but little left."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ay, you may depend upon it," said Servadac, breaking in upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conversation petulantly, "your grand resident lord high commissioner has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not much to congratulate himself about in the condition of Corfu."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Englishmen were mystified.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Corfu, did you say?" asked Major Oliphant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, Corfu; I said Corfu," replied Servadac, with a sort of malicious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: triumph.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The officers were speechless with astonishment.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The silence of bewilderment was broken at length by Count Timascheff
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: making inquiry whether nothing had been heard from England, either by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: telegraph or by any passing ship.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No," said the colonel; "not a ship has passed; and the cable is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: broken."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But do not the Italian telegraphs assist you?" continued the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Italian! I do not comprehend you. You must mean the Spanish, surely."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How?" demanded Timascheff.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Confound it!" cried the impatient Servadac. "What matters whether it be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Spanish or Italian? Tell us, have you had no communication at all from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Europe?--no news of any sort from London?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hitherto, none whatever," replied the colonel; adding with a stately
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: emphasis, "but we shall be sure to have tidings from England before
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: long."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Whether England is still in existence or not, I suppose," said
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, in a tone of irony.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Englishmen started simultaneously to their feet.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "England in existence?" the colonel cried. "England! Ten times more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: probable that France--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "France!" shouted Servadac in a passion. "France is not an island that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: can be submerged; France is an integral portion of a solid continent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: France, at least, is safe."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A scene appeared inevitable, and Count Timascheff's efforts to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conciliate the excited parties were of small avail.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You are at home here," said Servadac, with as much calmness as he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could command; "it will be advisable, I think, for this discussion to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be carried on in the open air." And hurriedly he left the room. Followed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: immediately by the others, he led the way to a level piece of ground,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which he considered he might fairly claim as neutral territory.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Now, gentlemen," he began haughtily, "permit me to represent that,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in spite of any loss France may have sustained in the fate of Algeria,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: France is ready to answer any provocation that affects her honor. Here I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: am the representative of my country, and here, on neutral ground--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Neutral ground?" objected Colonel Murphy; "I beg your pardon. This,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac, is English territory. Do you not see the English
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: flag?" and, as he spoke, he pointed with national pride to the British
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: standard floating over the top of the island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Pshaw!" cried Servadac, with a contemptuous sneer; "that flag, you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: know, has been hoisted but a few short weeks."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That flag has floated where it is for ages," asserted the colonel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "An imposture!" shouted Servadac, as he stamped with rage.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that I am not aware that this island on which we find you is what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exercise the right of protection, but have no claim of government?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The colonel and the major looked at each other in amazement.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although Count Timascheff secretly sympathized with Servadac, he had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carefully refrained from taking part in the dispute; but he was on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the point of interfering, when the colonel, in a greatly subdued tone,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: begged to be allowed to speak.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I begin to apprehend," he said, "that you must be la-boring under some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: strange mistake. There is no room for questioning that the territory
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: here is England's--England's by right of conquest; ceded to England
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: purpose. You are, I assure you, at the present moment, as much on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Square."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was now the turn of the captain and the count to look surprised. "Are
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: we not, then, in Corfu?" they asked.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You are at Gibraltar," replied the colonel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gibraltar! The word fell like a thunderclap upon their ears. Gibraltar!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the western extremity of the Mediterranean! Why, had they not been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sailing persistently to the east? Could they be wrong in imagining that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they had reached the Ionian Islands? What new mystery was this?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff was about to proceed with a more rigorous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: investigation, when the attention of all was arrested by a loud outcry.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Turning round, they saw that the crew of the _Dobryna_ was in hot
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dispute with the English soldiers. A general altercation had arisen
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from a disagreement between the sailor Panofka and Corporal Pim. It had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: transpired that the cannon-ball fired in experiment from the island
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had not only damaged one of the spars of the schooner, but had broken
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Panofka's pipe, and, moreover, had just grazed his nose, which, for a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Russian's, was unusually long. The discussion over this mishap led to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mutual recriminations, till the sailors had almost come to blows with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the garrison.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac was just in the mood to take Panofka's part, which drew from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Major Oliphant the remark that England could not be held responsible for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any accidental injury done by her cannon, and if the Russian's long nose
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: came in the way of the ball, the Russian must submit to the mischance.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This was too much for Count Timascheff, and having poured out a torrent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of angry invective against the English officers, he ordered his crew to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: embark immediately.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We shall meet again," said Servadac, as they pushed off from shore.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Whenever you please," was the cool reply.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The geographical mystery haunted the minds of both the count and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain, and they felt they could never rest till they had ascertained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what had become of their respective countries. They were glad to be on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: board again, that they might resume their voyage of investigation,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and in two hours were out of sight of the sole remaining fragment of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gibraltar.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XV. AN ENIGMA FROM THE SEA
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope had been left on board in charge of the _Dobryna_,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and on resuming the voyage it was a task of some difficulty to make him
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: understand the fact that had just come to light. Some hours were spent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in discussion and in attempting to penetrate the mysteries of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: situation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There were certain things of which they were perfectly certain. They
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could be under no misapprehension as to the distance they had positively
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sailed from Gourbi Island towards the east before their further progress
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was arrested by the unknown shore; as nearly as possible that was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fifteen degrees; the length of the narrow strait by which they had made
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their way across that land to regain the open sea was about three miles
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and a half; thence onward to the island, which they had been assured,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: on evidence that they could not disbelieve, to be upon the site of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gibraltar, was four degrees; while from Gibraltar to Gourbi Island was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seven degrees or but little more. What was it altogether? Was it not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: less than thirty degrees? In that latitude, the degree of longitude
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: represents eight and forty miles. What, then, did it all amount to?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Indubitably, to less than 1,400 miles. So brief a voyage would bring the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Dobryna_ once again to her starting-point, or, in other words, would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enable her to complete the circumnavigation of the globe. How changed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the condition of things! Previously, to sail from Malta to Gibraltar by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an eastward course would have involved the passage of the Suez Canal,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Red Sea, the Indian Ocean, the Pacific, the Atlantic; but what had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: happened now? Why, Gibraltar had been reached as if it had been just at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Corfu, and some three hundred and thirty degrees of the earth's circuit
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had vanished utterly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After allowing for a certain margin of miscalculation, the main fact
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remained undeniable; and the necessary inference that Lieutenant Procope
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: drew from the round of the earth being completed in 1,400 miles, was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the earth's diameter had been reduced by about fifteen sixteenths
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of its length.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "If that be so," observed the count, "it accounts for some of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: strange phenomena we witness. If our world has become so insignificant a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: spheroid, not only has its gravity diminished, but its rotary speed has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been accelerated; and this affords an adequate explanation of our days
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and nights being thus curtailed. But how about the new orbit in which we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are moving?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He paused and pondered, and then looked at Procope as though awaiting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from him some further elucidation of the difficulty. The lieutenant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hesitated. When, in a few moments, he began to speak, Servadac smiled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: intelligently, anticipating the answer he was about to hear.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "My conjecture is," said Procope, "that a fragment of considerable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: magnitude has been detached from the earth; that it has carried with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it an envelope of the earth's atmosphere, and that it is now traveling
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: through the solar system in an orbit that does not correspond at all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the proper orbit of the earth."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The hypothesis was plausible; but what a multitude of bewildering
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: speculations it entailed! If, in truth, a certain mass had been broken
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: off from the terrestrial sphere, whither would it wend its way? What
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would be the measure of the eccentricity of its path? What would be its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: period round the sun? Might it not, like a comet, be carried away into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the vast infinity of space? or, on the other hand, might it not be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attracted to the great central source of light and heat, and be absorbed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in it? Did its orbit correspond with the orbit of the ecliptic? and was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there no chance of its ever uniting again with the globe, from which it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had been torn off by so sudden and violent a disruption?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A thoughtful silence fell upon them all, which Servadac was the first
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to break. "Lieutenant," he said, "your explanation is ingenious, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accounts for many appearances; but it seems to me that in one point it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fails."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How so?" replied Procope. "To my mind the theory meets all objections."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I think not," Servadac answered. "In one point, at least, it appears to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: me to break down completely."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What is that?" asked the lieutenant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Stop a moment," said the captain. "Let us see that we understand each
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: other right. Unless I mistake you, your hypothesis is that a fragment of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth, comprising the Mediterranean and its shores from Gibraltar
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to Malta, has been developed into a new asteroid, which is started on an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: independent orbit in the solar regions. Is not that your meaning?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Precisely so," the lieutenant acquiesced.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, then," continued Servadac, "it seems to me to be at fault in this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: respect: it fails, and fails completely, to account for the geological
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: character of the land that we have found now encompassing this sea. Why,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: if the new land is a fragment of the old--why does it not retain its old
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: formation? What has become of the granite and the calcareous deposits?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: How is it that these should all be changed into a mineral concrete with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which we have no acquaintance?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: No doubt, it was a serious objection; for, however likely it might be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that a mass of the earth on being detached would be eccentric in its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: movements, there was no probable reason to be alleged why the material
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of its substance should undergo so complete a change. There was nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to account for the fertile shores, rich in vegetation, being transformed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into rocks arid and barren beyond precedent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant felt the difficulty, and owned himself unprepared to give
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at once an adequate solution; nevertheless, he declined to renounce his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: theory. He asserted that the arguments in favor of it carried conviction
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to his mind, and that he entertained no doubt but that, in the course of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: time, all apparently antagonistic circumstances would be explained so as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to become consistent with the view he took. He was careful, however,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to make it understood that with respect to the original cause of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the disruption he had no theory to offer; and although he knew what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: expansion might be the result of subterranean forces, he did not venture
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to say that he considered it sufficient to produce so tremendous an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: effect. The origin of the catastrophe was a problem still to be solved.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah! well," said Servadac, "I don't know that it matters much where our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: new little planet comes from, or what it is made of, if only it carries
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: France along with it."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And Russia," added the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And Russia, of course," said Servadac, with a polite bow.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was, however, not much room for this sanguine expectation, for if
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a new asteroid had thus been brought into existence, it must be a sphere
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of extremely limited dimensions, and there could be little chance that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it embraced more than the merest fraction of either France or Russia. As
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to England, the total cessation of all telegraphic communication between
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her shores and Gibraltar was a virtual proof that England was beyond its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: compass.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And what was the true measurement of the new little world? At Gourbi
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Island the days and nights were of equal length, and this seemed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: indicate that it was situated on the equator; hence the distance by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which the two poles stood apart would be half what had been reckoned
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would be the distance completed by the _Dobryna_ in her circuit. That
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distance had been already estimated to be something under 1,400 miles,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so that the Arctic Pole of their recently fashioned world must be about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 350 miles to the north, and the Antarctic about 350 miles to the south
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the island. Compare these calculations with the map, and it is at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: once apparent that the northernmost limit barely touched the coast of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Provence, while the southernmost reached to about lat. 20 degrees
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: N., and fell in the heart of the desert. The practical test of these
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conclusions would be made by future investigation, but meanwhile
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the fact appeared very much to strengthen the presumption that, if
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope had not arrived at the whole truth, he had made a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: considerable advance towards it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The weather, ever since the storm that had driven the _Dobryna_ into the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: creek, had been magnificent. The wind continued favorable, and now under
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: both steam and canvas, she made a rapid progress towards the north,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a direction in which she was free to go in consequence of the total
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disappearance of the Spanish coast, from Gibraltar right away to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Alicante. Malaga, Almeria, Cape Gata, Carthagena. Cape Palos--all were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gone. The sea was rolling over the southern extent of the peninsula, so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the yacht advanced to the latitude of Seville before it sighted any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: land at all, and then, not shores such as the shores of Andalusia, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a bluff and precipitous cliff, in its geological features resembling
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exactly the stern and barren rock that she had coasted beyond the site
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Malta. Here the sea made a decided indentation on the coast; it ran
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: up in an acute-angled triangle till its apex coincided with the very
