title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: semblance of a creek in which the _Dobryna_ could find an anchorage.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was no outlying ridge on which a footing could be gained. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: precipice was perpendicular as a wall, its topmost height crowned with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the same conglomerate of crystallized lamellae that had all along been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so pronounced a feature.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: With her steam at high pressure, the yacht made rapid progress towards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the east. The weather remained perfectly fine, the temperature
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: became gradually cooler, so that there was little prospect of vapors
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accumulating in the atmosphere; and nothing more than a few cirri,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost transparent, veiled here and there the clear azure of the sky.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Throughout the day the pale rays of the sun, apparently lessened in its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: magnitude, cast only faint and somewhat uncertain shadows; but at night
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the stars shone with surpassing brilliancy. Of the planets, some, it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observed, seemed to be fading away in remote distance. This was the case
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with Mars, Venus, and that unknown orb which was moving in the orbit of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the minor planets; but Jupiter, on the other hand, had assumed splendid
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proportions; Saturn was superb in its luster, and Uranus, which hitherto
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had been imperceptible without a telescope was pointed out by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope, plainly visible to the naked eye. The inference was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irresistible that Gallia was receding from the sun, and traveling far
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: away across the planetary regions.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 24th of February, after following the sinuous course of what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: before the date of the convulsion had been the coast line of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: department of Var, and after a fruitless search for Hyeres, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: peninsula of St. Tropez, the Lerius Islands, and the gulfs of Cannes and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Jouar, the _Dobryna_ arrived upon the site of the Cape of Antibes.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Here, quite unexpectedly, the explorers made the discovery that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: massive wall of cliff had been rent from the top to the bottom by a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: narrow rift, like the dry bed of a mountain torrent, and at the base of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the opening, level with the sea, was a little strand upon which there
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was just space enough for their boat to be hauled up.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Joy! joy!" shouted Servadac, half beside himself with ecstasy; "we can
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: land at last!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff and the lieutenant were scarcely less impatient than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the captain, and little needed his urgent and repeated solicitations:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Come on! Quick! Come on! no time to lose!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was half-past seven in the morning, when they set their foot upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this untried land. The bit of strand was only a few square yards in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: area, quite a narrow strip. Upon it might have been recognized
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some fragments of that agglutination of yellow limestone which is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: characteristic of the coast of Provence. But the whole party was far
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: too eager to wait and examine these remnants of the ancient shore; they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hurried on to scale the heights.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The narrow ravine was not only perfectly dry, but manifestly had never
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been the bed of any mountain torrent. The rocks that rested at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bottom--just as those which formed its sides--were of the same lamellous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: formation as the entire coast, and had not hitherto been subject to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disaggregation which the lapse of time never fails to work. A skilled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: geologist would probably have been able to assign them their proper
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scientific classification, but neither Servadac, Timascheff, nor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the lieutenant could pretend to any acquaintance with their specific
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: character.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although, however, the bottom of the chasm had never as yet been the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: channel of a stream, indications were not wanting that at some future
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: time it would be the natural outlet of accumulated waters; for already,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in many places, thin layers of snow were glittering upon the surface of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the fractured rocks, and the higher the elevation that was gained, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more these layers were found to increase in area and in depth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Here is a trace of fresh water, the first that Gallia has exhibited,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: said the count to his companions, as they toiled up the precipitous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: path.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And probably," replied the lieutenant, "as we ascend we shall find not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only snow but ice. We must suppose this Gallia of ours to be a sphere,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and if it is so, we must now be very close to her Arctic regions; it is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: true that her axis is not so much inclined as to prolong day and night
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as at the poles of the earth, but the rays of the sun must reach us here
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only very obliquely, and the cold, in all likelihood, will be intense."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "So cold, do you think," asked Servadac, "that animal life must be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extinct?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I do not say that, captain," answered the lieutenant; "for, however
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: far our little world may be removed from the sun, I do not see why its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: temperature should fall below what prevails in those outlying regions
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beyond our system where sky and air are not." "And what temperature may
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that be?" inquired the captain with a shudder.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Fourier estimates that even in those vast unfathomable tracts, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: temperature never descends lower than 60 degrees," said Procope.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Sixty! Sixty degrees below zero!" cried the count. "Why, there's not a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Russian could endure it!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I beg your pardon, count. It is placed on record that the English
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _have_ survived it, or something quite approximate, upon their Arctic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: expeditions. When Captain Parry was on Melville Island, he knew the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thermometer to fall to 56 degrees," said Procope.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As the explorers advanced, they seemed glad to pause from time to time,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that they might recover their breath; for the air, becoming more and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more rarefied, made respiration somewhat difficult and the ascent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fatiguing. Before they had reached an altitude of 600 feet they noticed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a sensible diminution of the temperature; but neither cold nor fatigue
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deterred them, and they were resolved to persevere. Fortunately, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deep striae or furrows in the surface of the rocks that made the bottom
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the ravine in some degree facilitated their progress, but it was not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: until they had been toiling up for two hours more that they succeeded in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reaching the summit of the cliff.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Eagerly and anxiously did they look around. To the south there was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nothing but the sea they had traversed; to the north, nothing but one
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: drear, inhospitable stretch.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac could not suppress a cry of dismay. Where was his beloved
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: France? Had he gained this arduous height only to behold the rocks
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carpeted with ice and snow, and reaching interminably to the far-off
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: horizon? His heart sank within him.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The whole region appeared to consist of nothing but the same strange,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: uniform mineral conglomerate, crystallized into regular hexagonal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prisms. But whatever was its geological character, it was only too
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: evident that it had entirely replaced the former soil, so that not a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vestige of the old continent of Europe could be discerned. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lovely scenery of Provence, with the grace of its rich and undulating
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: landscape; its gardens of citrons and oranges rising tier upon tier
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the deep red soil--all, all had vanished. Of the vegetable kingdom,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there was not a single representative; the most meager of Arctic plants,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the most insignificant of lichens, could obtain no hold upon that stony
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: waste. Nor did the animal world assert the feeblest sway. The mineral
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: kingdom reigned supreme.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac's deep dejection was in strange contrast to his general
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hilarity. Silent and tearful, he stood upon an ice-bound rock, straining
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his eyes across the boundless vista of the mysterious territory. "It
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cannot be!" he exclaimed. "We must somehow have mistaken our bearings.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: True, we have encountered this barrier; but France is there beyond! Yes,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: France is _there!_ Come, count, come! By all that's pitiful, I entreat
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you, come and explore the farthest verge of the ice-bound track!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He pushed onwards along the rugged surface of the rock, but had not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proceeded far before he came to a sudden pause. His foot had come in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: contact with something hard beneath the snow, and, stooping down, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: picked up a little block of stony substance, which the first glance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revealed to be of a geological character altogether alien to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: universal rocks around. It proved to be a fragment of dis-colored
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: marble, on which several letters were inscribed, of which the only part
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at all decipherable was the syllable "Vil."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Vil--Villa!" he cried out, in his excitement dropping the marble, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was broken into atoms by the fall.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: What else could this fragment be but the sole surviving remnant of some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sumptuous mansion that once had stood on this unrivaled site? Was it not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the residue of some edifice that had crowned the luxuriant headland of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Antibes, overlooking Nice, and commanding the gorgeous panorama that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: embraced the Maritime Alps and reached beyond Monaco and Mentone to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Italian height of Bordighera? And did it not give in its sad and too
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: convincing testimony that Antibes itself had been involved in the great
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: destruction? Servadac gazed upon the shattered marble, pensive and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disheartened.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff laid his hand kindly on the captain's shoulder, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: said, "My friend, do you not remember the motto of the old Hope family?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He shook his head mournfully.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "_Orbe fracto, spes illoesa_," continued the count--"Though the world be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shattered, hope is unimpaired."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac smiled faintly, and replied that he felt rather compelled to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: take up the despairing cry of Dante, "All hope abandon, ye who enter
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: here."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nay, not so," answered the count; "for the present at least, let our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: maxim be _Nil desperandum!_"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XVII. A SECOND ENIGMA
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Upon re-embarking, the bewildered explorers began to discuss the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: question whether it would not now be desirable to make their way back
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to Gourbi Island, which was apparently the only spot in their new world
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from which they could hope to derive their future sustenance. Captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac tried to console himself with the reflection that Gourbi Island
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was, after all, a fragment of a French colony, and as such almost like
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a bit of his dear France; and the plan of returning thither was on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: point of being adopted, when Lieutenant Procope remarked that they ought
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to remember that they had not hitherto made an entire circuit of the new
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shores of the sea on which they were sailing.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We have," he said, "neither investigated the northern shore from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: site of Cape Antibes to the strait that brought us to Gibraltar, nor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have we followed the southern shore that stretches from the strait to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Gulf of Cabes. It is the old coast, and not the new, that we have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been tracing; as yet, we cannot say positively that there is no outlet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the south; as yet, we cannot assert that no oasis of the African
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: desert has escaped the catastrophe. Perhaps, even here in the north,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: we may find that Italy and Sicily and the larger islands of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mediterranean may still maintain their existence."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I entirely concur with you," said Count Timascheff. "I quite think we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ought to make our survey of the confines of this new basin as complete
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as possible before we withdraw."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, although he acknowledged the justness of these observations,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could not help pleading that the explorations might be deferred until
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: after a visit had been paid to Gourbi Island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Depend upon it, captain, you are mistaken," replied the lieutenant;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "the right thing to do is to use the _Dobryna_ while she is available."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Available! What do you mean?" asked the count, somewhat taken by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surprise.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I mean," said Procope, "that the farther this Gallia of ours recedes
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the sun, the lower the temperature will fall. It is likely enough,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I think, that before long the sea will be frozen over, and navigation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will be impossible. Already you have learned something of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulties of traversing a field of ice, and I am sure, therefore, you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will acquiesce in my wish to continue our explorations while the water
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is still open."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No doubt you are right, lieutenant," said the count. "We will continue
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: our search while we can for some remaining fragment of Europe. Who
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shall tell whether we may not meet with some more survivors from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: catastrophe, to whom it might be in our power to afford assistance,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: before we go into our winter quarters?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Generous and altogether unselfish as this sentiment really was, it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: obviously to the general interest that they should become acquainted,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and if possible establish friendly relations, with any human inhabitant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: who might be sharing their own strange destiny in being rolled away upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a new planet into the infinitude of space. All difference of race, all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distinction of nationality, must be merged into the one thought that,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: few as they were, they were the sole surviving representatives of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: world which it seemed exceedingly improbable that they would ever see
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: again; and common sense dictated that they were bound to direct all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their energies to insure that their asteroid should at least have a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: united and sympathizing population.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was on the 25th of February that the yacht left the little creek in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which she had taken refuge, and setting off at full steam eastwards,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: she continued her way along the northern shore. A brisk breeze tended to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: increase the keenness of the temperature, the thermometer being, on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an average, about two degrees below zero. Salt water freezes only at a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lower temperature than fresh; the course of the _Dobryna_ was therefore
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unimpeded by ice, but it could not be concealed that there was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: greatest necessity to maintain the utmost possible speed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The nights continued lovely; the chilled condition of the atmosphere
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prevented the formation of clouds; the constellations gleamed forth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with unsullied luster; and, much as Lieutenant Procope, from nautical
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: considerations, might regret the absence of the moon, he could not do
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: otherwise than own that the magnificent nights of Gallia were such as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: must awaken the enthusiasm of an astronomer. And, as if to compensate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for the loss of the moonlight, the heavens were illuminated by a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: superb shower of falling stars, far exceeding, both in number and in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brilliancy, the phenomena which are commonly distinguished as the August
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and November meteors; in fact, Gallia was passing through that meteoric
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ring which is known to lie exterior to the earth's orbit, but almost
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: concentric with it. The rocky coast, its metallic surface reflecting the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: glow of the dazzling luminaries, appeared literally stippled with light,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whilst the sea, as though spattered with burning hailstones, shone with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a phosphorescence that was perfectly splendid. So great, however, was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the speed at which Gallia was receding from the sun, that this meteoric
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: storm lasted scarcely more than four and twenty hours.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Next day the direct progress of the _Dobryna_ was arrested by a long
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: projection of land, which obliged her to turn southwards, until she
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reached what formerly would have been the southern extremity of Corsica.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Of this, however, there was now no trace; the Strait of Bonifacio had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been replaced by a vast expanse of water, which had at first all the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appearance of being utterly desert; but on the following morning the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: explorers unexpectedly sighted a little island, which, unless it should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prove, as was only too likely, to be of recent origin they concluded,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from its situation, must be a portion of the northernmost territory of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sardinia.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The _Dobryna_ approached the land as nearly as was prudent, the boat was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lowered, and in a few minutes the count and Servadac had landed upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the islet, which was a mere plot of meadow land, not much more than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: two acres in extent, dotted here and there with a few myrtle-bushes and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lentisks, interspersed with some ancient olives. Having ascertained, as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they imagined, that the spot was devoid of living creature, they were on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the point of returning to their boat, when their attention was arrested
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by a faint bleating, and immediately afterwards a solitary she-goat came
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bounding towards the shore. The creature had dark, almost black hair,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and small curved horns, and was a specimen of that domestic breed which,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with considerable justice, has gained for itself the title of "the poor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: man's cow." So far from being alarmed at the presence of strangers, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: goat ran nimbly towards them, and then, by its movements and plaintive
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cries, seemed to be enticing them to follow it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Come," said Servadac; "let us see where it will lead us; it is more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than probable it is not alone."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count agreed; and the animal, as if comprehending what was said,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: trotted on gently for about a hundred paces, and stopped in front of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: kind of cave or burrow that was half concealed by a grove of lentisks.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Here a little girl, seven or eight years of age, with rich brown hair
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and lustrous dark eyes, beautiful as one of Murillo's angels, was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: peeping shyly through the branches. Apparently discovering nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the aspect of the strangers to excite her apprehensions, the child
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suddenly gained confidence, darted forwards with outstretched hands, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in a voice, soft and melodious as the language which she spoke, said in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Italian:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I like you; you will not hurt me, will you?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hurt you, my child?" answered Servadac. "No, indeed; we will be your
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: friends; we will take care of you."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And after a few moments' scrutiny of the pretty maiden, he added:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Tell us your name, little one."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nina!" was the child's reply.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, then, Nina, can you tell us where we are?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "At Madalena, I think," said the little girl; "at least, I know I was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there when that dreadful shock came and altered everything."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count knew that Madalena was close to Caprera, to the north of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sardinia, which had entirely disappeared in the disaster. By dint of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: series of questions, he gained from the child a very intelligent account
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of her experiences. She told him that she had no parents, and had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: employed in taking care of a flock of goats belonging to one of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: landowners, when one day, all of a sudden, everything around her, except
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this little piece of land, had been swallowed up, and that she and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Marzy, her pet goat, had been left quite alone. She went on to say that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at first she had been very frightened; but when she found that the earth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: did not shake any more, she had thanked the great God, and had soon made
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: herself very happy living with Marzy. She had enough food, she said, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had been waiting for a boat to fetch her, and now a boat had come and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: she was quite ready to go away; only they must let her goat go with her:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they would both like so much to get back to the old farm.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Here, at least, is one nice little inhabitant of Gallia," said Captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, as he caressed the child and conducted her to the boat.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Half an hour later, both Nina and Marzy were safely quartered on board
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the yacht. It is needless to say that they received the heartiest of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: welcomes. The Russian sailors, ever superstitious, seemed almost to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: regard the coming of the child as the appearance of an angel; and,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: incredible as it may seem, more than one of them wondered whether she
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had wings, and amongst themselves they commonly referred to her as "the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little Madonna."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Soon out of sight of Madalena, the _Dobryna_ for some hours held a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: southeasterly course along the shore, which here was fifty leagues in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: advance of the former coast-line of Italy, demonstrating that a new
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: continent must have been formed, substituted as it were for the old
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: peninsula, of which not a vestige could be identified. At a latitude
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: corresponding with the latitude of Rome, the sea took the form of a deep
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gulf, extending back far beyond the site of the Eternal City; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast making a wide sweep round to the former position of Calabria, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: jutting far beyond the outline of "the boot," which Italy resembles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But the beacon of Messina was not to be discerned; no trace, indeed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: survived of any portion of Sicily; the very peak of Etna, 11,000 feet as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it had reared itself above the level of the sea, had vanished utterly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Another sixty leagues to the south, and the _Dobryna_ sighted the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entrance of the strait which had afforded her so providential a refuge
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the tempest, and had conducted her to the fragmentary relic of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gibraltar. Hence to the Gulf of Cabes had been already explored, and as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it was universally allowed that it was unnecessary to renew the search
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in that direction, the lieutenant started off in a transverse course,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: towards a point hitherto uninvestigated. That point was reached on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 3rd of March, and thence the coast was continuously followed, as it led
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: through what had been Tunis, across the province of Constantine, away
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the oasis of Ziban; where, taking a sharp turn, it first reached a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: latitude of 32 degrees, and then returned again, thus forming a sort
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of irregular gulf, enclosed by the same unvarying border of mineral
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: concrete. This colossal boundary then stretched away for nearly 150
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: leagues over the Sahara desert, and, extending to the south of Gourbi
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Island, occupied what, if Morocco had still existed, would have been its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: natural frontier.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Adapting her course to these deviations of the coastline, the _Dobryna_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was steering northwards, and had barely reached the limit of the bay,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: when the attention of all on board was arrested by the phenomenon of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: volcano, at least 3,000 feet high, its crater crowned with smoke, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: occasionally was streaked by tongues of flame.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A burning mountain!" they exclaimed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Gallia, then, has some internal heat," said Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And why not, captain?" rejoined the lieutenant. "If our asteroid has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carried with it a portion of the old earth's atmosphere, why should it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not likewise retain something of its central fire?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah, well!" said the captain, shrugging his shoulders, "I dare say
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there is caloric enough in our little world to supply the wants of its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: population."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff interrupted the silence that followed this conversation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by saying, "And now, gentlemen, as our course has brought us on our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: way once more towards Gibraltar, what do you say to our renewing our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: acquaintance with the Englishmen? They will be interested in the result
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of our voyage."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "For my part," said Servadac, "I have no desire that way. They know
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: where to find Gourbi Island; they can betake themselves thither just
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: when they please. They have plenty of provisions. If the water freezes,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 120 leagues is no very great distance. The reception they gave us was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not so cordial that we need put ourselves out of the way to repeat our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: visit."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What you say is too true," replied the count. "I hope we shall show
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them better manners when they condescend to visit us."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ay," said Servadac, "we must remember that we are all one people now;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no longer Russian, French, or English. Nationality is extinct."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am sadly afraid, however," continued the count, "that an Englishman
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will be an Englishman ever."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes," said the captain, "that is always their failing."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And thus all further thought of making their way again to the little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: garrison of Gibraltar was abandoned.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But even if their spirit of courtesy had disposed them to renew their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: acquaintance with the British officers, there were two circumstances
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that just then would have rendered such a proposal very unadvisable. In
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the first place, Lieutenant Procope was convinced that it could not be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: much longer now before the sea would be entirely frozen; and, besides
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this, the consumption of their coal, through the speed they had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: maintained, had been so great that there was only too much reason
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to fear that fuel would fail them. Anyhow, the strictest economy was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: necessary, and it was accordingly resolved that the voyage should not be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: much prolonged. Beyond the volcanic peak, moreover, the waters seemed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: expand into a boundless ocean, and it might be a thing full of risk to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be frozen up while the yacht was so inadequately provisioned. Taking
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all these things into account, it was agreed that further investigations
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should be deferred to a more favorable season, and that, without delay,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the _Dobryna_ should return to Gourbi Island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This decision was especially welcome to Hector Servadac, who, throughout
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the whole of the last five weeks, had been agitated by much anxious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thought on account of the faithful servant he had left behind.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The transit from the volcano to the island was not long, and was marked
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by only one noticeable incident. This was the finding of a second
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mysterious document, in character precisely similar to what they had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: found before. The writer of it was evidently engaged upon a calculation,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: probably continued from day to day, as to the motions of the planet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia upon its orbit, and committing the results of his reckonings to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the waves as the channel of communication.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Instead of being enclosed in a telescope-case, it was this time secured
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in a preserved-meat tin, hermetically sealed, and stamped with the same
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: initials on the wax that fastened it. The greatest care was used in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: opening it, and it was found to contain the following message:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Gallia Ab sole, au 1 mars, dist. 78,000,000 l.! Chemin parcouru de fev.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a mars: 59,000,000 1.! _Va bene! All right! Nil desperandum!_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Enchante!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Another enigma!" exclaimed Servadac; "and still no intelligible
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: signature, and no address. No clearing up of the mystery!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I have no doubt, in my own mind," said the count, "that it is one of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: series. It seems to me probable that they are being sent broadcast upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the sea."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I wonder where the hare-brained _savant_ that writes them can be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: living?" observed Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very likely he may have met with the fate of AEsop's abstracted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astronomer, who found himself at the bottom of a well."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ay; but where _is_ that well?" demanded the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This was a question which the count was incapable of settling; and they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could only speculate afresh as to whether the author of the riddles was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dwelling upon some solitary island, or, like themselves, was navigating
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the waters of the new Mediterranean. But they could detect nothing to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: guide them to a definite decision.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After thoughtfully regarding the document for some time. Lieutenant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Procope proceeded to observe that he believed the paper might be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: considered as genuine, and accordingly, taking its statements as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reliable, he deduced two important conclusions: first, that whereas,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the month of January, the distance traveled by the planet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: (hypothetically called Gallia) had been recorded as 82,000,000 leagues,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the distance traveled in February was only 59,000,000 leagues--a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difference of 23,000,000 leagues in one month; secondly, that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distance of the planet from the sun, which on the 15th of February had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been 59,000,000 leagues, was on the 1st of March 78,000,000 leagues--an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: increase of 19,000,000 leagues in a fortnight. Thus, in proportion as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia receded from the sun, so did the rate of speed diminish by which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: she traveled along her orbit; facts to be observed in perfect conformity
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the known laws of celestial mechanism.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And your inference?" asked the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "My inference," replied the lieutenant, "is a confirmation of my surmise
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that we are following an orbit decidedly elliptical, although we have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not yet the material to determine its eccentricity."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "As the writer adheres to the appellation of Gallia, do you not think,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: asked the count, "that we might call these new waters the Gallian Sea?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "There can be no reason to the contrary, count," replied the lieutenant;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "and as such I will insert it upon my new chart."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Our friend," said Servadac, "seems to be more and more gratified
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the condition of things; not only has he adopted our motto, '_Nil
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: desperandum!_' but see how enthusiastically he has wound up with his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: '_Enchante!_'"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The conversation dropped.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A few hours later the man on watch announced that Gourbi Island was in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sight.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XVIII. AN UNEXPECTED POPULATION
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The _Dobryna_ was now back again at the island. Her cruise had lasted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the 31st of January to the 5th of March, a period of thirty-five
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: days (for it was leap year), corresponding to seventy days as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accomplished by the new little world.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Many a time during his absence Hector Servadac had wondered how his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: present vicissitudes would end, and he had felt some misgivings as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to whether he should ever again set foot upon the island, and see
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his faithful orderly, so that it was not without emotion that he had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approached the coast of the sole remaining fragment of Algerian soil.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But his apprehensions were groundless; Gourbi Island was just as he had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: left it, with nothing unusual in its aspect, except that a very peculiar
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cloud was hovering over it, at an altitude of little more than a hundred
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: feet. As the yacht approached the shore, this cloud appeared to rise and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fall as if acted upon by some invisible agency, and the captain, after
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: watching it carefully, perceived that it was not an accumulation of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vapors at all, but a dense mass of birds packed as closely together as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a swarm of herrings, and uttering deafening and discordant cries,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: amidst which from time to time the noise of the report of a gun could be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: plainly distinguished.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The _Dobryna_ signalized her arrival by firing her cannon, and dropped
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: anchor in the little port of the Shelif. Almost within a minute Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was seen running, gun in hand, towards the shore; he cleared the last
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ridge of rocks at a single bound, and then suddenly halted. For a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: few seconds he stood motionless, his eyes fixed, as if obeying the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: instructions of a drill sergeant, on a point some fifteen yards distant,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his whole attitude indicating submission and respect; but the sight
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the captain, who was landing, was too much for his equanimity, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: darting forward, he seized his master's hand and covered it with kisses.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Instead, however, of uttering any expressions of welcome or rejoicing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at the captain's return, Ben Zoof broke out into the most vehement
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ejaculations.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Thieves, captain! beastly thieves! Bedouins! pirates! devils!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why, Ben Zoof, what's the matter?" said Servadac soothingly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "They are thieves! downright, desperate thieves! those infernal birds!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: That's what's the matter. It is a good thing you have come. Here have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I for a whole month been spending my powder and shot upon them, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more I kill them, the worse they get; and yet, if I were to leave them
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: alone, we should not have a grain of corn upon the island."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was soon evident that the orderly had only too much cause for alarm.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The crops had ripened rapidly during the excessive heat of January, when
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the orbit of Gallia was being traversed at its perihelion, and were now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exposed to the depredations of many thousands of birds; and although
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a goodly number of stacks attested the industry of Ben Zoof during
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the time of the _Dobryna_'s voyage, it was only too apparent that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: portion of the harvest that remained ungathered was liable to the most
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: imminent risk of being utterly devoured. It was, perhaps, only natural
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that this clustered mass of birds, as representing the whole of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: feathered tribe upon the surface of Gallia, should resort to Gourbi
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Island, of which the meadows seemed to be the only spot from which they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could get sustenance at all; but as this sustenance would be obtained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at the expense, and probably to the serious detriment, of the human
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
