title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Confound the knave!" exclaimed Ben Zoof; "he gabbles every tongue under
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the sun!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes," said Servadac; "but whether he speaks French, Russian, Spanish,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: German, or Italian, he is neither more nor less than a Jew."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XX. A LIGHT ON THE HORIZON
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the following day, without giving himself any further concern about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Jew's incredulity, the captain gave orders for the _Hansa_ to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shifted round to the harbor of the Shelif. Hakkabut raised no objection,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not only because he was aware that the move insured the immediate safety
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his tartan, but because he was secretly entertaining the hope that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he might entice away two or three of the _Dobryna's_ crew and make his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: escape to Algiers or some other port.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Operations now commenced for preparing proper winter quarters. Spaniards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and Russians alike joined heartily in the work, the diminution of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: atmospheric pressure and of the force of attraction contributing such
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an increase to their muscular force as materially facilitated all their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: labors.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The first business was to accommodate the building adjacent to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gourbi to the wants of the little colony. Here for the present the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Spaniards were lodged, the Russians retaining their berths upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: yacht, while the Jew was permitted to pass his nights upon the _Hansa_.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This arrangement, however, could be only temporary. The time could not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be far distant when ships' sides and ordinary walls would fail to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: give an adequate protection from the severity of the cold that must
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be expected; the stock of fuel was too limited to keep up a permanent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: supply of heat in their present quarters, and consequently they must
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be driven to seek some other refuge, the internal temperature of which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would at least be bearable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The plan that seemed to commend itself most to their consideration was,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that they should dig out for themselves some subterraneous pits similar
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to "silos," such as are used as receptacles for grain. They presumed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that when the surface of Gallia should be covered by a thick layer of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ice, which is a bad conductor of heat, a sufficient amount of warmth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for animal vitality might still be retained in excavations of this kind.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After a long consultation they failed to devise any better expedient,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and were forced to resign themselves to this species of troglodyte
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: existence.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In one respect they congratulated themselves that they should be better
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: off than many of the whalers in the polar seas, for as it is impossible
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to get below the surface of a frozen ocean, these adventurers have to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seek refuge in huts of wood and snow erected on their ships, which at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: best can give but slight protection from extreme cold; but here, with a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: solid subsoil, the Gallians might hope to dig down a hundred feet or so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and secure for themselves a shelter that would enable them to brave the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hardest severity of climate.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The order, then, was at once given. The work was commenced. A stock of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shovels, mattocks, and pick-axes was brought from the gourbi, and with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof as overseer, both Spanish majos and Russian sailors set to work
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with a will.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was not long, however, before a discovery, more unexpected than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: agreeable, suddenly arrested their labors. The spot chosen for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: excavation was a little to the right of the gourbi, on a slight
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elevation of the soil. For the first day everything went on prosperously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enough; but at a depth of eight feet below the surface, the navvies came
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in contact with a hard surface, upon which all their tools failed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: make the slightest impression. Servadac and the count were at once
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: apprised of the fact, and had little difficulty in recognizing the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: substance that had revealed itself as the very same which composed the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shores as well as the subsoil of the Gallian sea. It evidently formed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the universal substructure of the new asteroid. Means for hollowing it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: failed them utterly. Harder and more resisting than granite, it could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not be blasted by ordinary powder; dynamite alone could suffice to rend
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The disappointment was very great. Unless some means of protection were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: speedily devised, death seemed to be staring them in the face. Were the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: figures in the mysterious documents correct? If so, Gallia must now be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a hundred millions of leagues from the sun, nearly three times the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distance of the earth at the remotest section of her orbit. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: intensity of the solar light and heat, too, was very seriously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diminishing, although Gourbi Island (being on the equator of an orb
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which had its axes always perpendicular to the plane in which it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revolved) enjoyed a position that gave it a permanent summer. But no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: advantage of this kind could compensate for the remoteness of the sun.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The temperature fell steadily; already, to the discomfiture of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little Italian girl, nurtured in sunshine, ice was beginning to form in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the crevices of the rocks, and manifestly the time was impending when
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the sea itself would freeze.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Some shelter must be found before the temperature should fall to 60
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: degrees below zero. Otherwise death was inevitable. Hitherto, for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: last few days, the thermometer had been registering an average of about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 6 degrees below zero, and it had become matter of experience that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stove, although replenished with all the wood that was available, was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: altogether inadequate to effect any sensible mitigation of the severity
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the cold. Nor could any amount of fuel be enough. It was certain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that ere long the very mercury and spirit in the thermometers would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: congealed. Some other resort must assuredly be soon found, or they must
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perish. That was clear.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The idea of betaking themselves to the _Dobryna_ and _Hansa_ could not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for a moment be seriously entertained; not only did the structure of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vessels make them utterly insufficient to give substantial shelter,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but they were totally unfitted to be trusted as to their stability when
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exposed to the enormous pressure of the accumulated ice.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Neither Servadac, nor the count, nor Lieutenant Procope were men to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be easily disheartened, but it could not be concealed that they felt
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: themselves in circumstances by which they were equally harassed and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perplexed. The sole expedient that their united counsel could suggest
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was to obtain a refuge below ground, and _that_ was denied them by the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: strange and impenetrable substratum of the soil; yet hour by hour the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sun's disc was lessening in its dimensions, and although at midday some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: faint radiance and glow were to be distinguished, during the night the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: painfulness of the cold was becoming almost intolerable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mounted upon Zephyr and Galette, the captain and the count scoured the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island in search of some available retreat. Scarcely a yard of ground
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was left unexplored, the horses clearing every obstacle as if they were,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: like Pegasus, furnished with wings. But all in vain. Soundings were made
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: again and again, but invariably with the same result; the rock, hard as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: adamant, never failed to reveal itself within a few feet of the surface
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the ground.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The excavation of any silo being thus manifestly hopeless, there seemed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nothing to be done except to try and render the buildings alongside the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gourbi impervious to frost. To contribute to the supply of fuel, orders
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were given to collect every scrap of wood, dry or green, that the island
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: produced; and this involved the necessity of felling the numerous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: trees that were scattered over the plain. But toil as they might at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accumulation of firewood, Captain Servadac and his companions could not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: resist the conviction that the consumption of a very short period would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exhaust the total stock. And what would happen then?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Studious if possible to conceal his real misgivings, and anxious that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the rest of the party should be affected as little as might be by his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: own uneasiness, Servadac would wander alone about the island, racking
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his brain for an idea that would point the way out of the serious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulty. But still all in vain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: One day he suddenly came upon Ben Zoof, and asked him whether he had no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: plan to propose. The orderly shook his head, but after a few moments'
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pondering, said: "Ah! master, if only we were at Montmartre, we would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: get shelter in the charming stone-quarries."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Idiot!" replied the captain, angrily, "if we were at Montmartre, you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: don't suppose that we should need to live in stone-quarries?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But the means of preservation which human ingenuity had failed to secure
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were at hand from the felicitous provision of Nature herself. It was on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the 10th of March that the captain and Lieutenant Procope started off
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: once more to investigate the northwest corner of the island; on their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: way their conversation naturally was engrossed by the subject of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the dire necessities which only too manifestly were awaiting them. A
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discussion more than usually animated arose between them, for the two
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: men were not altogether of the same mind as to the measures that ought
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to be adopted in order to open the fairest chance of avoiding a fatal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: climax to their exposure; the captain persisted that an entirely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: new abode must be sought, while the lieutenant was equally bent upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: devising a method of some sort by which their present quarters might
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be rendered sufficiently warm. All at once, in the very heat of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: argument, Procope paused; he passed his hand across his eyes, as if to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dispel a mist, and stood, with a fixed gaze centered on a point towards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the south. "What is that?" he said, with a kind of hesitation. "No, I am
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not mistaken," he added; "it is a light on the horizon."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A light!" exclaimed Servadac; "show me where."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Look there!" answered the lieutenant, and he kept pointing steadily in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its direction, until Servadac also distinctly saw the bright speck in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the distance.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It increased in clearness in the gathering shades of evening. "Can it be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a ship?" asked the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "If so, it must be in flames; otherwise we should not be able to see it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so far off," replied Procope.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It does not move," said Servadac; "and unless I am greatly deceived, I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: can hear a kind of reverberation in the air."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For some seconds the two men stood straining eyes and ears in rapt
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attention. Suddenly an idea struck Servadac's mind. "The volcano!" he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cried; "may it not be the volcano that we saw, whilst we were on board
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the _Dobryna?_"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant agreed that it was very probable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Heaven be praised!" ejaculated the captain, and he went on in the tones
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of a keen excitement: "Nature has provided us with our winter quarters;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the stream of burning lava that is flowing there is the gift of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bounteous Providence; it will provide us all the warmth we need. No time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to lose! To-morrow, my dear Procope, to-morrow we will explore it all;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no doubt the life, the heat we want is reserved for us in the heart and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bowels of our own Gallia!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Whilst the captain was indulging in his expressions of enthusiasm,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Procope was endeavoring to collect his thoughts. Distinctly he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remembered the long promontory which had barred the _Dobryna's_ progress
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: while coasting the southern confines of the sea, and which had obliged
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her to ascend northwards as far as the former latitude of Oran; he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remembered also that at the extremity of the promontory there was a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rocky headland crowned with smoke; and now he was convinced that he was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: right in identifying the position, and in believing that the smoke had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: given place to an eruption of flame.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: When Servadac gave him a chance of speaking, he said, "The more I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consider it, captain, the more I am satisfied that your conjecture is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: correct. Beyond a doubt, what we see is the volcano, and to-morrow we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will not fail to visit it."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On returning to the gourbi, they communicated their discovery to Count
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Timascheff only, deeming any further publication of it to be premature.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count at once placed his yacht at their disposal, and expressed his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: intention of accompanying them.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The yacht, I think," said Procope, "had better remain where she is;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the weather is beautifully calm, and the steam-launch will answer our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: purpose better; at any rate, it will convey us much closer to shore than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the schooner."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count replied that the lieutenant was by all means to use his own
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discretion, and they all retired for the night.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Like many other modern pleasure-yachts, the _Dobryna_, in addition to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her four-oar, was fitted with a fast-going little steam-launch, its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: screw being propelled, on the Oriolle system, by means of a boiler,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: small but very effective. Early next morning, this handy little craft
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was sufficiently freighted with coal (of which there was still about ten
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tons on board the _Dobryna_), and manned by nobody except the captain,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the count, and the lieutenant, left the harbor of the Shelif, much to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the bewilderment of Ben Zoof, who had not yet been admitted into the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: secret. The orderly, however, consoled himself with the reflection
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that he had been temporarily invested with the full powers of governor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: general, an office of which he was not a little proud.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The eighteen miles between the island and the headland were made in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: something less than three hours. The volcanic eruption was manifestly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very considerable, the entire summit of the promontory being enveloped
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in flames. To produce so large a combustion either the oxygen of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia's atmosphere had been brought into contact with the explosive
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gases contained beneath her soil, or perhaps, still more probable, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: volcano, like those in the moon, was fed by an internal supply of oxygen
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of her own.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It took more than half an hour to settle on a suitable landing-place.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At length, a small semi-circular creek was discovered among the rocks,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which appeared advantageous, because, if circumstances should so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: require, it would form a safe anchorage for both the _Dobryna_ and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Hansa_.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The launch securely moored, the passengers landed on the side of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: promontory opposite to that on which a torrent of burning lava was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: descending to the sea. With much satisfaction they experienced, as they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approached the mountain, a sensible difference in the temperature, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their spirits could not do otherwise than rise at the prospect of having
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their hopes confirmed, that a deliverance from the threatened calamity
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had so opportunely been found. On they went, up the steep acclivity,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scrambling over its rugged projections, scaling the irregularities of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its gigantic strata, bounding from point to point with the agility of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: chamois, but never alighting on anything except on the accumulation of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the same hexagonal prisms with which they had now become so familiar.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Their exertions were happily rewarded. Behind a huge pyramidal rock they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: found a hole in the mountain-side, like the mouth of a great tunnel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Climbing up to this orifice, which was more than sixty feet above the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: level of the sea, they ascertained that it opened into a long dark
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gallery. They entered and groped their way cautiously along the sides.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A continuous rumbling, that increased as they advanced, made them aware
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that they must be approaching the central funnel of the volcano; their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only fear was lest some insuperable wall of rock should suddenly bar
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their further progress.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac was some distance ahead.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Come on!" he cried cheerily, his voice ringing through the darkness,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "come on! Our fire is lighted! no stint of fuel! Nature provides that!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Let us make haste and warm ourselves!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Inspired by his confidence, the count and the lieutenant advanced
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bravely along the unseen and winding path. The temperature was now at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: least fifteen degrees above zero, and the walls of the gallery were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beginning to feel quite warm to the touch, an indication, not to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: overlooked, that the substance of which the rock was composed was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: metallic in its nature, and capable of conducting heat.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Follow me!" shouted Servadac again; "we shall soon find a regular
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stove!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Onwards they made their way, until at last a sharp turn brought them
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into a sudden flood of light. The tunnel had opened into a vast cavern,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the gloom was exchanged for an illumination that was perfectly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dazzling. Although the temperature was high, it was not in any way
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: intolerable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: One glance was sufficient to satisfy the explorers that the grateful
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: light and heat of this huge excavation were to be attributed to a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: torrent of lava that was rolling downwards to the sea, completely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: subtending the aperture of the cave. Not inaptly might the scene be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: compared to the celebrated Grotto of the Winds at the rear of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: central fall of Niagara, only with the exception that here, instead of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a curtain of rushing water, it was a curtain of roaring flame that hung
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: before the cavern's mouth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Heaven be praised!" cried Servadac, with glad emotion; "here is all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that we hoped for, and more besides!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XXI. WINTER QUARTERS
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The habitation that had now revealed itself, well lighted and thoroughly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: warm, was indeed marvelous. Not only would it afford ample accommodation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for Hector Servadac and "his subjects," as Ben Zoof delighted to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: call them, but it would provide shelter for the two horses, and for a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: considerable number of domestic animals.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This enormous cavern was neither more or less than the common junction
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of nearly twenty tunnels (similar to that which had been traversed by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the explorers), forming ramifications in the solid rock, and the pores,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as it were, by which the internal heat exuded from the heart of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mountain. Here, as long as the volcano retained its activity, every
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: living creature on the new asteroid might brave the most rigorous of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: climates; and as Count Timascheff justly remarked, since it was the only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: burning mountain they had sighted, it was most probably the sole outlet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for Gallia's subterranean fires, and consequently the eruption might
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: continue unchanged for ages to come.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But not a day, not an hour, was to be lost now. The steam-launch
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: returned to Gourbi Island, and preparations were forthwith taken in hand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for conveying man and beast, corn and fodder, across to the volcanic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: headland. Loud and hearty were the acclamations of the little colony,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: especially of the Spaniards, and great was the relief of Nina, when
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac announced to them the discovery of their future domicile; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with requickened energies they labored hard at packing, anxious to reach
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their genial winter quarters without delay.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For three successive days the _Dobryna_, laden to her very gunwale, made
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a transit to and fro. Ben Zoof was left upon the island to superintend
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the stowage of the freight, whilst Servadac found abundant occupation in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: overlooking its disposal within the recesses of the mountain. First
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of all, the large store of corn and fodder, the produce of the recent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: harvest, was landed and deposited in one of the vaults; then, on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 15th, about fifty head of live cattle--bullocks, cows, sheep, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pigs--were conveyed to their rocky stalls. These were saved for the sake
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of preserving the several breeds, the bulk of the island cattle being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: slaughtered, as the extreme severity of the climate insured all meat
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remaining fresh for almost an indefinite period. The winter which they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were expecting would probably be of unprecedented length; it was quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: likely that it would exceed the six months' duration by which many
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: arctic explorers have been tried; but the population of Gallia had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no anxiety in the matter of provisions--their stock was far more than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: adequate; while as for drink, as long as they were satisfied with pure
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: water, a frozen sea would afford them an inexhaustible reservoir.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The need for haste in forwarding their preparations became more and more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: manifest; the sea threatened to be un-navigable very soon, as ice was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: already forming which the noonday sun was unable to melt. And if haste
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were necessary, so also were care, ingenuity, and forethought. It
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was indispensable that the space at their command should be properly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: utilized, and yet that the several portions of the store should all be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: readily accessible.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On further investigation an unexpected number of galleries was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discovered, so that, in fact, the interior of the mountain was like a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vast bee-hive perforated with innumerable cells; and in compliment to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the little Italian it was unanimously voted by the colony that their new
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: home should be called "Nina's Hive."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The first care of Captain Servadac was to ascertain how he could make
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the best possible use of the heat which nature had provided for them
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so opportunely and with so lavish a hand. By opening fresh vents in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: solid rock (which by the action of the heat was here capable of fissure)
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the stream of burning lava was diverted into several new channels, where
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it could be available for daily use; and thus Mochel, the _Dobryna's_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cook, was furnished with an admirable kitchen, provided with a permanent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stove, where he was duly installed with all his culinary apparatus.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What a saving of expense it would be," exclaimed Ben Zoof, "if every
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: household could be furnished with its own private volcano!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The large cavern at the general junction of the galleries was fitted up
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as a drawing-room, and arranged with all the best furniture both of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gourbi and of the cabin of the _Dobryna_. Hither was also brought the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: schooner's library, containing a good variety of French and Russian
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: books; lamps were suspended over the different tables; and the walls of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the apartment were tapestried with the sails and adorned with the flags
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: belonging to the yacht. The curtain of fire extending over the opening
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the cavern provided it, as already stated, with light and heat.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The torrent of lava fell into a small rock-bound basin that had no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: apparent communication with the sea, and was evidently the aperture of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a deep abyss, of which the waters, heated by the descent of the eruptive
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: matter, would no doubt retain their liquid condition long after the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallian Sea had become a sheet of ice.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A small excavation to the left of the common hall was allotted for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the special use of Servadac and the count; another on the right was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appropriated to the lieutenant and Ben Zoof; whilst a third recess,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: immediately at the back, made a convenient little chamber for Nina. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Spaniards and the Russian sailors took up their sleeping-quarters in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: adjacent galleries, and found the temperature quite comfortable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Such were the internal arrangements of Nina's Hive, the refuge where
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the little colony were full of hope that they would be able to brave
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the rigors of the stern winter-time that lay before them--a winter-time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: during which Gallia might possibly be projected even to the orbit of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Jupiter, where the temperature would not exceed one twenty-fifth of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: normal winter temperature of the earth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The only discontented spirit was Isaac Hakkabut. Throughout all the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: preparations which roused even the Spaniards to activity, the Jew,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: still incredulous and deaf to every representation of the true state of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: things, insisted upon remaining in the creek at Gourbi Island; nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could induce him to leave his tartan, where, like a miser, he would keep
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: guard over his precious cargo, ever grumbling and growling, but with his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: weather-eye open in the hope of catching sight of some passing sail. It
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: must be owned that the whole party were far from sorry to be relieved
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his presence; his uncomely figure and repulsive countenance was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a perpetual bugbear. He had given out in plain terms that he did not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: intend to part with any of his property, except for current money, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, equally resolute, had strictly forbidden any purchases to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made, hoping to wear out the rascal's obstinacy.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hakkabut persistently refused to credit the real situation; he could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not absolutely deny that some portions of the terrestrial globe had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: undergone a certain degree of modification, but nothing could bring him
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to believe that he was not, sooner or later, to resume his old line of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: business in the Mediterranean. With his wonted distrust of all with whom
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he came in contact, he regarded every argument that was urged upon him
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only as evidence of a plot that had been devised to deprive him of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: goods. Repudiating, as he did utterly, the hypothesis that a fragment
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had become detached from the earth, he scanned the horizon for hours
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: together with an old telescope, the case of which had been patched up
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: till it looked like a rusty stove-pipe, hoping to descry the passing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: trader with which he might effect some bartering upon advantageous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: terms.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At first he professed to regard the proposed removal into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: winter-quarters as an attempt to impose upon his credulity; but the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frequent voyages made by the _Dobryna_ to the south, and the repeated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consignments of corn and cattle, soon served to make him aware that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac and his companions were really contemplating a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: departure from Gourbi Island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The movement set him thinking. What, he began to ask himself--what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: if all that was told him was true? What if this sea was no longer
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Mediterranean? What if he should never again behold his German
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fatherland? What if his marts for business were gone for ever? A vague
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: idea of ruin began to take possession of his mind: he must yield
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to necessity; he must do the best he could. As the result of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cogitations, he occasionally left his tartan and made a visit to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shore. At length he endeavored to mingle with the busy group, who were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hurrying on their preparations; but his advances were only met by jeers
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and scorn, and, ridiculed by all the rest, he was fain to turn his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attention to Ben Zoof, to whom he offered a few pinches of tobacco.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No, old Zebulon," said Ben Zoof, steadily refusing the gift, "it is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: against orders to take anything from you. Keep your cargo to yourself;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eat and drink it all if you can; we are not to touch it."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Finding the subordinates incorruptible, Isaac determined to go to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fountain-head. He addressed himself to Servadac, and begged him to tell
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: him the whole truth, piteously adding that surely it was unworthy of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: French officer to deceive a poor old man like himself.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Tell you the truth, man!" cried Servadac. "Confound it, I have told
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you the truth twenty times. Once for all, I tell you now, you have left
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: yourself barely time enough to make your escape to yonder mountain."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "God and Mahomet have mercy on me!" muttered the Jew, whose creed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frequently assumed a very ambiguous character.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I will tell you what," continued the captain--"you shall have a few men
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to work the _Hansa_ across, if you like."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But I want to go to Algiers," whimpered Hakkabut.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How often am I to tell you that Algiers is no longer in existence? Only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: say yes or no--are you coming with us into winter-quarters?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "God of Israel! what is to become of all my property?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But, mind you," continued the captain, not heeding the interruption,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "if you do not choose voluntarily to come with us, I shall have the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Hansa_, by my orders, removed to a place of safety. I am not going
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to let your cursed obstinacy incur the risk of losing your cargo
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: altogether."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Merciful Heaven! I shall be ruined!" moaned Isaac, in despair.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You are going the right way to ruin yourself, and it would serve you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: right to leave you to your own devices. But be off! I have no more to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: say."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And, turning contemptuously on his heel, Servadac left the old man
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vociferating bitterly, and with uplifted hands protesting vehemently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: against the rapacity of the Gentiles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: By the 20th all preliminary arrangements were complete, and everything
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ready for a final departure from the island. The thermometer stood on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an average at 8 degrees below zero, and the water in the cistern was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: completely frozen. It was determined, therefore, for the colony to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: embark on the following day, and take up their residence in Nina's Hive.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A final consultation was held about the _Hansa_. Lieutenant Procope
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pronounced his decided conviction that it would be impossible for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tartan to resist the pressure of the ice in the harbor of the Shelif,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and that there would be far more safety in the proximity of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: volcano. It was agreed on all hands that the vessel must be shifted; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accordingly orders were given, four Russian sailors were sent on board,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and only a few minutes elapsed after the _Dobryna_ had weighed anchor,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: before the great lateen sail of the tartan was unfurled, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "shop-ship," as Ben Zoof delighted to call it, was also on her way to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the southward.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Long and loud were the lamentations of the Jew. He kept exclaiming that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he had given no orders, that he was being moved against his will, that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he had asked for no assistance, and needed none; but it required no very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: keen discrimination to observe that all along there was a lurking gleam
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of satisfaction in his little gray eyes, and when, a few hours later, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: found himself securely anchored, and his property in a place of safety,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he quite chuckled with glee.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "God of Israel!" he said in an undertone, "they have made no charge; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: idiots have piloted me here for nothing."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For nothing! His whole nature exulted in the consciousness that he was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enjoying a service that had been rendered gratuitously.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Destitute of human inhabitants, Gourbi Island was now left to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tenancy of such birds and beasts as had escaped the recent promiscuous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: slaughter. Birds, indeed, that had migrated in search of warmer shores,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had returned, proving that this fragment of the French colony was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only shred of land that could yield them any sustenance; but their life
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: must necessarily be short. It was utterly impossible that they could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: survive the cold that would soon ensue.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The colony took possession of their new abode with but few formalities.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Everyone, however, approved of all the internal arrangements of Nina's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hive, and were profuse in their expressions of satisfaction at finding
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: themselves located in such comfortable quarters. The only malcontent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was Hakkabut; he had no share in the general enthusiasm, refused even
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to enter or inspect any of the galleries, and insisted on remaining on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: board his tartan.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "He is afraid," said Ben Zoof, "that he will have to pay for his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lodgings. But wait a bit; we shall see how he stands the cold out there;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the frost, no doubt, will drive the old fox out of his hole."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Towards evening the pots were set boiling, and a bountiful supper, to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which all were invited, was spread in the central hall. The stores of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the _Dobryna_ contained some excellent wine, some of which was broached
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to do honor to the occasion. The health of the governor general was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: drunk, as well as the toast "Success to his council," to which Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was called upon to return thanks. The entertainment passed off merrily.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Spaniards were in the best of spirits; one of them played the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: guitar, another the castanets, and the rest joined in a ringing chorus.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof contributed the famous Zouave refrain, well known throughout
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the French army, but rarely performed in finer style than by this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _virtuoso:_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _"Misti goth dar dar tire lyre!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Flic! floc! flac! lirette, lira!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Far la rira,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Tour tala rire,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Tour la Ribaud,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ricandeau,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sans repos, repit, repit, repos, ris pot, ripette!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Si vous attrapez mon refrain,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Fameux vous etes."_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The concert was succeeded by a ball, unquestionably the first that had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ever taken place in Gallia. The Russian sailors exhibited some of their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: national dances, which gained considerable applause, even although they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: followed upon the marvelous fandangos of the Spaniards. Ben Zoof, in
