title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his turn, danced a _pas seul_ (often performed in the Elysee Montmartre)
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with an elegance and vigor that earned many compliments from Negrete.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was nine o'clock before the festivities came to an end, and by that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: time the company, heated by the high temperature of the hall, and by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their own exertions, felt the want of a little fresh air. Accordingly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the greater portion of the party, escorted by Ben Zoof, made their way
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into one of the adjacent galleries that led to the shore. Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the count and lieutenant, did not follow immediately; but shortly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: afterwards they proceeded to join them, when on their way they were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: startled by loud cries from those in advance.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Their first impression was that they were cries of distress, and they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were greatly relieved to find that they were shouts of delight, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the dryness and purity of the atmosphere caused to re-echo like a volley
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of musketry.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Reaching the mouth of the gallery, they found the entire group pointing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with eager interest to the sky.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, Ben Zoof," asked the captain, "what's the matter now?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh, your Excellency," ejaculated the orderly, "look there! look there!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The moon! the moon's come back!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And, sure enough, what was apparently the moon was rising above the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mists of evening.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XXII. A FROZEN OCEAN
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The moon! She had disappeared for weeks; was she now returning? Had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: she been faithless to the earth? and had she now approached to be a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: satellite of the new-born world?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Impossible!" said Lieutenant Procope; "the earth is millions and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: millions of leagues away, and it is not probable that the moon has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ceased to revolve about her."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why not?" remonstrated Servadac. "It would not be more strange than the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: other phenomena which we have lately witnessed. Why should not the moon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have fallen within the limits of Gallia's attraction, and become her
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: satellite?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Upon that supposition," put in the count, "I should think that it would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be altogether unlikely that three months would elapse without our seeing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Quite incredible!" continued Procope. "And there is another thing which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: totally disproves the captain's hypothesis; the magnitude of Gallia
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is far too insignificant for her power of attraction to carry off the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moon."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But," persisted Servadac, "why should not the same convulsion that tore
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: us away from the earth have torn away the moon as well? After wandering
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: about as she would for a while in the solar regions, I do not see why
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: she should not have attached herself to us."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant repeated his conviction that it was not likely.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But why not?" again asked Servadac impetuously.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Because, I tell you, the mass of Gallia is so inferior to that of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moon, that Gallia would become the moon's satellite; the moon could not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: possibly become hers."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Assuming, however," continued Servadac, "such to be the case--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am afraid," said the lieutenant, interrupting him, "that I cannot
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: assume anything of the sort even for a moment."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac smiled good-humoredly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I confess you seem to have the best of the argument, and if Gallia had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: become a satellite of the moon, it would not have taken three months to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: catch sight of her. I suppose you are right."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: While this discussion had been going on, the satellite, or whatever it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: might be, had been rising steadily above the horizon, and had reached a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: position favorable for observation. Telescopes were brought, and it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very soon ascertained, beyond a question, that the new luminary was not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the well-known Phoebe of terrestrial nights; it had no feature in common
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the moon. Although it was apparently much nearer to Gallia than the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moon to the earth, its superficies was hardly one-tenth as large, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so feebly did it reflect the light of the remote sun, that it scarcely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: emitted radiance enough to extinguish the dim luster of stars of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eighth magnitude. Like the sun, it had risen in the west, and was now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at its full. To mistake its identity with the moon was absolutely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impossible; not even Servadac could discover a trace of the seas,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: chasms, craters, and mountains which have been so minutely delineated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in lunar charts, and it could not be denied that any transient hope
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that had been excited as to their once again being about to enjoy the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: peaceful smiles of "the queen of night" must all be resigned.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff finally suggested, though somewhat doubtfully, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: question of the probability that Gallia, in her course across the zone
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the minor planets, had carried off one of them; but whether it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was one of the 169 asteroids already included in the astronomical
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: catalogues, or one previously unknown, he did not presume to determine.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The idea to a certain extent was plausible, inasmuch as it has been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ascertained that several of the telescopic planets are of such small
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dimensions that a good walker might make a circuit of them in four and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: twenty hours; consequently Gallia, being of superior volume, might be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: supposed capable of exercising a power of attraction upon any of these
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miniature microcosms.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The first night in Nina's Hive passed without special incident; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: next morning a regular scheme of life was definitely laid down. "My lord
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: governor," as Ben Zoof until he was peremptorily forbidden delighted to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: call Servadac, had a wholesome dread of idleness and its consequences,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and insisted upon each member of the party undertaking some special
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: duty to fulfill. There was plenty to do. The domestic animals required
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a great deal of attention; a supply of food had to be secured and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: preserved; fishing had to be carried on while the condition of the sea
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would allow it; and in several places the galleries had to be further
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: excavated to render them more available for use. Occupation, then, need
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: never be wanting, and the daily round of labor could go on in orderly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: routine.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A perfect concord ruled the little colony. The Russians and Spaniards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: amalgamated well, and both did their best to pick up various scraps
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of French, which was considered the official language of the place.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac himself undertook the tuition of Pablo and Nina, Ben Zoof being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their companion in play-hours, when he entertained them with enchanting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stories in the best Parisian French, about "a lovely city at the foot of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a mountain," where he always promised one day to take them.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The end of March came, but the cold was not intense to such a degree
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as to confine any of the party to the interior of their resort; several
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: excursions were made along the shore, and for a radius of three or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: four miles the adjacent district was carefully explored. Investigation,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, always ended in the same result; turn their course in whatever
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: direction they would, they found that the country retained everywhere
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its desert character, rocky, barren, and without a trace of vegetation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Here and there a slight layer of snow, or a thin coating of ice arising
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from atmospheric condensation indicated the existence of superficial
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moisture, but it would require a period indefinitely long, exceeding
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: human reckoning, before that moisture could collect into a stream and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: roll downwards over the stony strata to the sea. It seemed at present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: out of their power to determine whether the land upon which they were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so happily settled was an island or a continent, and till the cold was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abated they feared to undertake any lengthened expedition to ascertain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the actual extent of the strange concrete of metallic crystallization.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: By ascending one day to the summit of the volcano, Captain Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the count succeeded in getting a general idea of the aspect of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: country. The mountain itself was an enormous block rising symmetrically
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to a height of nearly 3,000 feet above the level of the sea, in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: form of a truncated cone, of which the topmost section was crowned by a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wreath of smoke issuing continuously from the mouth of a narrow crater.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Under the old condition of terrestrial things, the ascent of this steep
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: acclivity would have been attended with much fatigue, but as the effect
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the altered condition of the law of gravity, the travelers performed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perpetual prodigies in the way of agility, and in little over an hour
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reached the edge of the crater, without more sense of exertion than if
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they had traversed a couple of miles on level ground. Gallia had its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: drawbacks, but it had some compensating advantages.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Telescopes in hand, the explorers from the summit scanned the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surrounding view. Their anticipations had already realized what they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: saw. Just as they expected, on the north, east, and west lay the Gallian
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sea, smooth and motionless as a sheet of glass, the cold having, as it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were, congealed the atmosphere so that there was not a breath of wind.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Towards the south there seemed no limit to the land, and the volcano
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: formed the apex of a triangle, of which the base was beyond the reach of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vision. Viewed even from this height, whence distance would do much
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to soften the general asperity, the surface nevertheless seemed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be bristling with its myriads of hexagonal lamellae, and to present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulties which, to an ordinary pedestrian, would be insurmountable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh for some wings, or else a balloon!" cried Servadac, as he gazed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: around him; and then, looking down to the rock upon which they were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: standing, he added, "We seem to have been transplanted to a soil strange
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enough in its chemical character to bewilder the _savants_ at a museum."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And do you observe, captain," asked the count, "how the convexity
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of our little world curtails our view? See, how circumscribed is the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: horizon!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac replied that he had noticed the same circumstance from the top
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the cliffs of Gourbi Island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes," said the count; "it becomes more and more obvious that ours is a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very tiny world, and that Gourbi Island is the sole productive spot upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its surface. We have had a short summer, and who knows whether we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are not entering upon a winter that may last for years, perhaps for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: centuries?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But we must not mind, count," said Servadac, smiling. "We have agreed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you know, that, come what may, we are to be philosophers."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ay, true, my friend," rejoined the count; "we must be philosophers
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and something more; we must be grateful to the good Protector who has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hitherto befriended us, and we must trust His mercy to the end."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For a few moments they both stood in silence, and contemplated land and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea; then, having given a last glance over the dreary panorama, they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prepared to wend their way down the mountain. Before, however, they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: commenced their descent, they resolved to make a closer examination of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the crater. They were particularly struck by what seemed to them almost
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the mysterious calmness with which the eruption was effected. There was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: none of the wild disorder and deafening tumult that usually accompany
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the discharge of volcanic matter, but the heated lava, rising with a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: uniform gentleness, quietly overran the limits of the crater, like the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: flow of water from the bosom of a peaceful lake. Instead of a boiler
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exposed to the action of an angry fire, the crater rather resembled a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brimming basin, of which the contents were noiselessly escaping. Nor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were there any igneous stones or red-hot cinders mingled with the smoke
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that crowned the summit; a circumstance that quite accorded with the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: absence of the pumice-stones, obsidians, and other minerals of volcanic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: origin with which the base of a burning mountain is generally strewn.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac was of opinion that this peculiarity augured favorably
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for the continuance of the eruption. Extreme violence in physical, as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: well as in moral nature, is never of long duration. The most terrible
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: storms, like the most violent fits of passion, are not lasting; but here
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the calm flow of the liquid fire appeared to be supplied from a source
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that was inexhaustible, in the same way as the waters of Niagara,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gliding on steadily to their final plunge, would defy all effort to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: arrest their course.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Before the evening of this day closed in, a most important change was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: effected in the condition of the Gallian Sea by the intervention of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: human agency. Notwithstanding the increasing cold, the sea, unruffled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as it was by a breath of wind, still retained its liquid state. It is an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: established fact that water, under this condition of absolute stillness,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will remain uncongealed at a temperature several degrees below zero,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whilst experiment, at the same time, shows that a very slight shock will
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: often be sufficient to convert it into solid ice. It had occurred to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac that if some communication could be opened with Gourbi Island,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there would be a fine scope for hunting expeditions. Having this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ultimate object in view, he assembled his little colony upon a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: projecting rock at the extremity of the promontory, and having called
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Nina and Pablo out to him in front, he said: "Now, Nina, do you think
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you could throw something into the sea?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I think I could," replied the child, "but I am sure that Pablo would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: throw it a great deal further than I can."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Never mind, you shall try first."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Putting a fragment of ice into Nina's hand, he addressed himself to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Pablo:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Look out, Pablo; you shall see what a nice little fairy Nina is! Throw,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Nina, throw, as hard as you can."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Nina balanced the piece of ice two or three times in her hand, and threw
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it forward with all her strength.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A sudden thrill seemed to vibrate across the motionless waters to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distant horizon, and the Gallian Sea had become a solid sheet of ice!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XXIII. A CARRIER-PIGEON
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: When, three hours after sunset, on the 23d of March, the Gallian moon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rose upon the western horizon, it was observed that she had entered upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her last quarter. She had taken only four days to pass from syzygy to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quadrature, and it was consequently evident that she would be visible
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for little more than a week at a time, and that her lunation would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accomplished within sixteen days. The lunar months, like the solar
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: days, had been diminished by one-half. Three days later the moon was in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conjunction with the sun, and was consequently lost to view; Ben Zoof,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as the first observer of the satellite, was extremely interested in its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: movements, and wondered whether it would ever reappear.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 26th, under an atmosphere perfectly clear and dry, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thermometer fell to 12 degrees F. below zero. Of the present distance of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia from the sun, and the number of leagues she had traversed since
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the receipt of the last mysterious document, there were no means of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: judging; the extent of diminution in the apparent disc of the sun did
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not afford sufficient basis even for an approximate calculation; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac was perpetually regretting that they could receive no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: further tidings from the anonymous correspondent, whom he persisted in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: regarding as a fellow-countryman.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The solidity of the ice was perfect; the utter stillness of the air at

text: The contrast to the ordinary aspect of polar seas was very remarkable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of a pantomime. Here, on the contrary, the vast white plain was level as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: the desert of Sahara or the Russian steppes; the waters of the Gallian
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: performed prodigies in the art.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This exercise was not only healthful in itself, but it was acknowledged
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The temperature, meanwhile, continued to decrease, and the average
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reading of the thermometer was about 16 degrees F. below zero; the light
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: also diminished in proportion, and all objects appeared to be enveloped
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in a half-defined shadow, as though the sun were undergoing a perpetual
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eclipse. It was not surprising that the effect of this continuously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: overhanging gloom should be to induce a frequent depression of spirits
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: amongst the majority of the little population, exiles as they were from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their mother earth, and not unlikely, as it seemed, to be swept far away
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: community who could bring any scientific judgment to bear upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to arouse the flagging spirits, and to restore a wholesome excitement.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the labors or the amusements of the colony. In spite of the cold,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac had strictly forbidden any communication with him; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At the beginning of April the weather changed. The sky became overcast,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but there was no rise in the temperature. Unlike the polar winters of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth, which ordinarily are affected by atmospheric influence, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
