author: Verne, Jules

text: And as she spoke she pointed to the left wing of the bird. The wing bore
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the faint impress of a postage-stamp, and the one word: "FORMENTERA."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XXIV. A SLEDGE-RIDE
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Formentera was at once recognized by Servadac and the count as the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: name of one of the smallest of the Balearic Islands. It was more than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: probable that the unknown writer had thence sent out the mysterious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: documents, and from the message just come to hand by the carrier-pigeon,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it appeared all but certain that at the beginning of April, a fortnight
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: back, he had still been there. In one important particular the present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: communication differed from those that had preceded it: it was written
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entirely in French, and exhibited none of the ecstatic exclamations in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: other languages that had been remarkable in the two former papers. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: concluding line, with its intimation of failing provisions, amounted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost to an appeal for help. Captain Servadac briefly drew attention
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to these points, and concluded by saying, "My friends, we must, without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: delay, hasten to the assistance of this unfortunate man."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "For my part," said the count, "I am quite ready to accompany you; it is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not unlikely that he is not alone in his distress."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope expressed much surprise. "We must have passed close
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to Formentera," he said, "when we explored the site of the Balearic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Isles; this fragment must be very small; it must be smaller than the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remaining splinter of Gibraltar or Ceuta; otherwise, surely it would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: never have escaped our observation."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "However small it may be," replied Servadac, "we must find it. How far
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: off do you suppose it is?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It must be a hundred and twenty leagues away," said the lieutenant,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thoughtfully; "and I do not quite understand how you would propose to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: get there."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why, on skates of course; no difficulty in that, I should imagine,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: answered Servadac, and he appealed to the count for confirmation of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: opinion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count assented, but Procope looked doubtful.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Your enterprise is generous," he said, "and I should be most unwilling
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to throw any unnecessary obstacle in the way of its execution; but,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pardon me, if I submit to you a few considerations which to my mind
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are very important. First of all, the thermometer is already down to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 22 degrees below zero, and the keen wind from the south is making the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: temperature absolutely unendurable; in the second place, supposing you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: travel at the rate of twenty leagues a day, you would be exposed for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at least six consecutive days; and thirdly, your expedition will be of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: small avail unless you convey provisions not only for yourselves, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for those whom you hope to relieve."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We can carry our own provisions on our backs in knapsacks," interposed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, quickly, unwilling to recognize any difficulty in the way.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Granted that you can," answered the lieutenant, quietly; "but where, on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this level ice-field, will you find shelter in your periods of rest?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: You must perish with cold; you will not have the chance of digging out
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ice-huts like the Esquimaux."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "As to rest," said Servadac, "we shall take none; we shall keep on our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: way continuously; by traveling day and night without intermission, we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shall not be more than three days in reaching Formentera."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Believe me," persisted the lieutenant, calmly, "your enthusiasm is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carrying you too far; the feat you propose is impossible; but even
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conceding the possibility of your success in reaching your destination,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what service do you imagine that you, half-starved and half-frozen
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: yourself, could render to those who are already perishing by want and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exposure? you would only bring them away to die."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The obvious and dispassionate reasoning of the lieutenant could not fail
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to impress the minds of those who listened to him; the impracticability
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the journey became more and more apparent; unprotected on that drear
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: expanse, any traveler must assuredly succumb to the snow-drifts that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were continually being whirled across it. But Hector Servadac, animated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by the generous desire of rescuing a suffering fellow-creature, could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scarcely be brought within the bounds of common sense. Against his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: better judgment he was still bent upon the expedition, and Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: declared himself ready to accompany his master in the event of Count
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Timascheff hesitating to encounter the peril which the undertaking
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: involved. But the count entirely repudiated all idea of shrinking from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what, quite as much as the captain, he regarded as a sacred duty, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: turning to Lieutenant Procope, told him that unless some better plan
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could be devised, he was prepared to start off at once and make the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attempt to skate across to Formentera. The lieutenant, who was lost in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thought, made no immediate reply.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I wish we had a sledge," said Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I dare say that a sledge of some sort could be contrived," said the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: count; "but then we should have no dogs or reindeers to draw it."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why not rough-shoe the two horses?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "They would never be able to endure the cold," objected the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Never mind," said Servadac, "let us get our sledge and put them to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: test. Something must be done!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I think," said Lieutenant Procope, breaking his thoughtful silence,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "that I can tell you of a sledge already provided for your hand, and I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: can suggest a motive power surer and swifter than horses."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What do you mean?" was the eager inquiry.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I mean the _Dobryna_'s yawl," answered the lieutenant; "and I have no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: doubt that the wind would carry her rapidly along the ice."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The idea seemed admirable. Lieutenant Procope was well aware to what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: marvelous perfection the Americans had brought their sail-sledges, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had heard how in the vast prairies of the United States they had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: known to outvie the speed of an express train, occasionally attaining
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a rate of more than a hundred miles an hour. The wind was still blowing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hard from the south, and assuming that the yawl could be propelled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with a velocity of about fifteen or at least twelve leagues an hour, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reckoned that it was quite possible to reach Formentera within twelve
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hours, that is to say, in a single day between the intervals of sunrise
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and sunrise.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The yawl was about twelve feet long, and capable of holding five or six
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: people. The addition of a couple of iron runners would be all that was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: requisite to convert it into an excellent sledge, which, if a sail
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were hoisted, might be deemed certain to make a rapid progress over the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: smooth surface of the ice. For the protection of the passengers it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proposed to erect a kind of wooden roof lined with strong cloth; beneath
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this could be packed a supply of provisions, some warm furs, some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cordials, and a portable stove to be heated by spirits of wine.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: For the outward journey the wind was as favorable as could be desired;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but it was to be apprehended that, unless the direction of the wind
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should change, the return would be a matter of some difficulty; a system
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of tacking might be carried out to a certain degree, but it was not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: likely that the yawl would answer her helm in any way corresponding to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what would occur in the open sea. Captain Servadac, however, would not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: listen to any representation of probable difficulties; the future, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: said, must provide for itself.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The engineer and several of the sailors set vigorously to work, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: before the close of the day the yawl was furnished with a pair of stout
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: iron runners, curved upwards in front, and fitted with a metal scull
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: designed to assist in maintaining the directness of her course; the roof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was put on, and beneath it were stored the provisions, the wraps, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the cooking utensils.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A strong desire was expressed by Lieutenant Procope that he should be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: allowed to accompany Captain Servadac instead of Count Timascheff. It
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was unadvisable for all three of them to go, as, in case of there being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: several persons to be rescued, the space at their command would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quite inadequate. The lieutenant urged that he was the most experienced
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seaman, and as such was best qualified to take command of the sledge
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the management of the sails; and as it was not to be expected that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac would resign his intention of going in person to relieve his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fellow-countryman, Procope submitted his own wishes to the count. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: count was himself very anxious to have his share in the philanthropic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enterprise, and demurred considerably to the proposal; he yielded,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, after a time, to Servadac's representations that in the event
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the expedition proving disastrous, the little colony would need his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: services alike as governor and protector, and overcoming his reluctance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to be left out of the perilous adventure, was prevailed upon to remain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: behind for the general good of the community at Nina's Hive.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At sunrise on the following morning, the 16th of April, Captain Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the lieutenant took their places in the yawl. The thermometer was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more than 20 degrees below zero, and it was with deep emotion that their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: companions beheld them thus embarking upon the vast white plain. Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof's heart was too full for words; Count Timascheff could not forbear
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pressing his two brave friends to his bosom; the Spaniards and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Russian sailors crowded round for a farewell shake of the hand, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little Nina, her great eyes flooded with tears, held up her face for a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: parting kiss. The sad scene was not permitted to be long. The sail was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quickly hoisted, and the sledge, just as if it had expanded a huge white
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wing, was in a little while carried far away beyond the horizon.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Light and unimpeded, the yawl scudded on with incredible speed. Two
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sails, a brigantine and a jib, were arranged to catch the wind to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: greatest advantage, and the travelers estimated that their progress
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would be little under the rate of twelve leagues an hour. The motion of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their novel vehicle was singularly gentle, the oscillation being less
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than that of an ordinary railway-carriage, while the diminished force of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gravity contributed to the swiftness. Except that the clouds of ice-dust
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: raised by the metal runners were an evidence that they had not actually
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: left the level surface of the ice, the captain and lieutenant might
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: again and again have imagined that they were being conveyed through the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: air in a balloon.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope, with his head all muffled up for fear of frost-bite,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: took an occasional peep through an aperture that had been intentionally
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: left in the roof, and by the help of a compass, maintained a proper and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: straight course for Formentera. Nothing could be more dejected than the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: aspect of that frozen sea; not a single living creature relieved the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: solitude; both the travelers, Procope from a scientific point of view,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac from an aesthetic, were alike impressed by the solemnity of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scene, and where the lengthened shadow of the sail cast upon the ice by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the oblique rays of the setting sun had disappeared, and day had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: given place to night, the two men, drawn together as by an involuntary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impulse, mutually held each other's hands in silence.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There had been a new moon on the previous evening; but, in the absence
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of moonlight, the constellations shone with remarkable brilliancy.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The new pole-star close upon the horizon was resplendent, and even had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope been destitute of a compass, he would have had no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulty in holding his course by the guidance of that alone. However
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: great was the distance that separated Gallia from the sun, it was after
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all manifestly insignificant in comparison with the remoteness of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nearest of the fixed stars.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Observing that Servadac was completely absorbed in his own thoughts,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope had leisure to contemplate some of the present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perplexing problems, and to ponder over the true astronomical position.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The last of the three mysterious documents had represented that Gallia,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in conformity with Kepler's second law, had traveled along her orbit
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: during the month of March twenty millions of leagues less than she had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: done in the previous month; yet, in the same time, her distance from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sun had nevertheless been increased by thirty-two millions of leagues.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: She was now, therefore, in the center of the zone of telescopic planets
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that revolve between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter, and had captured
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for herself a satellite which, according to the document, was Nerina,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: one of the asteroids most recently identified. If thus, then, it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: within the power of the unknown writer to estimate with such apparent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certainty Gallia's exact position, was it not likely that his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mathematical calculations would enable him to arrive at some definite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conclusion as to the date at which she would begin again to approach the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sun? Nay, was it not to be expected that he had already estimated, with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sufficient approximation to truth, what was to be the true length of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallian year?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: So intently had they each separately been following their own train of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thought, that daylight reappeared almost before the travelers were aware
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of it. On consulting their instruments, they found that they must have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: traveled close upon a hundred leagues since they started, and they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: resolved to slacken their speed. The sails were accordingly taken in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a little, and in spite of the intensity of the cold, the explorers
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ventured out of their shelter, in order that they might reconnoiter
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the plain, which was apparently as boundless as ever. It was completely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: desert; not so much as a single point of rock relieved the bare
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: uniformity of its surface.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Are we not considerably to the west of Formentera?" asked Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: after examining the chart.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Most likely," replied Procope. "I have taken the same course as I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should have done at sea, and I have kept some distance to windward of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the island; we can bear straight down upon it whenever we like."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Bear down then, now; and as quickly as you can."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The yawl was at once put with her head to the northeast and Captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, in defiance of the icy blast, remained standing at the bow,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his gaze fixed on the horizon.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: All at once his eye brightened.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Look! look!" he exclaimed, pointing to a faint outline that broke the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: monotony of the circle that divided the plain from the sky.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In an instant the lieutenant had seized his telescope.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I see what you mean," said he; "it is a pylone that has been used for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some geodesic survey."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The next moment the sail was filled, and the yawl was bearing down upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the object with inconceivable swiftness, both Captain Servadac and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lieutenant too excited to utter a word. Mile after mile the distance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rapidly grew less, and as they drew nearer the pylone they could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: see that it was erected on a low mass of rocks that was the sole
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: interruption to the dull level of the field of ice. No wreath of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: smoke rose above the little island; it was manifestly impossible, they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conceived, that any human being could there have survived the cold; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sad presentiment forced itself upon their minds that it was a mere cairn
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to which they had been hurrying.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ten minutes later, and they were so near the rock that the lieutenant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: took in his sail, convinced that the impetus already attained would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be sufficient to carry him to the land. Servadac's heart bounded as he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: caught sight of a fragment of blue canvas fluttering in the wind from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the top of the pylone: it was all that now remained of the French
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: national standard. At the foot of the pylone stood a miserable shed, its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shutters tightly closed. No other habitation was to be seen; the entire
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: island was less than a quarter of a mile in circumference; and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conclusion was irresistible that it was the sole surviving remnant of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Formentera, once a member of the Balearic Archipelago.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To leap on shore, to clamber over the slippery stones, and to reach the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cabin was but the work of a few moments. The worm-eaten door was bolted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: on the inside. Servadac began to knock with all his might. No answer.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Neither shouting nor knocking could draw forth a reply.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Let us force it open, Procope!" he said.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The two men put their shoulders to the door, which soon yielded to their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vigorous efforts, and they found themselves inside the shed, and in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost total darkness. By opening a shutter they admitted what daylight
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they could. At first sight the wretched place seemed to be deserted; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little grate contained the ashes of a fire long since extinguished; all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: looked black and desolate. Another instant's investigation, however,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revealed a bed in the extreme corner, and extended on the bed a human
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: form.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Dead!" sighed Servadac; "dead of cold and hunger!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope bent down and anxiously contemplated the body.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No; he is alive!" he said, and drawing a small flask from his pocket he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: poured a few drops of brandy between the lips of the senseless man.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was a faint sigh, followed by a feeble voice, which uttered the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: one word, "Gallia?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, yes! Gallia!" echoed Servadac, eagerly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "My comet, my comet!" said the voice, so low as to be almost inaudible,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the unfortunate man relapsed again into unconsciousness.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Where have I seen this man?" thought Servadac to himself; "his face is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: strangely familiar to me."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But it was no time for deliberation. Not a moment was to be lost in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: getting the unconscious astronomer away from his desolate quarters.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He was soon conveyed to the yawl; his books, his scanty wardrobe, his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: papers, his instruments, and the blackboard which had served for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his calculations, were quickly collected; the wind, by a fortuitous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Providence, had shifted into a favorable quarter; they set their sail
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with all speed, and ere long were on their journey back from Formentera.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Thirty-six hours later, the brave travelers were greeted by the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: acclamations of their fellow-colonists, who had been most anxiously
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: awaiting their reappearance, and the still senseless _savant_, who had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: neither opened his eyes nor spoken a word throughout the journey, was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: safely deposited in the warmth and security of the great hall of Nina's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hive.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: END OF FIRST BOOK
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: BOOK II.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER I. THE ASTRONOMER
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: By the return of the expedition, conveying its contribution from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Formentera, the known population of Gallia was raised to a total of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thirty-six.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On learning the details of his friends' discoveries, Count Timascheff
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: did not hesitate in believing that the exhausted individual who was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lying before him was the author alike of the two unsigned documents
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: picked up at sea, and of the third statement so recently brought to hand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by the carrier-pigeon. Manifestly, he had arrived at some knowledge of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia's movements: he had estimated her distance from the sun; he had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: calculated the diminution of her tangential speed; but there was nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to show that he had arrived at the conclusions which were of the most
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: paramount interest to them all. Had he ascertained the true character of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her orbit? had he established any data from which it would be possible
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to reckon what time must elapse before she would again approach the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The only intelligible words which the astronomer had uttered had been,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "My comet!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To what could the exclamation refer? Was it to be conjectured that a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fragment of the earth had been chipped off by the collision of a comet?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and if so, was it implied that the name of the comet itself was Gallia,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and were they mistaken in supposing that such was the name given by the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _savant_ to the little world that had been so suddenly launched
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into space? Again and again they discussed these questions; but no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: satisfactory answer could be found. The only man who was able to throw
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any light upon the subject was lying amongst them in an unconscious and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: half-dying condition.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Apart from motives of humanity, motives of self-interest made it a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: matter of the deepest concern to restore animation to that senseless
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: form. Ben Zoof, after making the encouraging remark that _savants_ have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as many lives as a cat, proceeded, with Negrete's assistance, to give
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the body such a vigorous rubbing as would have threatened serious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: injury to any ordinary mortal, whilst they administered cordials and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: restoratives from the _Dobryna's_ medical stores powerful enough, one
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: might think, to rouse the very dead.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meanwhile the captain was racking his brain in his exertions to recall
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what were the circumstances of his previous acquaintance with the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Frenchman upon whose features he was gazing; he only grew more and more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: convinced that he had once been familiar with them. Perhaps it was not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: altogether surprising that he had almost forgotten him; he had never
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seen him since the days of his youth, that time of life which, with a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certain show of justice, has been termed the age of ingratitude; for,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in point of fact, the astronomer was none other than Professor Palmyrin
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette, Servadac's old science-master at the Lycee Charlemagne.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After completing his year of elementary studies, Hector Servadac had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entered the school at Saint Cyr, and from that time he and his former
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tutor had never met, so that naturally they would well-nigh pass from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: each other's recollection. One thing, however, on the other hand, might
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conduce to a mutual and permanent impression on their memories; during
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the year at the Lycee, young Servadac, never of a very studious turn
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of mind, had contrived, as the ringleader of a set of like caliber as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself, to lead the poor professor a life of perpetual torment. On the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discovery of each delinquency he would fume and rage in a manner that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was a source of unbounded delight to his audience.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Two years after Servadac left the Lycee, Professor Rosette had thrown
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: up all educational employment in order that he might devote himself
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entirely to the study of astronomy. He endeavored to obtain a post
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at the Observatory, but his ungenial character was so well known in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scientific circles that he failed in his application; however, having
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some small private means, he determined on his own account to carry on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his researches without any official salary. He had really considerable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: genius for the science that he had adopted; besides discovering three of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the latest of the telescopic planets, he had worked out the elements of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the three hundred and twenty-fifth comet in the catalogue; but his chief
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: delight was to criticize the publications of other astronomers, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he was never better pleased than when he detected a flaw in their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reckonings.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: When Ben Zoof and Negrete had extricated their patient from the envelope
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of furs in which he had been wrapped by Servadac and the lieutenant,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they found themselves face to face with a shrivelled little man, about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: five feet two inches high, with a round bald head, smooth and shiny as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an ostrich's egg, no beard unless the unshorn growth of a week could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be so described, and a long hooked nose that supported a huge pair of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: spectacles such as with many near-sighted people seems to have become
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a part of their individuality. His nervous system was remarkably
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: developed, and his body might not inaptly be compared to one of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rhumkorff's bobbins of which the thread, several hundred yards in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: length, is permeated throughout by electric fluid. But whatever he was,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his life, if possible, must be preserved. When he had been partially
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: though very feebly. Asserting that while there was life there was hope,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof recommenced his friction with more vigor than ever.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: When the rubbing had been continued without a moment's intermission for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the best part of half an hour, the astronomer heaved a faint sigh, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ere long was followed by another and another. He half opened his eyes,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: closed them again, then opened them completely, but without exhibiting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any consciousness whatever of his situation. A few words seemed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: escape his lips, but they were quite unintelligible. Presently he raised
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his right hand to his forehead as though instinctively feeling for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: something that was missing; then, all of a sudden, his features became
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: contracted, his face flushed with apparent irritation, and he exclaimed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fretfully, "My spectacles!--where are my spectacles?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In order to facilitate his operations, Ben Zoof had removed the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: spectacles in spite of the tenacity with which they seemed to adhere
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the temples of his patient; but he now rapidly brought them back
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and readjusted them as best he could to what seemed to be their natural
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: position on the aquiline nose. The professor heaved a long sigh of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: relief, and once more closed his eyes.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Before long the astronomer roused himself a little more, and glanced
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inquiringly about him, but soon relapsed into his comatose condition.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: When next he opened his eyes, Captain Servadac happened to be bending
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: down closely over him, examining his features with curious scrutiny.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The old man darted an angry look at him through the spectacles, and said
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sharply, "Servadac, five hundred lines to-morrow!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was an echo of days of old. The words were few, but they were enough
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to recall the identity which Servadac was trying to make out.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Is it possible?" he exclaimed. "Here is my old tutor, Mr. Rosette, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very flesh and blood."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Can't say much for the flesh," muttered Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The old man had again fallen back into a torpid slumber. Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: continued, "His sleep is getting more composed. Let him alone; he will
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: come round yet. Haven't I heard of men more dried up than he is, being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brought all the way from Egypt in cases covered with pictures?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You idiot!--those were mummies; they had been dead for ages."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof did not answer a word. He went on preparing a warm bed, into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which he managed to remove his patient, who soon fell into a calm and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: natural sleep.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Too impatient to await the awakening of the astronomer and to hear what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: representations he had to make, Servadac, the count, and the lieutenant,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: constituting themselves what might be designated "the Academy of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sciences" of the colony, spent the whole of the remainder of the day in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: starting and discussing the wildest conjectures about their situation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The hypothesis, to which they had now accustomed themselves for so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: long, that a new asteroid had been formed by a fracture of the earth's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surface, seemed to fall to the ground when they found that Professor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Palmyrin Rosette had associated the name of Gallia, not with their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: present home, but with what he called "my comet"; and that theory being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abandoned, they were driven to make the most improbable speculations to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: replace it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Alluding to Rosette, Servadac took care to inform his companions
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that, although the professor was always eccentric, and at times very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irascible, yet he was really exceedingly good-hearted; his bark was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: worse than his bite; and if suffered to take their course without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observation, his outbreaks of ill-temper seldom lasted long.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We will certainly do our best to get on with him," said the count. "He
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is no doubt the author of the papers, and we must hope that he will be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: able to give us some valuable information."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Beyond a question the documents have originated with him," assented
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the lieutenant. "Gallia was the word written at the top of every one of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them, and Gallia was the first word uttered by him in our hearing."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The astronomer slept on. Meanwhile, the three together had no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hesitation in examining his papers, and scrutinizing the figures on his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extemporized blackboard. The handwriting corresponded with that of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: papers already received; the blackboard was covered with algebraical
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: symbols traced in chalk, which they were careful not to obliterate;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the papers, which consisted for the most part of detached scraps,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: presented a perfect wilderness of geometrical figures, conic sections of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: every variety being repeated in countless profusion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope pointed out that these curves evidently had reference
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the orbits of comets, which are variously parabolic, hyperbolic, or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elliptic. If either of the first two, the comet, after once appearing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: within the range of terrestrial vision, would vanish forever in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: outlying regions of space; if the last, it would be sure, sooner or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: later, after some periodic interval, to return.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: From the _prima facie_ appearance of his papers, then, it seemed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this kind are ordinarily based upon the assumption that the orbit is a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: parabola, it was not unlikely that he had been endeavoring to trace the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: path of some particular comet.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I wonder whether these calculations were made before or after the 1st
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of January; it makes all the difference," said Lieutenant Procope.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We must bide our time and hear," replied the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac paced restlessly up and down. "I would give a month of my
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: life," he cried, impetuously, "for every hour that the old fellow goes
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sleeping on."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You might be making a bad bargain," said Procope, smiling. "Perhaps
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: after all the comet has had nothing to do with the convulsion that we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have experienced."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nonsense!" exclaimed the captain; "I know better than that, and so do
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: do not deny your theory," said Procope after a while. "If it be correct,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: are on a considerable fragment of the terrestrial globe that has been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: detached by collision with a planet to which you appear to have given
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the name of Gallia."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Better than that!" cried Rosette, starting to his feet with excitement.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How? Why? What do you mean?" cried the voices of the listeners.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You are correct to a certain degree," continued the professor. "It is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quite true that at 47' 35.6" after two o'clock on the morning of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: first of January there was a collision; my comet grazed the earth; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the bits of the earth which you have named were carried clean away."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: They were all fairly bewildered.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Where, then," cried Servadac eagerly, "where are we?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You are on my comet, on Gallia itself!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And the professor gazed around him with a perfect air of triumph.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules
