text: CHAPTER III. THE PROFESSOR'S EXPERIENCES
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, my comet!" repeated the professor, and from time to time he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: knitted his brows, and looked around him with a defiant air, as though
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he could not get rid of the impression that someone was laying an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unwarranted claim to its proprietorship, or that the individuals before
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: him were intruders upon his own proper domain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But for a considerable while, Servadac, the count, and the lieutenant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remained silent and sunk in thought. Here then, at last, was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unriddling of the enigma they had been so long endeavoring to solve;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: both the hypotheses they had formed in succession had now to give way
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: before the announcement of the real truth. The first supposition, that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the rotatory axis of the earth had been subject to some accidental
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: modification, and the conjecture that replaced it, namely, that a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certain portion of the terrestrial sphere had been splintered off and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carried into space, had both now to yield to the representation that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth had been grazed by an unknown comet, which had caught up some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scattered fragments from its surface, and was bearing them far away into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sidereal regions. Unfolded lay the past and the present before them; but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this only served to awaken a keener interest about the future. Could the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: professor throw any light upon that? they longed to inquire, but did not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: yet venture to ask him.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meanwhile Rosette assumed a pompous professional air, and appeared to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be waiting for the entire party to be ceremoniously introduced to him.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Nothing unwilling to humor the vanity of the eccentric little man,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac proceeded to go through the expected formalities.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Allow me to present to you my excellent friend, the Count Timascheff,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he said.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You are very welcome," said Rosette, bowing to the count with a smile
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of condescension.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Although I am not precisely a voluntary resident on your comet, Mr.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Professor, I beg to acknowledge your courteous reception," gravely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: responded Timascheff.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac could not quite conceal his amusement at the count's irony, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: continued, "This is Lieutenant Procope, the officer in command of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Dobryna_."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The professor bowed again in frigid dignity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "His yacht has conveyed us right round Gallia," added the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Round Gallia?" eagerly exclaimed the professor.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, entirely round it," answered Servadac, and without allowing time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for reply, proceeded, "And this is my orderly, Ben Zoof."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Aide-de-camp to his Excellency the Governor of Gallia," interposed Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof himself, anxious to maintain his master's honor as well as his own.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette scarcely bent his head.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The rest of the population of the Hive were all presented in succession:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Russian sailors, the Spaniards, young Pablo, and little Nina, on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whom the professor, evidently no lover of children, glared fiercely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: through his formidable spectacles. Isaac Hakkabut, after his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: introduction, begged to be allowed to ask one question.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How soon may we hope to get back?" he inquired.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Get back!" rejoined Rosette, sharply; "who talks of getting back? We
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have hardly started yet."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Seeing that the professor was inclined to get angry, Captain Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: adroitly gave a new turn to the conversation by asking him whether
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he would gratify them by relating his own recent experiences. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astronomer seemed pleased with the proposal, and at once commenced a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: verbose and somewhat circumlocutory address, of which the following
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: summary presents the main features.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The French Government, being desirous of verifying the measurement
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: already made of the arc of the meridian of Paris, appointed a scientific
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: commission for that purpose. From that commission the name of Palmyrin
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette was omitted, apparently for no other reason than his personal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unpopularity. Furious at the slight, the professor resolved to set to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: work independently on his own account, and declaring that there were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inaccuracies in the previous geodesic operations, he determined to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: re-examine the results of the last triangulation which had united
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Formentera to the Spanish coast by a triangle, one of the sides of which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: measured over a hundred miles, the very operation which had already been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so successfully accomplished by Arago and Biot.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Accordingly, leaving Paris for the Balearic Isles, he placed his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observatory on the highest point of Formentera, and accompanied as he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was only by his servant, Joseph, led the life of a recluse. He secured
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the services of a former assistant, and dispatched him to a high peak on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the coast of Spain, where he had to superintend a reverberator, which,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the aid of a glass, could be seen from Formentera. A few books and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: instruments, and two months' victuals, was all the baggage he took with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: him, except an excellent astronomical telescope, which was, indeed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost part and parcel of himself, and with which he assiduously scanned
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the heavens, in the sanguine anticipation of making some discovery which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would immortalize his name.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The task he had undertaken demanded the utmost patience. Night after
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: night, in order to fix the apex of his triangle, he had to linger on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: watch for the assistant's signal-light, but he did not forget that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his predecessors, Arago and Biot, had had to wait sixty-one days for a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: similar purpose. What retarded the work was the dense fog which, it has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been already mentioned, at that time enveloped not only that part of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Europe, but almost the entire world.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Never failing to turn to the best advantage the few intervals when the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mist lifted a little, the astronomer would at the same time cast an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inquiring glance at the firmament, as he was greatly interested in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revision of the chart of the heavens, in the region contiguous to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: constellation Gemini.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To the naked eye this constellation consists of only six stars, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: through a telescope ten inches in diameter, as many as six thousand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are visible. Rosette, however, did not possess a reflector of this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: magnitude, and was obliged to content himself with the good but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comparatively small instrument he had.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On one of these occasions, whilst carefully gauging the recesses of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gemini, he espied a bright speck which was unregistered in the chart,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and which at first he took for a small star that had escaped being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entered in the catalogue. But the observation of a few separate nights
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: soon made it manifest that the star was rapidly changing its position
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with regard to the adjacent stars, and the astronomer's heart began to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: leap at the thought that the renown of the discovery of a new planet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would be associated with his name.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Redoubling his attention, he soon satisfied himself that what he saw was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not a planet; the rapidity of its displacement rather forced him to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the conjecture that it must be a comet, and this opinion was soon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: strengthened by the appearance of a coma, and subsequently confirmed, as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the body approached the sun, by the development of a tail.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A comet! The discovery was fatal to all further progress in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: triangulation. However conscientiously the assistant on the Spanish
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coast might look to the kindling of the beacon, Rosette had no glances
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to spare for that direction; he had no eyes except for the one object of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his notice, no thoughts apart from that one quarter of the firmament.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A comet! No time must be lost in calculating its elements.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Now, in order to calculate the elements of a comet, it is always deemed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the safest mode of procedure to assume the orbit to be a parabola.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ordinarily, comets are conspicuous at their perihelia, as being their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shortest distances from the sun, which is the focus of their orbit,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and inasmuch as a parabola is but an ellipse with its axis indefinitely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: produced, for some short portion of its pathway the orbit may be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: indifferently considered either one or the other; but in this particular
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: case the professor was right in adopting the supposition of its being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: parabolic.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Just as in a circle, it is necessary to know three points to determine
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the circumference; so in ascertaining the elements of a comet, three
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: different positions must be observed before what astronomers call its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "ephemeris" can be established.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But Professor Rosette did not content himself with three positions;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: taking advantage of every rift in the fog he made ten, twenty, thirty
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observations both in right ascension and in declination, and succeeded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in working out with the most minute accuracy the five elements of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet which was evidently advancing with astounding rapidity towards the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: These elements were:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 1. The inclination of the plane of the cometary orbit to the plane of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the ecliptic, an angle which is generally considerable, but in this case
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the planes were proved to coincide.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 2. The position of the ascending node, or the point where the comet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: crossed the terrestrial orbit.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: These two elements being obtained, the position in space of the comet's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: orbit was determined.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 3. The direction of the axis major of the orbit, which was found by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: calculating the longitude of the comet's perihelion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 4. The perihelion distance from the sun, which settled the precise form
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the parabola.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 5. The motion of the comet, as being retrograde, or, unlike the planets,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from east to west.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette thus found himself able to calculate the date at which the comet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would reach its perihelion, and, overjoyed at his discovery, without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thinking of calling it Palmyra or Rosette, after his own name, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: resolved that it should be known as Gallia.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: His next business was to draw up a formal report. Not only did he at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: once recognize that a collision with the earth was possible, but he soon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: foresaw that it was inevitable, and that it must happen on the night of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the 31st of December; moreover, as the bodies were moving in opposite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: directions, the shock could hardly fail to be violent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To say that he was elated at the prospect was far below the truth; his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: delight amounted almost to delirium. Anyone else would have hurried from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the solitude of Formentera in sheer fright; but, without communicating
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a word of his startling discovery, he remained resolutely at his post.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: From occasional newspapers which he had received, he had learnt that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fogs, dense as ever, continued to envelop both hemispheres, so that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he was assured that the existence of the comet was utterly unknown
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elsewhere; and the ignorance of the world as to the peril that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: threatened it averted the panic that would have followed the publication
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the facts, and left the philosopher of Formentera in sole possession
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the great secret. He clung to his post with the greater persistency,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: because his calculations had led him to the conclusion that the comet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would strike the earth somewhere to the south of Algeria, and as it had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a solid nucleus, he felt sure that, as he expressed it, the effect would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be "unique," and he was anxious to be in the vicinity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The shock came, and with it the results already recorded. Palmyrin
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette was suddenly separated from his servant Joseph, and when, after
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a long period of unconsciousness, he came to himself, he found that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he was the solitary occupant of the only fragment that survived of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Balearic Archipelago.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Such was the substance of the narrative which the professor gave
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with sundry repetitions and digressions; while he was giving it, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frequently paused and frowned as if irritated in a way that seemed by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no means justified by the patient and good-humored demeanor of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: audience.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But now, gentlemen," added the professor, "I must tell you something
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more. Important changes have resulted from the collision; the cardinal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: points have been displaced; gravity has been diminished: not that I ever
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: supposed for a minute, as you did, that I was still upon the earth. No!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth, attended by her moon, continued to rotate along her proper
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: orbit. But we, gentlemen, have nothing to complain of; our destiny might
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have been far worse; we might all have been crushed to death, or the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet might have remained in adhesion to the earth; and in neither of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: these cases should we have had the satisfaction of making this marvelous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: excursion through untraversed solar regions. No, gentlemen, I repeat it,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: we have nothing to regret."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And as the professor spoke, he seemed to kindle with the emotion of such
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: supreme contentment that no one had the heart to gainsay his assertion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof alone ventured an unlucky remark to the effect that if the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet had happened to strike against Montmartre, instead of a bit of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Africa, it would have met with some resistance.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Pshaw!" said Rosette, disdainfully. "A mole-hill like Montmartre would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have been ground to powder in a moment."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Mole-hill!" exclaimed Ben Zoof, stung to the quick. "I can tell you it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would have caught up your bit of a comet and worn it like a feather in a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cap."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The professor looked angry, and Servadac having imposed silence upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his orderly, explained the worthy soldier's sensitiveness on all that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: concerned Montmartre. Always obedient to his master, Ben Zoof held his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tongue; but he felt that he could never forgive the slight that had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cast upon his beloved home.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was now all-important to learn whether the astronomer had been able
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to continue his observations, and whether he had learned sufficient of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia's path through space to make him competent to determine, at least
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approximately, the period of its revolution round the sun. With as much
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tact and caution as he could, Lieutenant Procope endeavored to intimate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the general desire for some information on this point.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Before the shock, sir," answered the professor, "I had conclusively
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: demonstrated the path of the comet; but, in consequence of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: modifications which that shock has entailed upon my comet's orbit, I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have been compelled entirely to recommence my calculations."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant looked disappointed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Although the orbit of the earth was unaltered," continued the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: professor, "the result of the collision was the projection of the comet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into a new orbit altogether."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And may I ask," said Procope, deferentially, "whether you have got the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elements of the fresh orbit?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then perhaps you know--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I know this, sir, that at 47 minutes 35.6 seconds after two o'clock on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the morning of the 1st of January last, Gallia, in passing its ascending
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: node, came in contact with the earth; that on the 10th of January it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: crossed the orbit of Venus; that it reached its perihelion on the 15th;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that it re-crossed the orbit of Venus; that on the 1st of February
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it passed its descending node; on the 13th crossed the orbit of Mars;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entered the zone of the telescopic planets on the 10th of March, and,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attracting Nerina, carried it off as a satellite."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac interposed:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We are already acquainted with well-nigh all these extraordinary facts;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: many of them, moreover, we have learned from documents which we have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: picked up, and which, although unsigned, we cannot entertain a doubt
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have originated with you."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Professor Rosette drew himself up proudly and said: "Of course, they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: originated with me. I sent them off by hundreds. From whom else could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they come?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "From no one but yourself, certainly," rejoined the count, with grave
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: politeness.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hitherto the conversation had thrown no light upon the future movements
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Gallia, and Rosette was disposed apparently to evade, or at least to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: postpone, the subject. When, therefore, Lieutenant Procope was about to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: press his inquiries in a more categorical form, Servadac, thinking
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it advisable not prematurely to press the little _savant_ too far,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: interrupted him by asking the professor how he accounted for the earth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: having suffered so little from such a formidable concussion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I account for it in this way," answered Rosette: "the earth was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: traveling at the rate of 28,000 leagues an hour, and Gallia at the rate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of 57,000 leagues an hour, therefore the result was the same as though
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a train rushing along at a speed of about 86,000 leagues an hour had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suddenly encountered some obstacle. The nucleus of the comet, being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: excessively hard, has done exactly what a ball would do fired with that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: velocity close to a pane of glass. It has crossed the earth without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cracking it."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It is possible you may be right," said Servadac, thoughtfully.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Right! of course I am right!" replied the snappish professor. Soon,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, recovering his equanimity, he continued: "It is fortunate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the earth was only touched obliquely; if the comet had impinged
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he added, with a smile, "even Montmartre might not have survived the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: calamity."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Sir!" shouted Ben Zoof, quite unable to bear the unprovoked attack.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Quiet, Ben Zoof!" said Servadac sternly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Fortunately for the sake of peace, Isaac Hakkabut, who at length was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: beginning to realize something of the true condition of things, came
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: forward at this moment, and in a voice trembling with eagerness,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: implored the professor to tell him when they would all be back again
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon the earth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Are you in a great hurry?" asked the professor coolly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Jew was about to speak again, when Captain Servadac interposed:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Allow me to say that, in somewhat more scientific terms, I was about to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ask you the same question. Did I not understand you to say that, as the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequence of the collision, the character of the comet's orbit has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been changed?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You did, sir."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Did you imply that the orbit has ceased to be a parabola?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Just so."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Is it then an hyperbola? and are we to be carried on far and away into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remote distance, and never, never to return?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I did not say an hyperbola."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And is it not?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It is not."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes."

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: "It is."

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: along the gallery.
