text: As to the fulfillment of the professor's prediction of an ultimate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: return to the terrestrial sphere, that was a point on which it must
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be owned that the captain, after the first flush of his excitement was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: over, was not without many misgivings.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The next day or two were spent in providing for the accommodation of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: new comer. Fortunately his desires were very moderate; he seemed to live
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: among the stars, and as long as he was well provided with coffee, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cared little for luxuries, and paid little or no regard to the ingenuity
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with which all the internal arrangements of Nina's Hive had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: devised. Anxious to show all proper respect to his former tutor,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac proposed to leave the most comfortable apartment of the place
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at his disposal; but the professor resolutely declined to occupy it,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: saying that what he required was a small chamber, no matter how small,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: provided that it was elevated and secluded, which he could use as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an observatory and where he might prosecute his studies without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disturbance. A general search was instituted, and before long they were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lucky enough to find, about a hundred feet above the central grotto, a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: small recess or reduct hollowed, as it were, in the mountain side, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would exactly answer their purpose. It contained room enough for a bed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a table, an arm-chair, a chest of drawers, and, what was of still more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequence, for the indispensable telescope. One small stream of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lava, an off-shoot of the great torrent, sufficed to warm the apartment
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enough.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In these retired quarters the astronomer took up his abode. It was on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all hands acknowledged to be advisable to let him go on entirely in his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: own way. His meals were taken to him at stated intervals; he slept but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little; carried on his calculations by day, his observations by night,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and very rarely made his appearance amongst the rest of the little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: community.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The cold now became very intense, the thermometer registering 30 degrees
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: F. below zero. The mercury, however, never exhibited any of those
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fluctuations that are ever and again to be observed in variable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: climates, but continued slowly and steadily to fall, and in all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: probability would continue to do so until it reached the normal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: temperature of the regions of outlying space.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This steady sinking of the mercury was accompanied by a complete
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stillness of the atmosphere; the very air seemed to be congealed; no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: particle of it stirred; from zenith to horizon there was never a cloud;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: neither were there any of the damp mists or dry fogs which so often
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extend over the polar regions of the earth; the sky was always clear;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the sun shone by day and the stars by night without causing any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perceptible difference in the temperature.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: These peculiar conditions rendered the cold endurable even in the open
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: air. The cause of so many of the diseases that prove fatal to Arctic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: explorers resides in the cutting winds, unwholesome fogs, or terrible
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: snow drifts, which, by drying up, relaxing, or otherwise affecting the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lungs, make them incapable of fulfilling their proper functions. But
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: during periods of calm weather, when the air has been absolutely still,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: many polar navigators, well-clothed and properly fed, have been known
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to withstand a temperature when the thermometer has fallen to 60 degrees
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: below zero. It was the experience of Parry upon Melville Island, of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Kane beyond latitude 81 degrees north, and of Hall and the crew of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Polaris_, that, however intense the cold, in the absence of the wind
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they could always brave its rigor.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Notwithstanding, then, the extreme lowness of the temperature, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little population found that they were able to move about in the open
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: air with perfect immunity. The governor general made it his special care
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to see that his people were all well fed and warmly clad. Food was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: both wholesome and abundant, and besides the furs brought from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Dobryna's_ stores, fresh skins could very easily be procured and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made up into wearing apparel. A daily course of out-door exercise was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enforced upon everyone; not even Pablo and Nina were exempted from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: general rule; the two children, muffled up in furs, looking like little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Esquimeaux, skated along together, Pablo ever at his companion's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: side, ready to give her a helping hand whenever she was weary with her
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exertions.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After his interview with the newly arrived astronomer, Isaac Hakkabut
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: slunk back again to his tartan. A change had come over his ideas; he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could no longer resist the conviction that he was indeed millions and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: millions of miles away from the earth, where he had carried on so varied
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and remunerative a traffic. It might be imagined that this realization
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his true position would have led him to a better mind, and that,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in some degree at least, he would have been induced to regard the few
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fellow-creatures with whom his lot had been so strangely cast, otherwise
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than as mere instruments to be turned to his own personal and pecuniary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: advantage; but no--the desire of gain was too thoroughly ingrained into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his hard nature ever to be eradicated, and secure in his knowledge that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he was under the protection of a French officer, who, except under the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: most urgent necessity, would not permit him to be molested in retaining
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his property, he determined to wait for some emergency to arise which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should enable him to use his present situation for his own profit.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the one hand, the Jew took it into account that although the chances
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of returning to the earth might be remote, yet from what he had heard
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the professor he could not believe that they were improbable; on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the other, he knew that a considerable sum of money, in English and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Russian coinage, was in the possession of various members of the little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: colony, and this, although valueless now, would be worth as much as ever
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: if the proper condition of things should be restored; accordingly, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: set his heart on getting all the monetary wealth of Gallia into his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: possession, and to do this he must sell his goods. But he would not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sell them yet; there might come a time when for many articles the supply
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would not be equal to the demand; that would be the time for him;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by waiting he reckoned he should be able to transact some lucrative
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: business.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Such in his solitude were old Isaac's cogitations, whilst the universal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: population of Nina's Hive were congratulating themselves upon being rid
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his odious presence.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As already stated in the message brought by the carrier pigeon, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distance traveled by Gallia in April was 39,000,000 leagues, and at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: end of the month she was 110,000,000 leagues from the sun. A diagram
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: representing the elliptical orbit of the planet, accompanied by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an ephemeris made out in minute detail, had been drawn out by the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: professor. The curve was divided into twenty-four sections of unequal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: length, representing respectively the distance described in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: twenty-four months of the Gallian year, the twelve former divisions,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: according to Kepler's law, gradually diminishing in length as they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approached the point denoting the aphelion and increasing as they neared
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the perihelion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was on the 12th of May that Rosette exhibited this result of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: labors to Servadac, the count, and the lieutenant, who visited his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: apartment and naturally examined the drawing with the keenest interest.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia's path, extending beyond the orbit of Jupiter, lay clearly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: defined before their eyes, the progress along the orbit and the solar
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distances being inserted for each month separately. Nothing could look
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: plainer, and if the professor's calculations were correct (a point upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which they dared not, if they would, express the semblance of a doubt),
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia would accomplish her revolution in precisely two years, and would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: meet the earth, which would in the same period of time have completed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: two annual revolutions, in the very same spot as before. What would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the consequences of a second collision they scarcely ventured to think.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without lifting his eye from the diagram, which he was still carefully
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scrutinizing, Servadac said, "I see that during the month of May, Gallia
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will only travel 30,400,000 leagues, and that this will leave her about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 140,000,000 leagues distant from the sun."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Just so," replied the professor.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then we have already passed the zone of the telescopic planets, have we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not?" asked the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Can you not use your eyes?" said the professor, testily. "If you will
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: look you will see the zone marked clearly enough upon the map."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without noticing the interruption, Servadac continued his own remarks,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The comet then, I see, is to reach its aphelion on the 15th of January,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exactly a twelvemonth after passing its perihelion."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A twelvemonth! Not a Gallian twelvemonth?" exclaimed Rosette.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac looked bewildered. Lieutenant Procope could not suppress a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: smile.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What are you laughing at?" demanded the professor, turning round upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: him angrily.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nothing, sir; only it amuses me to see how you want to revise the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: terrestrial calendar."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I want to be logical, that's all."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "By all manner of means, my dear professor, let us be logical."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, then, listen to me," resumed the professor, stiffly. "I presume
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you are taking it for granted that the Gallian year--by which I mean
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the time in which Gallia makes one revolution round the sun--is equal in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: length to two terrestrial years."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: They signified their assent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And that year, like every other year, ought to be divided into twelve
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: months."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, certainly, if you wish it," said the captain, acquiescing.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "If I wish it!" exclaimed Rosette. "Nothing of the sort! Of course a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: year must have twelve months!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Of course," said the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And how many days will make a month?" asked the professor.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I suppose sixty or sixty-two, as the case may be. The days now are only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: half as long as they used to be," answered the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Servadac, don't be thoughtless!" cried Rosette, with all the petulant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impatience of the old pedagogue. "If the days are only half as long
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as they were, sixty of them cannot make up a twelfth part of Gallia's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: year--cannot be a month."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I suppose not," replied the confused captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Do you not see, then," continued the astronomer, "that if a Gallian
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: month is twice as long as a terrestrial month, and a Gallian day is only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: half as long as a terrestrial day, there must be a hundred and twenty
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: days in every month?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No doubt you are right, professor," said Count Timascheff; "but do you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not think that the use of a new calendar such as this would practically
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be very troublesome?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Not at all! not at all! I do not intend to use any other," was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: professor's bluff reply.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After pondering for a few moments, the captain spoke again. "According,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: then, to this new calendar, it isn't the middle of May at all; it must
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: now be some time in March."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes," said the professor, "to-day is the 26th of March. It is the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 266th day of the Gallian year. It corresponds with the 133d day of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: terrestrial year. You are quite correct, it is the 26th of March."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Strange!" muttered Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And a month, a terrestrial month, thirty old days, sixty new days
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hence, it will be the 86th of March."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ha, ha!" roared the captain; "this is logic with a vengeance!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The old professor had an undefined consciousness that his former pupil
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was laughing at him; and as it was growing late, he made an excuse
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that he had no more leisure. The visitors accordingly quitted the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observatory.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It must be owned that the revised calendar was left to the professor's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sole use, and the colony was fairly puzzled whenever he referred to such
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unheard-of dates as the 47th of April or the 118th of May.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: According to the old calendar, June had now arrived; [illustration
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: omitted] [page intentionally blank] and by the professor's tables Gallia
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: during the month would have advanced 27,500,000 leagues farther along
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its orbit, and would have attained a distance of 155,000,000 leagues
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the sun. The thermometer continued to fall; the atmosphere remained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clear as heretofore. The population performed their daily avocations
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with systematic routine; and almost the only thing that broke the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: monotony of existence was an occasional visit from the blustering,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nervous, little professor, when some sudden fancy induced him to throw
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: aside his astronomical studies for a time, and pay a visit to the common
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hall. His arrival there was generally hailed as the precursor of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little season of excitement. Somehow or other the conversation would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eventually work its way round to the topic of a future collision between
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the comet and the earth; and in the same degree as this was a matter
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of sanguine anticipation to Captain Servadac and his friends, it was a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: matter of aversion to the astronomical enthusiast, who had no desire to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quit his present quarters in a sphere which, being of his own discovery,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he could hardly have cared for more if it had been of his own creation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The interview would often terminate in a scene of considerable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: animation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 27th of June (old calendar) the professor burst like a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cannon-ball into the central hall, where they were all assembled, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: without a word of salutation or of preface, accosted the lieutenant in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the way in which in earlier days he had been accustomed to speak to an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: idle school-boy, "Now, lieutenant! no evasions! no shufflings! Tell me,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have you or have you not circumnavigated Gallia?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant drew himself up stiffly. "Evasions! shufflings! I am not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accustomed, sir--" he began in a tone evidencing no little resentment;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but catching a hint from the count he subdued his voice, and simply
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: said, "We have."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And may I ask," continued the professor, quite unaware of his previous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discourtesy, "whether, when you made your voyage, you took any account
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of distances?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "As approximately as I could," replied the lieutenant; "I did what I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could by log and compass. I was unable to take the altitude of sun or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: star."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "At what result did you arrive? What is the measurement of our equator?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I estimate the total circumference of the equator to be about 1,400
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah!" said the professor, more than half speaking to himself, "a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumference of 1,400 miles would give a diameter of about 450 miles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: That would be approximately about one-sixteenth of the diameter of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Raising his voice, he continued, "Gentlemen, in order to complete my
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: account of my comet Gallia, I require to know its area, its mass, its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: volume, its density, its specific gravity."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Since we know the diameter," remarked the lieutenant, "there can be no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulty in finding its surface and its volume."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And did I say there was any difficulty?" asked the professor, fiercely.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I have been able to reckon that ever since I was born."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Cock-a-doodle-doo!" cried Ben Zoof, delighted at any opportunity of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: paying off his old grudge.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The professor looked at him, but did not vouchsafe a word. Addressing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the captain, he said, "Now, Servadac, take your paper and a pen, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: find me the surface of Gallia."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: With more submission than when he was a school-boy, the captain sat down
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and endeavored to recall the proper formula.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The surface of a sphere? Multiply circumference by diameter."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Right!" cried Rosette; "but it ought to be done by this time."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Circumference, 1,400; diameter, 450; area of surface, 630,000," read
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "True," replied Rosette, "630,000 square miles; just 292 times less than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that of the earth."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Pretty little comet! nice little comet!" muttered Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The astronomer bit his lip, snorted, and cast at him a withering look,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but did not take any further notice.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Now, Captain Servadac," said the professor, "take your pen again, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: find me the volume of Gallia."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain hesitated.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Quick, quick!" cried the professor, impatiently; "surely you have not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: forgotten how to find the volume of a sphere!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A moment's breathing time, please."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Breathing time, indeed! A mathematician should not want breathing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: time! Come, multiply the surface by the third of the radius. Don't you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: recollect?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac applied himself to his task while the by-standers
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: waited, with some difficulty suppressing their inclination to laugh.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was a short silence, at the end of which Servadac announced that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the volume of the comet was 47,880,000 cubic miles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Just about 5,000 times less than the earth," observed the lieutenant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nice little comet! pretty little comet!" said Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The professor scowled at him, and was manifestly annoyed at having the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: insignificant dimensions of his comet pointed out in so disparaging
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a manner. Lieutenant Procope further remarked that from the earth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he supposed it to be about as conspicuous as a star of the seventh
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: magnitude, and would require a good telescope to see it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ha, ha!" laughed the orderly, aloud; "charming little comet! so pretty;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and so modest!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You rascal!" roared the professor, and clenched his hand in passion, as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: if about to strike him. Ben Zoof laughed the more, and was on the point
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of repeating his satirical comments, when a stern order from the captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made him hold his tongue. The truth was that the professor was just as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sensitive about his comet as the orderly was about Montmartre, and if
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the contention between the two had been allowed to go on unchecked, it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is impossible to say what serious quarrel might not have arisen.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: When Professor Rosette's equanimity had been restored, he said, "Thus,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: then, gentlemen, the diameter, the surface, the volume of my comet are
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: settled; but there is more to be done. I shall not be satisfied until,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by actual measurement, I have determined its mass, its density, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: force of gravity at its surface."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A laborious problem," remarked Count Timascheff.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Laborious or not, it has to be accomplished. I am resolved to find out
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what my comet weighs."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Would it not be of some assistance, if we knew of what substance it is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: composed?" asked the lieutenant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That is of no moment at all," replied the professor; "the problem is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: independent of it."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then we await your orders," was the captain's reply.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You must understand, however," said Rosette, "that there are various
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: preliminary calculations to be made; you will have to wait till they are
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: finished."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "As long as you please," said the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No hurry at all," observed the captain, who was not in the least
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impatient to continue his mathematical exercises.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then, gentlemen," said the astronomer, "with your leave we will for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this purpose make an appointment a few weeks hence. What do you say to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the 62d of April?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without noticing the general smile which the novel date provoked, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: astronomer left the hall, and retired to his observatory.

author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER V. WANTED: A STEELYARD
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: Under the still diminishing influence of the sun's attraction, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meanwhile, the question beyond all others important was ever recurring
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the minds of Servadac and his two companions: were the astronomer's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: calculations correct, and was there a sound foundation for his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: might be their doubts or anxieties, they were fain to keep all their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: results of his observations.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The rest of the community by no means shared in their uneasiness.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: away across the frozen ocean, the next fishing in the lake that was kept
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: liquid by the heat of the lava-torrent, the two children led a life of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: perpetual enjoyment. Nor was their recreation allowed to interfere with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their studies. Captain Servadac, who in common with the count really
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: liked them both, conceived that the responsibilities of a parent in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some degree had devolved upon him, and took great care in superintending
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their daily lessons, which he succeeded in making hardly less pleasant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than their sports.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Indulged and loved by all, it was little wonder that young Pablo had no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: longing for the scorching plains of Andalusia, or that little Nina
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had lost all wish to return with her pet goat to the barren rocks of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sardinia. They had now a home in which they had nothing to desire.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Have you no father nor mother?" asked Pablo, one day.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No," she answered.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No more have I," said the boy, "I used to run along by the side of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diligences when I was in Spain."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I used to look after goats at Madalena," said Nina; "but it is much
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nicer here--I am so happy here. I have you for a brother, and everybody
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is so kind. I am afraid they will spoil us, Pablo," she added, smiling.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh, no, Nina; you are too good to be spoiled, and when I am with you,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you make me good too," said Pablo, gravely.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: July had now arrived. During the month Gallia's advance along its orbit
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would be reduced to 22,000,000 leagues, the distance from the sun at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: end being 172,000,000 leagues, about four and a half times as great as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the average distance of the earth from the sun. It was traveling now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at about the same speed as the earth, which traverses the ecliptic at a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rate of 21,000,000 leagues a month, or 28,800 leagues an hour.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In due time the 62d April, according to the revised Gallian calendar,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dawned; and in punctual fulfillment of the professor's appointment, a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: note was delivered to Servadac to say that he was ready, and hoped that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: day to commence operations for calculating the mass and density of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet, as well as the force of gravity at its surface.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A point of far greater interest to Captain Servadac and his friends
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would have been to ascertain the nature of the substance of which the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet was composed, but they felt pledged to render the professor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any aid they could in the researches upon which he had set his heart.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without delay, therefore, they assembled in the central hall, where they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were soon joined by Rosette, who seemed to be in fairly good temper.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Gentlemen," he began, "I propose to-day to endeavor to complete our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observations of the elements of my comet. Three matters of investigation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are before us. First, the measure of gravity at its surface; this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attractive force we know, by the increase of our own muscular force,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: must of course be considerably less than that at the surface of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth. Secondly, its mass, that is, the quality of its matter. And
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thirdly, its density or quantity of matter in a unit of its volume. We
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will proceed, gentlemen, if you please, to weigh Gallia."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof, who had just entered the hall, caught the professor's last
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sentence, and without saying a word, went out again and was absent for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some minutes. When he returned, he said, "If you want to weigh this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet of yours, I suppose you want a pair of scales; but I have been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to look, and I cannot find a pair anywhere. And what's more," he added
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mischievously, "you won't get them anywhere."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A frown came over the professor's countenance. Servadac saw it, and gave
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his orderly a sign that he should desist entirely from his bantering.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I require, gentlemen," resumed Rosette, "first of all to know by how
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: much the weight of a kilogramme here differs from its weight upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth; the attraction, as we have said, being less, the weight will
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proportionately be less also."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then an ordinary pair of scales, being under the influence of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attraction, I suppose, would not answer your purpose," submitted the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lieutenant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And the very kilogramme weight you used would have become lighter," put
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the count, deferentially.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Pray, gentlemen, do not interrupt me," said the professor,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: authoritatively, as if _ex cathedra_. "I need no instruction on these
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: points."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Procope and Timascheff demurely bowed their heads.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The professor resumed. "Upon a steelyard, or spring-balance, dependent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon mere tension or flexibility, the attraction will have no influence.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: If I suspend a weight equivalent to the weight of a kilogramme, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: index will register the proper weight on the surface of Gallia. Thus
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I shall arrive at the difference I want: the difference between the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth's attraction and the comet's. Will you, therefore, have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the goodness to provide me at once with a steelyard and a tested
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: kilogramme?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The audience looked at one another, and then at Ben Zoof, who was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thoroughly acquainted with all their resources. "We have neither one nor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the other," said the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The professor stamped with vexation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I believe old Hakkabut has a steelyard on board his tartan," said Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof, presently.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then why didn't you say so before, you idiot?" roared the excitable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little man.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Anxious to pacify him, Servadac assured him that every exertion should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be made to procure the instrument, and directed Ben Zoof to go to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Jew and borrow it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: errand; "perhaps I had better go with you myself; the old Jew may make a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulty about lending us any of his property."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why should we not all go?" asked the count; "we should see what kind of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a life the misanthrope leads on board the _Hansa_."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The proposal met with general approbation. Before they started,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Professor Rosette requested that one of the men might be ordered to cut
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: him a cubic decimeter out of the solid substance of Gallia. "My engineer
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is the man for that," said the count; "he will do it well for you if you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will give him the precise measurement."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What! you don't mean," exclaimed the professor, again going off into a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: passion, "that you haven't a proper measure of length?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof was sent off to ransack the stores for the article in question,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but no measure was forthcoming. "Most likely we shall find one on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tartan," said the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then let us lose no time in trying," answered the professor, as he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hustled with hasty strides into the gallery.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The rest of the party followed, and were soon in the open air upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rocks that overhung the shore. They descended to the level of the frozen
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: water and made their way towards the little creek where the _Dobryna_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the _Hansa_ lay firmly imprisoned in their icy bonds.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The temperature was low beyond previous experience; but well muffled up
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in fur, they all endured it without much actual suffering. Their breath
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their whiskers, beards, eyebrows, and eyelashes, until their faces,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cub of an Arctic bear.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was eight o'clock in the morning. The sun was rapidly approaching the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: zenith; but its disc, from the extreme remoteness, was proportionately
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dwarfed; its beams being all but destitute of their proper warmth and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: radiance. The volcano to its very summit and the surrounding rocks were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: still covered with the unsullied mantle of snow that had fallen while
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the atmosphere was still to some extent charged with vapor; but on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: north side the snow had given place to the cascade of fiery lava, which,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: making its way down the sloping rocks as far as the vaulted opening of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the central cavern, fell thence perpendicularly into the sea. Above
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the stream of lava made a bifurcation in its course. From this hole
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: projected the case of an astronomer's telescope; it was the opening of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Palmyrin Rosette's observatory.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Sea and land seemed blended into one dreary whiteness, to which the pale
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: blue sky offered scarcely any contrast. The shore was indented with the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: marks of many footsteps left by the colonists either on their way to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: collect ice for drinking purposes, or as the result of their skating
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: complicated as the figures traced by aquatic insects upon the surface of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a pool.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Across the quarter of a mile of level ground that lay between the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mountain and the creek, a series of footprints, frozen hard into the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On approaching the creek, Lieutenant Procope drew his companions'
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attention to the elevation of the _Dobryna's_ and _Hansa's_ waterline,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What a strange phenomenon!" exclaimed the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It makes me very uneasy," rejoined the lieutenant; "in shallow places
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: like this, as the crust of ice thickens, it forces everything upwards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: with irresistible force."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But surely this process of congelation must have a limit!" said the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But who can say what that limit will be? Remember that we have not yet

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules
