title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: about this formidable neighbor."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant having refreshed his memory by reference to Flammarion's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Recits de l'Infini_, of which he had a Russian translation, and some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: other books, proceeded to recapitulate that Jupiter accomplishes his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revolution round the sun in 4,332 days 14 hours and 2 minutes; that he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: travels at the rate of 467 miles a minute along an orbit measuring 2,976
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: millions of miles; and that his rotation on his axis occupies only 9
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hours and 55 minutes.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "His days, then, are shorter than ours?" interrupted the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Considerably," answered the lieutenant, who went on to describe how the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: displacement of a point at the equator of Jupiter was twenty-seven times
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as rapid as on the earth, causing the polar compression to be about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 2,378 miles; how the axis, being nearly perpendicular, caused the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: days and nights to be nearly of the same length, and the seasons to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distance from the sun being 475,693,000 miles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And how about these satellites? Sometimes, I suppose, Jupiter has the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: benefit of four moons all shining at once?" asked Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Of the satellites, Lieutenant Procope went on to say that one is rather
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: smaller than our own moon; that another moves round its primary at an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: interval about equal to the moon's distance from ourselves; but that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they all revolve in considerably less time: the first takes only l day
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 18 hours 27 minutes; the second takes 3 days 13 hours 14 minutes; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: third, 7 days 3 hours 42 minutes; whilst the largest of all takes but 16
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: days 16 hours 32 minutes. The most remote revolves round the planet at a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distance of 1,192,820 miles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "They have been enlisted into the service of science," said Procope. "It
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is by their movements that the velocity of light has been calculated;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: longitudes."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It must be a wonderful sight," said the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes," answered Procope. "I often think Jupiter is like a prodigious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: clock with four hands."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I only hope that we are not destined to make a fifth hand," answered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Such was the style of the conversation that was day by day reiterated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: during the whole month of suspense. Whatever topic might be started, it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with such threatening aspect.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The more remote that these planets are from the sun," said Procope,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "the more venerable and advanced in formation are they found to be.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Neptune, situated 2,746,271,000 miles from the sun, issued from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: solar nebulosity, thousands of millions of centuries back. Uranus,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revolving 1,753,851,000 miles from the center of the planetary system,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is of an age amounting to many hundred millions of centuries. Jupiter,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the colossal planet, gravitating at a distance of 475,693,000 miles,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 1,000,000,000 years at a distance of 139,212,000 miles. The earth,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 91,430,000 miles from the sun, quitted his burning bosom 100,000,000
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: years ago. Venus, revolving now 66,131,000 miles away, may be assigned
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the age of 50,000,000 years at least; and Mercury, nearest of all, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: youngest of all, has been revolving at a distance of 35,393,000 miles
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for the space of 10,000,000 years--the same time as the moon has been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: evolved from the earth."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac listened attentively. He was at a loss what to say; and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only reply he made to the recital of this novel theory was to the effect
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Jupiter, and on the 1st of October the two bodies were calculated to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be at their minimum separation. No direct shock, however, could be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: being inclined at an angle of 1 degrees 19 mins to the orbit of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth, with which that of Gallia was, no doubt, coincident.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As the month of September verged towards its close, Jupiter began
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so that Nerina had to pale her beauty.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Who could wonder that Rosette, enthusiast as he was, should be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irremovable from his observatory? Who could expect otherwise than that,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: every moment that distracted his attention?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meanwhile, as Jupiter grew large, the sun grew small.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diminished to 5 degrees 46 mins.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And what an increased interest began to be associated with the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: satellites! They were visible to the naked eye! Was it not a new record
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the annals of science?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although it is acknowledged that they are not ordinarily visible on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth without the aid of a somewhat powerful telescope, it has been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: asserted that a favored few, endued with extraordinary powers of vision,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have been able to identify them with an unassisted eye; but here,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scintillation.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: planet, seemed to be beguiled into comparative forgetfulness of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: might be impending.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was continually being asked, "What does the professor really think?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Our friend the professor," said Servadac, "is not likely to tell us
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very much; but we may feel pretty certain of one thing: he wouldn't keep
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I trust from my very soul," said the count, "that his prognostications
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are correct."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mind," he said.

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: it down straight upon us."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: displeasure, "touch that telescope, and you shall swing for it!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The orderly looked astonished.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am governor here," said Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof knew what his master meant, and to him his master's wish was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: law.

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reduced to 43,000,000 miles. The belts all parallel to Jupiter's equator
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: orbs.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: which events had taken. The comet was pursuing an unaltered way.

text: The astronomer, correct in his prognostications, ought to have been the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: most proud and contented of philosophers; his pride and contentment
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were both overshadowed by the certainty that the career of his comet was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: destined to be so transient, and that it must inevitably once again come
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into collision with the earth.

text: "All right!" said Servadac, convinced by the professor's ill humor that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the danger was past; "no doubt we are in for a two years' excursion, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fifteen months more will take us back to the earth!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And we shall see Montmartre again!" exclaimed Ben Zoof, in excited
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tones that betrayed his delight in the anticipation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To use a nautical expression, they had safely "rounded the point," and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they had to be congratulated on their successful navigation; for if,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: under the influence of Jupiter's attraction, the comet had been retarded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for a single hour, in that hour the earth would have already traveled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 2,300,000 miles from the point where contact would ensue, and many
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: centuries would elapse before such a coincidence would possibly again
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: occur.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 1st of November Gallia and Jupiter were 40,000,000 miles apart.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was little more than ten weeks to the 15th of January, when the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet would begin to re-approach the sun. Though light and heat were now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reduced to a twenty-fifth part of their terrestrial intensity, so that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a perpetual twilight seemed to have settled over Gallia, yet the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: population felt cheered even by the little that was left, and buoyed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: up by the hope that they should ultimately regain their proper position
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with regard to the great luminary, of which the temperature has been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: estimated as not less than 5,000,000 degrees.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Of the anxiety endured during the last two months Isaac Hakkabut had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: known nothing. Since the day he had done his lucky stroke of business he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had never left the tartan; and after Ben Zoof, on the following day, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: returned the steelyard and the borrowed cash, receiving back the paper
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: roubles deposited, all communication between the Jew and Nina's Hive had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ceased. In the course of the few minutes' conversation which Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had held with him, he had mentioned that he knew that the whole soil of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia was made of gold; but the old man, guessing that the orderly was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only laughing at him as usual, paid no attention to the remark, and only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: meditated upon the means he could devise to get every bit of the money
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the new world into his own possession. No one grieved over the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: life of solitude which Hakkabut persisted in leading. Ben Zoof giggled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: heartily, as he repeatedly observed "it was astonishing how they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reconciled themselves to his absence."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The time came, however, when various circumstances prompted him to think
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he must renew his intercourse with the inhabitants of the Hive. Some of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his goods were beginning to spoil, and he felt the necessity of turning
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them into money, if he would not be a loser; he hoped, moreover, that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the scarcity of his commodities would secure very high prices.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It happened, just about this same time, that Ben Zoof had been calling
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his master's attention to the fact that some of their most necessary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: provisions would soon be running short, and that their stock of coffee,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sugar, and tobacco would want replenishing. Servadac's mind, of course,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: turned to the cargo on board the _Hansa_, and he resolved, according to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his promise, to apply to the Jew and become a purchaser. Mutual interest
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and necessity thus conspired to draw Hakkabut and the captain together.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Often and often had Isaac gloated in his solitude over the prospect of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: first selling a portion of his merchandise for all the gold and silver
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the colony. His recent usurious transaction had whetted his appetite.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He would next part with some more of his cargo for all the paper money
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they could give him; but still he should have goods left, and they would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: want these. Yes, they should have these, too, for promissory notes.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Notes would hold good when they got back again to the earth; bills from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his Excellency the governor would be good bills; anyhow there would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be the sheriff. By the God of Israel! he would get good prices, and he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would get fine interest!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although he did not know it, he was proposing to follow the practice of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Gauls of old, who advanced money on bills for payment in a future
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: life. Hakkabut's "future life," however, was not many months in advance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the present.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Still Hakkabut hesitated to make the first advance, and it was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accordingly with much satisfaction that he hailed Captain Servadac's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appearance on board the _Hansa_.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hakkabut," said the captain, plunging without further preface into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: business, "we want some coffee, some tobacco, and other things. I have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: come to-day to order them, to settle the price, and to-morrow Ben Zoof
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shall fetch the goods away."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Merciful, heavens!" the Jew began to whine; but Servadac cut him short.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "None of that miserable howling! Business! I am come to buy your goods.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I shall pay for them."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah yes, your Excellency," whispered the Jew, his voice trembling like
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a street beggar. "Don't impose on me. I am poor; I am nearly ruined
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: already."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Cease your wretched whining!" cried Servadac. "I have told you once, I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shall pay for all I buy."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ready money?" asked Hakkabut.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, ready money. What makes you ask?" said the captain, curious to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hear what the Jew would say.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, you see--you see, your Excellency," stammered out the Jew, "to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: give credit to one wouldn't do, unless I gave credit to another. You are
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: solvent--I mean honorable, and his lordship the count is honorable; but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: maybe--maybe--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well?" said Servadac, waiting, but inclined to kick the old rascal out
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his sight.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I shouldn't like to give credit," he repeated.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I have not asked you for credit. I have told you, you shall have ready
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: money."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very good, your Excellency. But how will you pay me?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Pay you? Why, we shall pay you in gold and silver and copper, while our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: money lasts, and when that is gone we shall pay you in bank notes."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh, no paper, no paper!" groaned out the Jew, relapsing into his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accustomed whine.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nonsense, man!" cried Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No paper!" reiterated Hakkabut.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why not? Surely you can trust the banks of England, France, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Russia."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah no! I must have gold. Nothing so safe as gold."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well then," said the captain, not wanting to lose his temper, "you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shall have it your own way; we have plenty of gold for the present.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: We will leave the bank notes for by and by." The Jew's countenance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brightened, and Servadac, repeating that he should come again the next
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: day, was about to quit the vessel.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "One moment, your Excellency," said Hakkabut, sidling up with a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hypocritical smile; "I suppose I am to fix my own prices."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You will, of course, charge ordinary prices--proper market prices;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: European prices, I mean."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Merciful heavens!" shrieked the old man, "you rob me of my rights; you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: defraud me of my privilege. The monopoly of the market belongs to me. It
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is the custom; it is my right; it is my privilege to fix my own prices."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac made him understand that he had no intention of swerving from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his decision.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Merciful heavens!" again howled the Jew, "it is sheer ruin. The time of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: monopoly is the time for profit; it is the time for speculation."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The very thing, Hakkabut, that I am anxious to prevent. Just stop now,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and think a minute. You seem to forget _my_ rights; you are forgetting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that, if I please, I can confiscate all your cargo for the common
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: use. You ought to think yourself lucky in getting any price at all. Be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: contented with European prices; you will get no more. I am not going
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to waste my breath on you. I will come again to-morrow;" and, without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: allowing Hakkabut time to renew his lamentations, Servadac went away.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: All the rest of the day the Jew was muttering bitter curses against
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the thieves of Gentiles in general, and the governor of Gallia in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: particular, who were robbing him of his just profits, by binding him
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: down to a maximum price for his goods, just as if it were a time of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revolution in the state. But he would be even with them yet; he would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have it all out of them: he would make European prices pay, after all.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He had a plan--he knew how; and he chuckled to himself, and grinned
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: maliciously.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: True to his word, the captain next morning arrived at the tartan. He
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was accompanied by Ben Zoof and two Russian sailors. "Good-morning, old
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Eleazar; we have come to do our little bit of friendly business with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you, you know," was Ben Zoof's greeting.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What do you want to-day?" asked the Jew.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To-day we want coffee, and we want sugar, and we want tobacco. We must
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have ten kilogrammes of each. Take care they are all good; all first
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rate. I am commissariat officer, and I am responsible."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I thought you were the governor's aide-de-camp," said Hakkabut.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "So I am, on state occasions; but to-day, I tell you. I am
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: superintendent of the commissariat department. Now, look sharp!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hakkabut hereupon descended into the hold of the tartan, and soon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: returned, carrying ten packets of tobacco, each weighing one kilogramme,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and securely fastened by strips of paper, labeled with the French
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: government stamp.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ten kilogrammes of tobacco at twelve francs a kilogramme: a hundred and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: twenty francs," said the Jew.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof was on the point of laying down the money, when Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stopped him.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Let us just see whether the weight is correct."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hakkabut pointed out that the weight was duly registered on every
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: packet, and that the packets had never been unfastened. The captain,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, had his own special object in view, and would not be diverted.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Jew fetched his steelyard, and a packet of the tobacco was suspended
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Merciful heavens!" screamed Isaac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The index registered only 133 grammes!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You see, Hakkabut, I was right. I was perfectly justified in having
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: your goods put to the test," said Servadac, quite seriously.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But--but, your Excellency--" stammered out the bewildered man.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You will, of course, make up the deficiency," the captain continued,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not noticing the interruption.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh, my lord, let me say--" began Isaac again.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Come, come, old Caiaphas, do you hear? You are to make up the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deficiency," exclaimed Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah, yes, yes; but--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The unfortunate Israelite tried hard to speak, but his agitation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prevented him. He understood well enough the cause of the phenomenon,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but he was overpowered by the conviction that the "cursed Gentiles"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wanted to cheat him. He deeply regretted that he had not a pair of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: common scales on board.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Come, I say, old Jedediah, you are a long while making up what's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: short," said Ben Zoof, while the Jew was still stammering on.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As soon as he recovered his power of articulation, Isaac began to pour
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: out a medley of lamentations and petitions for mercy. The captain was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inexorable. "Very sorry, you know, Hakkabut. It is not my fault that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: packet is short weight; but I cannot pay for a kilogramme except I have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a kilogramme."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hakkabut pleaded for some consideration.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A bargain is a bargain," said Servadac. "You must complete your
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: contract."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And, moaning and groaning, the miserable man was driven to make up the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: full weight as registered by his own steelyard. He had to repeat the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: process with the sugar and coffee: for every kilogramme he had to weigh
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seven. Ben Zoof and the Russians jeered him most unmercifully.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I say, old Mordecai, wouldn't you rather give your goods away, than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sell them at this rate? I would."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I say, old Pilate, a monopoly isn't always a good thing, is it?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I say, old Sepharvaim, what a flourishing trade you're driving!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meanwhile seventy kilogrammes of each of the articles required were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: weighed, and the Jew for each seventy had to take the price of ten.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: All along Captain Servadac had been acting only in jest. Aware that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: old Isaac was an utter hypocrite, he had no compunction in turning a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: business transaction with him into an occasion for a bit of fun. But
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the joke at an end, he took care that the Jew was properly paid all his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: legitimate due.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER X. FAR INTO SPACE
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A month passed away. Gallia continued its course, bearing its little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: population onwards, so far removed from the ordinary influence of human
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: passions that it might almost be said that its sole ostensible vice was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: represented by the greed and avarice of the miserable Jew.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After all, they were but making a voyage--a strange, yet a transient,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: excursion through solar regions hitherto untraversed; but if the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: professor's calculations were correct--and why should they be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: doubted?--their little vessel was destined, after a two years' absence,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: once more to return "to port." The landing, indeed, might be a matter
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of difficulty; but with the good prospect before them of once again
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: standing on terrestrial shores, they had nothing to do at present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: except to make themselves as comfortable as they could in their present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quarters.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Thus confident in their anticipations, neither the captain, the count,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nor the lieutenant felt under any serious obligation to make any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extensive provisions for the future; they saw no necessity for expending
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the strength of the people, during the short summer that would intervene
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon the long severity of winter, in the cultivation or the preservation
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of their agricultural resources. Nevertheless, they often found
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: themselves talking over the measures they would have been driven to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: adopt, if they had found themselves permanently attached to their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: present home.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Even after the turning-point in their career, they knew that at least
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nine months would have to elapse before the sea would be open to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: navigation; but at the very first arrival of summer they would be bound
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to arrange for the _Dobryna_ and the _Hansa_ to retransport themselves
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and all their animals to the shores of Gourbi Island, where they would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have to commence their agricultural labors to secure the crops that must
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: form their winter store. During four months or thereabouts, they would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lead the lives of farmers and of sportsmen; but no sooner would their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: haymaking and their corn harvest have been accomplished, than they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would be compelled again, like a swarm of bees, to retire to their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: semi-troglodyte existence in the cells of Nina's Hive.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Now and then the captain and his friends found themselves speculating
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whether, in the event of their having to spend another winter upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia, some means could not be devised by which the dreariness of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: second residence in the recesses of the volcano might be escaped. Would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not another exploring expedition possibly result in the discovery of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a vein of coal or other combustible matter, which could be turned to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: account in warming some erection which they might hope to put up?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A prolonged existence in their underground quarters was felt to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: monotonous and depressing, and although it might be all very well for a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: man like Professor Rosette, absorbed in astronomical studies, it was ill
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suited to the temperaments of any of themselves for any longer period
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than was absolutely indispensable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: One contingency there was, almost too terrible to be taken into account.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Was it not to be expected that the time might come when the internal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fires of Gallia would lose their activity, and the stream of lava would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequently cease to flow? Why should Gallia be exempt from the destiny
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that seemed to await every other heavenly body? Why should it not roll
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: onwards, like the moon, a dark cold mass in space?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In the event of such a cessation of the volcanic eruption, whilst the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet was still at so great a distance from the sun, they would indeed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be at a loss to find a substitute for what alone had served to render
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: life endurable at a temperature of 60 degrees below zero. Happily,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, there was at present no symptom of the subsidence of the lava's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stream; the volcano continued its regular and unchanging discharge, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, ever sanguine, declared that it was useless to give themselves
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any anxiety upon the matter.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 15th of December, Gallia was 276,000,000 leagues from the sun,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and, as it was approximately to the extremity of its axis major, would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: travel only some 11,000,000 or 12,000,000 leagues during the month.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Another world was now becoming a conspicuous object in the heavens, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Palmyrin Rosette, after rejoicing in an approach nearer to Jupiter than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any other mortal man had ever attained, was now to be privileged to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enjoy a similar opportunity of contemplating the planet Saturn. Not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the circumstances were altogether so favorable. Scarcely 31,000,000
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles had separated Gallia from Jupiter; the minimum distance of Saturn
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would not be less than 415,000,000 miles; but even this distance,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: although too great to affect the comet's progress more than had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: duly reckoned on, was considerably shorter than what had ever separated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Saturn from the earth.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To get any information about the planet from Rosette appeared quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impossible. Although equally by night and by day he never seemed to quit
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his telescope, he did not evince the slightest inclination to impart the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: result of his observations. It was only from the few astronomical works
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that happened to be included in the _Dobryna's_ library that any details
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could be gathered, but these were sufficient to give a large amount of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: interesting information.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof, when he was made aware that the earth would be invisible to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the naked eye from the surface of Saturn, declared that he then, for his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: part, did not care to learn any more about such a planet; to him it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was indispensable that the earth should remain in sight, and it was his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: great consolation that hitherto his native sphere had never vanished
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from his gaze.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At this date Saturn was revolving at a distance of 420,000,000 miles
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from Gallia, and consequently 874,440,000 miles from the sun, receiving
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only a hundredth part of the light and heat which that luminary bestows
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon the earth. On consulting their books of reference, the colonists
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: found that Saturn completes his revolution round the sun in a period of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 29 years and 167 days, traveling at the rate of more than 21,000 miles
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an hour along an orbit measuring 5,490 millions of miles in length. His
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumference is about 220,000 miles; his superficies, 144,000 millions
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of square miles; his volume, 143,846 millions of cubic miles. Saturn
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is 735 times larger than the earth, consequently he is smaller than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Jupiter; in mass he is only 90 times greater than the earth, which gives
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: him a density less than that of water. He revolves on his axis in 10
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hours 29 minutes, causing his own year to consist of 86,630 days; and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his seasons, on account of the great inclination of his axis to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: plane of his orbit, are each of the length of seven terrestrial years.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although the light received from the sun is comparatively feeble, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nights upon Saturn must be splendid. Eight satellites--Mimas, Enceladus,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Tethys, Dione, Rhea, Titan, Hyperion, and Japetus--accompany the planet;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Mimas, the nearest to its primary, rotating on its axis in 22 1/2 hours,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and revolving at a distance of only 120,800 miles, whilst Japetus,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the most remote, occupies 79 days in its rotation, and revolves at a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distance of 2,314,000 miles.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Another most important contribution to the magnificence of the nights
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon Saturn is the triple ring with which, as a brilliant setting, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: planet is encompassed. To an observer at the equator, this ring, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: has been estimated by Sir William Herschel as scarcely 100 miles in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thickness, must have the appearance of a narrow band of light passing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: through the zenith 12,000 miles above his head. As the observer,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, increases his latitude either north or south, the band will
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gradually widen out into three detached and concentric rings, of which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the innermost, dark though transparent, is 9,625 miles in breadth; the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: intermediate one, which is brighter than the planet itself, being 17,605
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miles broad; and the outer, of a dusky hue, being 8,660 miles broad.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Such, they read, is the general outline of this strange appendage, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: revolves in its own plane in 10 hours 32 minutes. Of what matter it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: is composed, and how it resists disintegration, is still an unsettled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: question; but it might almost seem that the Designer of the universe, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: permitting its existence, had been willing to impart to His intelligent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: creatures the manner in which celestial bodies are evolved, and that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this remarkable ring-system is a remnant of the nebula from which Saturn
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was himself developed, and which, from some unknown cause, has become
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: solidified. If at any time it should disperse, it would either fall
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into fragments upon the surface of Saturn, or the fragments, mutually
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coalescing, would form additional satellites to circle round the planet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in its path.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To any observer stationed on the planet, between the extremes of lat.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: 45 degrees on either side of the equator, these wonderful rings would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: present various strange phenomena. Sometimes they would appear as an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: illuminated arch, with the shadow of Saturn passing over it like the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hour-hand over a dial; at other times they would be like a semi-aureole
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of light. Very often, too, for periods of several years, daily eclipses
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the sun must occur through the interposition of this triple ring.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Truly, with the constant rising and setting of the satellites, some with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bright discs at their full, others like silver crescents, in quadrature,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as well as by the encircling rings, the aspect of the heavens from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surface of Saturn must be as impressive as it is gorgeous.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Unable, indeed, the Gallians were to realize all the marvels of this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: strange world. After all, they were practically a thousand times further
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: off than the great astronomers have been able to approach by means of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their giant telescopes. But they did not complain; their little comet,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they knew, was far safer where it was; far better out of the reach of an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attraction which, by affecting their path, might have annihilated their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: best hopes.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The distances of several of the brightest of the fixed stars have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been estimated. Amongst others, Vega in the constellation Lyra is 100
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: millions of millions of miles away; Sirius in Canis Major, 123 millions
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of millions; the Pole-star, 282 millions of millions; and Capella, 340
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: millions of millions of miles, a figure represented by no less than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fifteen digits.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The hard numerical statement of these enormous figures, however,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fails altogether in any adequate way to convey a due impression of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: magnitude of these distances. Astronomers, in their ingenuity, have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: endeavored to use some other basis, and have found "the velocity
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of light" to be convenient for their purpose. They have made their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: representations something in this way:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Suppose," they say, "an observer endowed with an infinite length of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: vision: suppose him stationed on the surface of Capella; looking thence
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: towards the earth, he would be a spectator of events that had happened
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seventy years previously; transport him to a star ten times distant, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he will be reviewing the terrestrial sphere of 720 years back; carry him
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: away further still, to a star so remote that it requires something less
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than nineteen centuries for light to reach it, and he would be a witness
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the birth and death of Christ; convey him further again, and he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shall be looking upon the dread desolation of the Deluge; take him away
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: further yet (for space is infinite), and he shall be a spectator of the
