title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Creation of the spheres. History is thus stereotyped in space; nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: once accomplished can ever be effaced."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Who can altogether be astonished that Palmyrin Rosette, with his burning
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thirst for astronomical research, should have been conscious of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: longing for yet wider travel through the sidereal universe? With his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet now under the influence of one star, now of another, what various
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: systems might he not have explored! what undreamed-of marvels might not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have revealed themselves before his gaze! The stars, fixed and immovable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in name, are all of them in motion, and Gallia might have followed them
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in their un-tracked way.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But Gallia had a narrow destiny. She was not to be allowed to wander
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: away into the range of attraction of another center; nor to mingle with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the star clusters, some of which have been entirely, others partially
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: resolved; nor was she to lose herself amongst the 5,000 nebulae which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have resisted hitherto the grasp of the most powerful reflectors. No;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia was neither to pass beyond the limits of the solar system, nor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to travel out of sight of the terrestrial sphere. Her orbit was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: circumscribed to little over 1,500 millions of miles; and, in comparison
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the infinite space beyond, this was a mere nothing.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XI. A FETE DAY
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The temperature continued to decrease; the mercurial thermometer, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: freezes at 42 degrees below zero, was no longer of service, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: spirit thermometer of the _Dobryna_ had been brought into use. This now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: registered 53 degrees below freezing-point.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In the creek, where the two vessels had been moored for the winter, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elevation of the ice, in anticipation of which Lieutenant Procope had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: taken the precautionary measure of beveling, was going on slowly but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irresistibly, and the tartan was upheaved fifty feet above the level of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Gallian Sea, while the schooner, as being lighter, had been raised
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to a still greater altitude.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: So irresistible was this gradual process of elevation, so utterly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: defying all human power to arrest, that the lieutenant began to feel
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very anxious as to the safety of his yacht. With the exception of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: engine and the masts, everything had been cleared out and conveyed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shore, but in the event of a thaw it appeared that nothing short of a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: miracle could prevent the hull from being dashed to pieces, and then all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: means of leaving the promontory would be gone. The _Hansa_, of course,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would share a similar fate; in fact, it had already heeled over to such
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an extent as to render it quite dangerous for its obstinate owner, who,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at the peril of his life, resolved that he would stay where he could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: watch over his all-precious cargo, though continually invoking curses on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the ill-fate of which he deemed himself the victim.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was, however, a stronger will than Isaac Hakkabut's. Although no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: one of all the community cared at all for the safety of the Jew, they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cared very much for the security of his cargo, and when Servadac found
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that nothing would induce the old man to abandon his present quarters
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: voluntarily, he very soon adopted measures of coercion that were far
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more effectual than any representations of personal danger.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Stop where you like, Hakkabut," said the captain to him; "but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: understand that I consider it my duty to make sure that your cargo is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: taken care of. I am going to have it carried across to land, at once."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Neither groans, nor tears, nor protestations on the part of the Jew,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were of the slightest avail. Forthwith, on the 20th of December, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: removal of the goods commenced.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Both Spaniards and Russians were all occupied for several days in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: work of unloading the tartan. Well muffled up as they were in furs, they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were able to endure the cold with impunity, making it their special care
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to avoid actual contact with any article made of metal, which, in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: low state of the temperature, would inevitably have taken all the skin
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: off their hands, as much as if it had been red-hot. The task, however,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was brought to an end without accident of any kind; and when the stores
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the _Hansa_ were safely deposited in the galleries of the Hive,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope avowed that he really felt that his mind had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unburdened from a great anxiety.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac gave old Isaac full permission to take up his residence
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: amongst the rest of the community, promised him the entire control over
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his own property, and altogether showed him so much consideration that,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but for his unbounded respect for his master, Ben Zoof would have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: liked to reprimand him for his courtesy to a man whom he so cordially
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: despised.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although Hakkabut clamored most vehemently about his goods being carried
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: off "against his will," in his heart he was more than satisfied to see
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his property transferred to a place of safety, and delighted, moreover,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to know that the transport had been effected without a farthing of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: expense to himself. As soon, then, as he found the tartan empty, he was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only too glad to accept the offer that had been made him, and very soon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made his way over to the quarters in the gallery where his merchandise
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had been stored. Here he lived day and night. He supplied himself with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what little food he required from his own stock of provisions, a small
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: spirit-lamp sufficing to perform all the operations of his meager
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cookery. Consequently all intercourse between himself and the rest of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the inhabitants was entirely confined to business transactions, when
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: occasion required that some purchase should be made from his stock
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of commodities. Meanwhile, all the silver and gold of the colony was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gradually finding its way to a double-locked drawer, of which the Jew
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: most carefully guarded the key.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The 1st of January was drawing near, the anniversary of the shock
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which had resulted in the severance of thirty-six human beings from the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: society of their fellow-men. Hitherto, not one of them was missing. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unvarying calmness of the climate, notwithstanding the cold, had tended
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to maintain them in good health, and there seemed no reason to doubt
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that, when Gallia returned to the earth, the total of its little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: population would still be complete.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The 1st of January, it is true, was not properly "New Year's Day" in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia, but Captain Servadac, nevertheless, was very anxious to have it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observed as a holiday.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I do not think," he said to Count Timascheff and Lieutenant Procope,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "that we ought to allow our people to lose their interest in the world
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to which we are all hoping to return; and how can we cement the bond
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that ought to unite us, better than by celebrating, in common with our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fellow-creatures upon earth, a day that awakens afresh the kindliest
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sentiments of all? Besides," he added, smiling, "I expect that Gallia,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: although invisible just at present to the naked eye, is being closely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: watched by the telescopes of our terrestrial friends, and I have no
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: doubt that the newspapers and scientific journals of both hemispheres
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are full of accounts detailing the movements of the new comet."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "True," asserted the count. "I can quite imagine that we are occasioning
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no small excitement in all the chief observatories."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ay, more than that," said the lieutenant; "our Gallia is certain to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be far more than a mere object of scientific interest or curiosity. Why
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should we doubt that the elements of a comet which has once come into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: collision with the earth have by this time been accurately calculated?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: What our friend the professor has done here, has been done likewise on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth, where, beyond a question, all manner of expedients are being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discussed as to the best way of mitigating the violence of a concussion
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that must occur."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant's conjectures were so reasonable that they commanded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: assent. Gallia could scarcely be otherwise than an object of terror to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the inhabitants of the earth, who could by no means be certain that a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: second collision would be comparatively so harmless as the first. Even
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the Gallians themselves, much as they looked forward to the event,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the prospect was not unmixed with alarm, and they would rejoice in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: invention of any device by which it was likely the impetus of the shock
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: might be deadened.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Christmas arrived, and was marked by appropriate religious observance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by everyone in the community, with the exception of the Jew, who made
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a point of secluding himself more obstinately than ever in the gloomy
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: recesses of his retreat.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To Ben Zoof the last week of the year was full of bustle. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: arrangements for the New Year _fete_ were entrusted to him, and he was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: anxious, in spite of the resources of Gallia being so limited, to make
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the program for the great day as attractive as possible.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was a matter of debate that night whether the professor should be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: invited to join the party; it was scarcely likely that he would care
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to come, but, on the whole, it was felt to be advisable to ask him. At
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: first Captain Servadac thought of going in person with the invitation;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but, remembering Rosette's dislike to visitors, he altered his mind, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sent young Pablo up to the observatory with a formal note, requesting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the pleasure of Professor Rosette's company at the New Year's _fete_.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Pablo was soon back, bringing no answer except that the professor had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: told him that "to-day was the 125th of June, and that to-morrow would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the 1st of July."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Consequently, Servadac and the count took it for granted that Palmyrin
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette declined their invitation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: An hour after sunrise on New Year's Day, Frenchmen, Russians, Spaniards,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and little Nina, as the representative of Italy, sat down to a feast
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: such as never before had been seen in Gallia. Ben Zoof and the Russian
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cook had quite surpassed themselves. The wines, part of the _Dobryna's_
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: stores, were of excellent quality. Those of the vintages of France and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Spain were drunk in toasting their respective countries, and even Russia
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was honored in a similar way by means of a few bottles of kummel. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: company was more than contented--it was as jovial as Ben Zoof could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: desire; and the ringing cheers that followed the great toast of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: day--"A happy return to our Mother Earth," must fairly have startled the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: professor in the silence of his observatory.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The _dejeuner_ over, there still remained three hours of daylight. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sun was approaching the zenith, but so dim and enfeebled were his rays
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that they were very unlike what had produced the wines of Bordeaux and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Burgundy which they had just been enjoying, and it was necessary for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all, before starting upon an excursion that would last over nightfall,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to envelop themselves in the thickest of clothing.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Full of spirits, the party left the Hive, and chattering and singing as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they went, made their way down to the frozen shore, where they fastened
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: on their skates. Once upon the ice, everyone followed his own fancy,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and some singly, some in groups, scattered themselves in all directions.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac, the count, and the lieutenant were generally seen
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: together. Negrete and the Spaniards, now masters of their novel
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exercise, wandered fleetly and gracefully hither and thither,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: occasionally being out of sight completely. The Russian sailors,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: following a northern custom, skated in file, maintaining their rank by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: means of a long pole passed under their right arms, and in this way they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: described a trackway of singular regularity. The two children, blithe
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as birds, flitted about, now singly, now arm-in-arm, now joining the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain's party, now making a short peregrination by themselves, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: always full of life and spirit. As for Ben Zoof, he was here, there,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and everywhere, his imperturbable good temper ensuring him a smile of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: welcome whenever he appeared.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Thus coursing rapidly over the icy plain, the whole party had soon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exceeded the line that made the horizon from the shore. First, the rocks
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the coast were lost to view; then the white crests of the cliffs were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no longer to be seen; and at last, the summit of the volcano, with its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: corona of vapor, was entirely out of sight. Occasionally the skaters
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were obliged to stop to recover their breath, but, fearful of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frost-bite, they almost instantly resumed their exercise, and proceeded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nearly as far as Gourbi Island before they thought about retracing their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: course.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But night was coming on, and the sun was already sinking in the east
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the rapidity to which the residents on Gallia were by this time
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: well accustomed. The sunset upon this contracted horizon was very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remarkable. There was not a cloud nor a vapor to catch the tints of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: declining beams; the surface of the ice did not, as a liquid sea would,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reflect the last green ray of light; but the radiant orb, enlarged by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the effect of refraction, its circumference sharply defined against the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sky, sank abruptly, as though a trap had been opened in the ice for its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reception.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Before the daylight ended. Captain Servadac had cautioned the party to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: collect themselves betimes into one group. "Unless you are sure of your
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whereabouts before dark," he said, "you will not find it after. We have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: come out like a party of skirmishers; let us go back in full force."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The night would be dark; their moon was in conjunction, and would not be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seen; the stars would only give something of that "pale radiance" which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the poet Corneille has described.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Immediately after sunset the torches were lighted, and the long series
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of flames, fanned by the rapid motion of their bearers, had much the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appearance of an enormous fiery banner. An hour later, and the volcano
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appeared like a dim shadow on the horizon, the light from the crater
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shedding a lurid glare upon the surrounding gloom. In time the glow of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the burning lava, reflected in the icy mirror, fell upon the troop of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: skaters, and cast their lengthened shadows grotesquely on the surface of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the frozen sea.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Later still, half an hour or more afterwards, the torches were all but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dying out. The shore was close at hand. All at once, Ben Zoof uttered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a startled cry, and pointed with bewildered excitement towards the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mountain. Involuntarily, one and all, they plowed their heels into the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ice and came to a halt. Exclamations of surprise and horror burst from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: every lip. The volcano was extinguished! The stream of burning lava had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suddenly ceased to flow!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Speechless with amazement, they stood still for some moments. There was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not one of them that did not realize, more or less, how critical was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their position. The sole source of the heat that had enabled them to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brave the rigor of the cold had failed them! death, in the cruellest of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all shapes, seemed staring them in the face--death from cold! Meanwhile,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the last torch had flickered out.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was quite dark.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Forward!" cried Servadac, firmly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At the word of command they advanced to the shore; clambered with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no little difficulty up the slippery rocks; gained the mouth of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gallery; groped their way into the common hall.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: How dreary! how chill it seemed!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The fiery cataract no longer spread its glowing covering over the mouth
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the grotto. Lieutenant Procope leaned through the aperture. The pool,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hitherto kept fluid by its proximity to the lava, was already encrusted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with a layer of ice.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Such was the end of the New Year's Day so happily begun.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XII. THE BOWELS OF THE COMET
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The whole night was spent in speculating, with gloomy forebodings, upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the chances of the future. The temperature of the hall, now entirely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exposed to the outer air, was rapidly falling, and would quickly become
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unendurable. Far too intense was the cold to allow anyone to remain at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the opening, and the moisture on the walls soon resolved itself into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: icicles. But the mountain was like the body of a dying man, that retains
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: awhile a certain amount of heat at the heart after the extremities have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: become cold and dead. In the more interior galleries there was still a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certain degree of warmth, and hither Servadac and his companions were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: glad enough to retreat.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Here they found the professor, who, startled by the sudden cold, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been fain to make a precipitate retreat from his observatory. Now would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have been the opportunity to demand of the enthusiast whether he would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: like to prolong his residence indefinitely upon his little comet. It is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: very likely that he would have declared himself ready to put up with any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: amount of discomfort to be able to gratify his love of investigation;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but all were far too disheartened and distressed to care to banter him
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon the subject on which he was so sensitive.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Next morning, Servadac thus addressed his people. "My friends, except
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from cold, we have nothing to fear. Our provisions are ample--more than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enough for the remaining period of our sojourn in this lone world of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ours; our preserved meat is already cooked; we shall be able to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dispense with all fuel for cooking purposes. All that we require is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: warmth--warmth for ourselves; let us secure that, and all may be well.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Now, I do not entertain a doubt but that the warmth we require is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: resident in the bowels of this mountain on which we are living; to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the depth of those bowels we must penetrate; there we shall obtain the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: warmth which is indispensable to our very existence."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: His tone, quite as much as his words, restored confidence to many of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: people, who were already yielding to a feeling of despair. The count and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the lieutenant fervently, but silently, grasped his hand.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nina," said the captain, "you will not be afraid to go down to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lower depths of the mountain, will you?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Not if Pablo goes," replied the child.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh yes, of course, Pablo will go. You are not afraid to go, are you,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Pablo?" he said, addressing the boy.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Anywhere with you, your Excellency," was the boy's prompt reply.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And certain it was that no time must be lost in penetrating below
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the heart of the volcano; already the most protected of the many
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ramifications of Nina's Hive were being pervaded by a cold that was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: insufferable. It was an acknowledged impossibility to get access to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: crater by the exterior declivities of the mountain-side; they were far
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: too steep and too slippery to afford a foothold. It must of necessity be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entered from the interior.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope accordingly undertook the task of exploring all the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: galleries, and was soon able to report that he had discovered one which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he had every reason to believe abutted upon the central funnel. His
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reason for coming to this conclusion was that the caloric emitted by the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rising vapors of the hot lava seemed to be oozing, as it were, out of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the tellurium, which had been demonstrated already to be a conductor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of heat. Only succeed in piercing through this rock for seven or eight
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: yards, and the lieutenant did not doubt that his way would be opened
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into the old lava-course, by following which he hoped descent would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: easy.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Under the lieutenant's direction the Russian sailors were immediately
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: set to work. Their former experience had convinced them that spades and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pick-axes were of no avail, and their sole resource was to proceed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by blasting with gunpowder. However skillfully the operation might be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: carried on, it must necessarily occupy several days, and during that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: time the sufferings from cold must be very severe.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "If we fail in our object, and cannot get to the depths of the mountain,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: our little colony is doomed," said Count Timascheff.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That speech is not like yourself," answered Servadac, smiling. "What
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: has become of the faith which has hitherto carried you so bravely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: through all our difficulties?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count shook his head, as if in despair, and said, sadly, "The Hand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that has hitherto been outstretched to help seems now to be withdrawn."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But only to test our powers of endurance," rejoined the captain,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earnestly. "Courage, my friend, courage! Something tells me that this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cessation of the eruption is only partial; the internal fire is not all
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extinct. All is not over yet. It is too soon to give up; never despair!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope quite concurred with the captain. Many causes, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: knew, besides the interruption of the influence of the oxygen upon the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mineral substances in Gallia's interior, might account for the stoppage
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the lava-flow in this one particular spot, and he considered it more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than probable that a fresh outlet had been opened in some other part of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the surface, and that the eruptive matter had been diverted into the new
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: channel. But at present his business was to prosecute his labors so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that a retreat might be immediately effected from their now untenable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: position.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Restless and agitated, Professor Rosette, if he took any interest in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: these discussions, certainly took no share in them. He had brought his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: telescope down from the observatory into the common hall, and there at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frequent intervals, by night and by day, he would endeavor to continue
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his observations; but the intense cold perpetually compelled him to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: desist, or he would literally have been frozen to death. No sooner,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however, did he find himself obliged to retreat from his study of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: heavens, than he would begin overwhelming everybody about him with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bitter complaints, pouring out his regrets that he had ever quitted his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quarters at Formentera.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 4th of January, by persevering industry, the process of boring
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was completed, and the lieutenant could hear that fragments of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: blasted rock, as the sailors cleared them away with their spades, were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rolling into the funnel of the crater. He noticed, too, that they did
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not fall perpendicularly, but seemed to slide along, from which he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inferred that the sides of the crater were sloping; he had therefore
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reason to hope that a descent would be found practicable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Larger and larger grew the orifice; at length it would admit a man's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: body, and Ben Zoof, carrying a torch, pushed himself through it,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: followed by the lieutenant and Servadac. Procope's conjecture proved
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: correct. On entering the crater, they found that the sides slanted at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the angle of about 4 degrees; moreover, the eruption had evidently been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of recent origin, dating probably only from the shock which had invested
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia with a proportion of the atmosphere of the earth, and beneath
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the coating of ashes with which they were covered, there were various
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irregularities in the rock, not yet worn away by the action of the lava,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and these afforded a tolerably safe footing.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Rather a bad staircase!" said Ben Zoof, as they began to make their way
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: down.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In about half an hour, proceeding in a southerly direction, they had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: descended nearly five hundred feet. From time to time they came
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: upon large excavations that at first sight had all the appearance of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: galleries, but by waving his torch, Ben Zoof could always see their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extreme limits, and it was evident that the lower strata of the mountain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: did not present the same system of ramification that rendered the Hive
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: above so commodious a residence.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was not a time to be fastidious; they must be satisfied with such
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accommodation as they could get, provided it was warm. Captain Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was only too glad to find that his hopes about the temperature were to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a certain extent realized. The lower they went, the greater was the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diminution in the cold, a diminution that was far more rapid than that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which is experienced in making the descent of terrestrial mines. In
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this case it was a volcano, not a colliery, that was the object of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exploration, and thankful enough they were to find that it had not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: become extinct. Although the lava, from some unknown cause, had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ceased to rise in the crater, yet plainly it existed somewhere in an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: incandescent state, and was still transmitting considerable heat to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inferior strata.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lieutenant Procope had brought in his hand a mercurial thermometer,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and Servadac carried an aneroid barometer, by means of which he could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: estimate the depth of their descent below the level of the Gallian Sea.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: When they were six hundred feet below the orifice the mercury registered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a temperature of 6 degrees below zero.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Six degrees!" said Servadac; "that will not suit us. At this low
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: temperature we could not survive the winter. We must try deeper down. I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only hope the ventilation will hold out."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was, however, nothing to fear on the score of ventilation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The great current of air that rushed into the aperture penetrated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: everywhere, and made respiration perfectly easy.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The descent was continued for about another three hundred feet, which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: brought the explorers to a total depth of nine hundred feet from their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: old quarters. Here the thermometer registered 12 degrees above zero--a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: temperature which, if only it were permanent, was all they wanted. There
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was no advantage in proceeding any further along the lava-course; they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could already hear the dull rumblings that indicated that they were at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no great distance from the central focus.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Quite near enough for me!" exclaimed Ben Zoof. "Those who are chilly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are welcome to go as much lower as they like. For my part, I shall be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quite warm enough here."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After throwing the gleams of torch-light in all directions, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: explorers seated themselves on a jutting rock, and began to debate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whether it was practicable for the colony to make an abode in these
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lower depths of the mountain. The prospect, it must be owned, was not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inviting. The crater, it is true, widened out into a cavern sufficiently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: large, but here its accommodation ended. Above and below were a few
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ledges in the rock that would serve as receptacles for provisions; but,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with the exception of a small recess that must be reserved for Nina,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it was clear that henceforth they must all renounce the idea of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: having separate apartments. The single cave must be their dining-room,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: drawing-room, and dormitory, all in one. From living the life of rabbits
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in a warren, they were reduced to the existence of moles, with the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difference that they could not, like them, forget their troubles in a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: long winter's sleep.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The cavern, however, was quite capable of being lighted by means of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lamps and lanterns. Among the stores were several barrels of oil and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a considerable quantity of spirits of wine, which might be burned when
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: required for cooking purposes. Moreover, it would be unnecessary for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them to confine themselves entirely to the seclusion of their gloomy
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: residence; well wrapped up, there would be nothing to prevent them
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: making occasional excursions both to the Hive and to the sea-shore. A
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: supply of fresh water would be constantly required; ice for this purpose
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: must be perpetually carried in from the coast, and it would be necessary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to arrange that everyone in turn should perform this office, as it would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be no sinecure to clamber up the sides of the crater for 900 feet, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: descend the same distance with a heavy burden.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But the emergency was great, and it was accordingly soon decided that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the little colony should forthwith take up its quarters in the cave.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: After all, they said, they should hardly be much worse off than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: thousands who annually winter in Arctic regions. On board the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whaling-vessels, and in the establishments of the Hudson's Bay Company,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: such luxuries as separate cabins or sleeping-chambers are never thought
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of; one large apartment, well heated and ventilated, with as few corners
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as possible, is considered far more healthy; and on board ship the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entire hold, and in forts a single floor, is appropriated to this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: purpose. The recollection of this fact served to reconcile them, in a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: great degree, to the change to which they felt it requisite to submit.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Having remounted the ascent, they made the result of their exploration
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: known to the mass of the community, who received the tidings with a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sense of relief, and cordially accepted the scheme of the migration.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The first step was to clear the cavern of its accumulation of ashes,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and then the labor of removal commenced in earnest. Never was a task
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: undertaken with greater zest. The fear of being to a certainty frozen
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to death if they remained where they were, was a stimulus that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made everyone put forth all his energies. Beds, furniture, cooking
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: utensils--first the stores of the _Dobryna_, then the cargo of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tartan--all were carried down with the greatest alacrity, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: diminished weight combined with the downhill route to make the labor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proceed with incredible briskness.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although Professor Rosette yielded to the pressure of circumstances,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and allowed himself to be conducted to the lower regions, nothing would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: induce him to allow his telescope to be carried underground; and as it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was undeniable that it would certainly be of no service deep down in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bowels of the mountain, it was allowed to remain undisturbed upon its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tripod in the great hall of Nina's Hive.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: As for Isaac Hakkabut, his outcry was beyond description lamentable.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Never, in the whole universe, had a merchant met with such reverses;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: never had such a pitiable series of losses befallen an unfortunate man.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Regardless of the ridicule which his abject wretchedness excited, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: howled on still, and kept up an unending wail; but meanwhile he kept
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a keen eye upon every article of his property, and amidst universal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: laughter insisted on having every item registered in an inventory as it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was transferred to its appointed place of safety. Servadac considerately
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: allowed the whole of the cargo to be deposited in a hollow apart by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: itself, over which the Jew was permitted to keep a watch as vigilant as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he pleased.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: By the 10th the removal was accomplished. Rescued, at all events, from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the exposure to a perilous temperature of 60 degrees below zero, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: community was installed in its new home. The large cave was lighted by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the _Dobryna's_ lamps, while several lanterns, suspended at intervals
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: along the acclivity that led to their deserted quarters above, gave
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a weird picturesqueness to the scene, that might vie with any of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: graphic descriptions of the "Arabian Nights' Entertainments."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How do you like this, Nina?" said Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "_Va bene!_" replied the child. "We are only living in the cellars
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: instead of upon the ground floor."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We will try and make ourselves comfortable," said the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh yes, we will be happy here," rejoined the child; "it is nice and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: warm."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although they were as careful as they could to conceal their misgivings
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the rest, Servadac and his two friends could not regard their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: present situation without distrust. When alone, they would frequently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ask each other what would become of them all, if the volcanic heat
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should really be subsiding, or if some unexpected perturbation should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: retard the course of the comet, and compel them to an indefinitely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prolonged residence in their grim abode. It was scarcely likely that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet could supply the fuel of which ere long they would be in urgent
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: need. Who could expect to find coal in the bowels of Gallia,--coal,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which is the residuum of ancient forests mineralized by the lapse of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ages? Would not the lava-cinders exhumed from the extinct volcano be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their last poor resource?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Keep up your spirits, my friends," said Servadac; "we have plenty of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: time before us at present. Let us hope that as fresh difficulties arise,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fresh ways of escape will open. Never despair!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "True," said the count; "it is an old saying that 'Necessity is the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mother of invention.' Besides, I should think it very unlikely that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: internal heat will fail us now before the summer."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant declared that he entertained the same hope. As the reason
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his opinion he alleged that the combustion of the eruptive matter
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was most probably of quite recent origin, because the comet before
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its collision with the earth had possessed no atmosphere, and that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequently no oxygen could have penetrated to its interior.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Most likely you are right," replied the count; "and so far from
