title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dreading a failure of the internal heat, I am not quite sure that we may
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not be exposed to a more terrible calamity still?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What?" asked Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The calamity of the eruption breaking out suddenly again, and taking us
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by surprise."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Heavens!" cried the captain, "we will not think of that."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The outbreak may happen again," said the lieutenant, calmly; "but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it will be our fault, our own lack of vigilance, if we are taken by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: surprise." And so the conversation dropped.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The 15th of January dawned; and the comet was 220,000,000 leagues from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the sun.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gallia had reached its aphelion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XIII. DREARY MONTHS
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Henceforth, then, with a velocity ever increasing, Gallia would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: re-approach the sun.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Except the thirteen Englishmen who had been left at Gibraltar, every
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: living creature had taken refuge in the dark abyss of the volcano's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: crater.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And with those Englishmen, how had it fared?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Far better than with ourselves," was the sentiment that would have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been universally accepted in Nina's Hive. And there was every reason
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to conjecture that so it was. The party at Gibraltar, they all agreed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would not, like themselves, have been compelled to have recourse to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a stream of lava for their supply of heat; they, no doubt, had had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: abundance of fuel as well as food; and in their solid casemate, with its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: substantial walls, they would find ample shelter from the rigor of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cold. The time would have been passed at least in comfort, and perhaps
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in contentment; and Colonel Murphy and Major Oliphant would have had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: leisure more than sufficient for solving the most abstruse problems of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the chess-board. All of them, too, would be happy in the confidence that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: when the time should come, England would have full meed of praise to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: award to the gallant soldiers who had adhered so well and so manfully to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their post.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It did, indeed, more than once occur to the minds both of Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and his friends that, if their condition should become one of extreme
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: emergency, they might, as a last resource, betake themselves to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gibraltar, and there seek a refuge; but their former reception had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not been of the kindest, and they were little disposed to renew an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: acquaintanceship that was marked by so little cordiality. Not in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: least that they would expect to meet with any inhospitable rebuff. Far
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from that; they knew well enough that Englishmen, whatever their faults,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would be the last to abandon their fellow-creatures in the hour of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distress. Nevertheless, except the necessity became far more urgent than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it had hitherto proved, they resolved to endeavor to remain in their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: present quarters. Up till this time no casualties had diminished
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their original number, but to undertake so long a journey across that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: unsheltered expanse of ice could scarcely fail to result in the loss of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some of their party.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: However great was the desire to find a retreat for every living thing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the deep hollow of the crater, it was found necessary to slaughter
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: almost all the domestic animals before the removal of the community from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Nina's Hive. To have stabled them all in the cavern below would have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: been quite impossible, whilst to have left them in the upper galleries
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would only have been to abandon them to a cruel death; and since meat
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could be preserved for an indefinite time in the original store-places,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: now colder than ever, the expedient of killing the animals seemed to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: recommend itself as equally prudent and humane.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Naturally the captain and Ben Zoof were most anxious that their favorite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: horses should be saved, and accordingly, by dint of the greatest care,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: all difficulties in the way were overcome, and Zephyr and Galette were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conducted down the crater, where they were installed in a large hole and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: provided with forage, which was still abundant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Birds, subsisting only on scraps thrown out to them did not cease to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: follow the population in its migration, and so numerous did they become
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that multitudes of them had repeatedly to be destroyed.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The general re-arrangement of the new residence was no easy business,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and occupied so much time that the end of January arrived before they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could be said to be fairly settled. And then began a life of dreary
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: monotony. Then seemed to creep over everyone a kind of moral torpor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: as well as physical lassitude, which Servadac, the count, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lieutenant did their best not only to combat in themselves, but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to counteract in the general community. They provided a variety of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: intellectual pursuits; they instituted debates in which everybody was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: encouraged to take part; they read aloud, and explained extracts from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the elementary manuals of science, or from the books of adventurous
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: travel which their library supplied; and Russians and Spaniards, day
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: after day, might be seen gathered round the large table, giving their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: best attention to instruction which should send them back to Mother
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Earth less ignorant than they had left her.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Selfish and morose, Hakkabut could never be induced to be present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at these social gatherings. He was far too much occupied in his own
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: appropriated corner, either in conning his accounts, or in counting his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: money. Altogether, with what he had before, he now possessed the round
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sum of 150,000 francs, half of which was in sterling gold; but nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could give him any satisfaction while he knew that the days were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: passing, and that he was denied the opportunity of putting out his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: capital in advantageous investments, or securing a proper interest.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Neither did Palmyrin Rosette find leisure to take any share in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mutual intercourse. His occupation was far too absorbing for him to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suffer it to be interrupted, and to him, living as he did perpetually in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a world of figures, the winter days seemed neither long nor wearisome.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Having ascertained every possible particular about his comet, he was now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: devoting himself with equal ardor to the analysis of all the properties
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the satellite Nerina, to which he appeared to assert the same claim
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of proprietorship.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In order to investigate Nerina it was indispensable that he should make
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: several actual observations at various points of the orbit; and for this
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: purpose he repeatedly made his way up to the grotto above, where, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: spite of the extreme severity of the cold, he would persevere in the use
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his telescope till he was all but paralyzed. But what he felt more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: than anything was the want of some retired apartment, where he could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pursue his studies without hindrance or intrusion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was about the beginning of February, when the professor brought his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: complaint to Captain Servadac, and begged him to assign him a chamber,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no matter how small, in which he should be free to carry on his task in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: silence and without molestation. So readily did Servadac promise to do
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: everything in his power to provide him with the accommodation for which
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he asked, that the professor was put into such a manifest good temper
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the captain ventured to speak upon the matter that was ever
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: uppermost in his mind.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I do not mean," he began timidly, "to cast the least imputation of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inaccuracy upon any of your calculations, but would you allow me, my
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dear professor, to suggest that you should revise your estimate of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: duration of Gallia's period of revolution. It is so important, you know,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: so all important; the difference of one half minute, you know, would so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certainly mar the expectation of reunion with the earth--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And seeing a cloud gathering on Rosette's face, he added:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am sure Lieutenant Procope would be only too happy to render you any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: assistance in the revision."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Sir," said the professor, bridling up, "I want no assistant; my
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: calculations want no revision. I never make an error. I have made my
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reckoning as far as Gallia is concerned. I am now making a like estimate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the elements of Nerina."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Conscious how impolitic it would be to press this matter further, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain casually remarked that he should have supposed that all the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: elements of Nerina had been calculated long since by astronomers on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: earth. It was about as unlucky a speech as he could possibly have made.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The professor glared at him fiercely.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Astounding, sir!" he exclaimed. "Yes! Nerina was a planet then;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: everything that appertained to the planet was determined; but Nerina is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a moon now. And do you not think, sir, that we have a right to know as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: much about our moon as those _terrestrials_"--and he curled his lip as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he spoke with a contemptuous emphasis--"know of theirs?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I beg pardon," said the corrected captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well then, never mind," replied the professor, quickly appeased; "only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will you have the goodness to get me a proper place for study?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I will, as I promised, do all I can," answered Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very good," said the professor. "No immediate hurry; an hour hence will
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: do."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But in spite of this condescension on the part of the man of science,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: some hours had to elapse before any place of retreat could be discovered
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: likely to suit his requirements; but at length a little nook was found
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the side of the cavern just large enough to hold an armchair and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a table, and in this the astronomer was soon ensconced to his entire
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: satisfaction.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Buried thus, nearly 900 feet below ground, the Gallians ought to have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had unbounded mental energy to furnish an adequate reaction to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: depressing monotony of their existence; but many days would often elapse
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: without any one of them ascending to the surface of the soil, and had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it not been for the necessity of obtaining fresh water, it seemed almost
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: probable that there would never have been an effort made to leave the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cavern at all.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A few excursions, it is true, were made in the downward direction. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: three leaders, with Ben Zoof, made their way to the lower depths of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: crater, not with the design of making any further examination as to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the nature of the rock--for although it might be true enough that it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: contained thirty per cent. of gold, it was as valueless to them as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: granite--but with the intention of ascertaining whether the subterranean
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fire still retained its activity. Satisfied upon this point, they came
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the conclusion that the eruption which had so suddenly ceased in one
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: spot had certainly broken out in another.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: February, March, April, May, passed wearily by; but day succeeded to day
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with such gloomy sameness that it was little wonder that no notice was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: taken of the lapse of time. The people seemed rather to vegetate than
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to live, and their want of vigor became at times almost alarming. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: readings around the long table ceased to be attractive, and the debates,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sustained by few, became utterly wanting in animation. The Spaniards
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could hardly be roused to quit their beds, and seemed to have scarcely
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: energy enough to eat. The Russians, constitutionally of more enduring
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: temperament, did not give way to the same extent, but the long and drear
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: confinement was beginning to tell upon them all. Servadac, the count,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and the lieutenant all knew well enough that it was the want of air and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: exercise that was the cause of much of this mental depression; but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what could they do? The most serious remonstrances on their part were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entirely in vain. In fact, they themselves occasionally fell a prey
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the same lassitude both of body and mind. Long fits of drowsiness,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: combined with an utter aversion to food, would come over them. It almost
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seemed as if their entire nature had become degenerate, and that, like
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tortoises, they could sleep and fast till the return of summer.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Strange to say, little Nina bore her hardships more bravely than any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of them. Flitting about, coaxing one to eat, another to drink, rousing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Pablo as often as he seemed yielding to the common languor, the child
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: became the life of the party. Her merry prattle enlivened the gloom of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the grim cavern like the sweet notes of a bird; her gay Italian songs
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: broke the monotony of the depressing silence; and almost unconscious as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the half-dormant population of Gallia were of her influence, they still
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would have missed her bright presence sorely. The months still glided
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: on; how, it seemed impossible for the inhabitants of the living tomb to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: say. There was a dead level of dullness.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At the beginning of June the general torpor appeared slightly to relax
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its hold upon its victims. This partial revival was probably due to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: somewhat increased influence of the sun, still far, far away. During
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the first half of the Gallian year, Lieutenant Procope had taken careful
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: note of Rosette's monthly announcements of the comet's progress, and he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was able now, without reference to the professor, to calculate the rate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of advance on its way back towards the sun. He found that Gallia had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: re-crossed the orbit of Jupiter, but was still at the enormous distance
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of 197,000,000 leagues from the sun, and he reckoned that in about four
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: months it would have entered the zone of the telescopic planets.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gradually, but uninterruptedly, life and spirits continued to revive,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and by the end of the month Servadac and his little colony had regained
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: most of their ordinary physical and mental energies. Ben Zoof, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: particular, roused himself with redoubled vigor, like a giant refreshed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: from his slumbers. The visits, consequently, to the long-neglected
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: galleries of Nina's Hive became more and more frequent.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: One day an excursion was made to the shore. It was still bitterly cold,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but the atmosphere had lost nothing of its former stillness, and not a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cloud was visible from horizon to zenith. The old footmarks were all as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distinct as on the day in which they had been imprinted, and the only
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: portion of the shore where any change was apparent was in the little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: creek. Here the elevation of the ice had gone on increasing, until the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: schooner and the tartan had been uplifted to a height of 150 feet, not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: only rendering them quite inaccessible, but exposing them to all but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certain destruction in the event of a thaw.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Isaac Hakkabut, immovable from the personal oversight of his property
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the cavern, had not accompanied the party, and consequently was in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: blissful ignorance of the fate that threatened his vessel. "A good thing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the old fellow wasn't there to see," observed Ben Zoof; "he would have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: screamed like a peacock. What a misfortune it is," he added, speaking to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself, "to have a peacock's voice, without its plumage!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: During the months of July and August, Gallia advanced 164,000,000
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: leagues along her orbit. At night the cold was still intense, but in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the daytime the sun, here full upon the equator, caused an appreciable
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: difference of 20 degrees in the temperature. Like birds, the population
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: spent whole days exposed to its grateful warmth, rarely returning till
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nightfall to the shade of their gloomy home.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: This spring-time, if such it may be called, had a most enlivening
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: influence upon all. Hope and courage revived as day by day the sun's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disc expanded in the heavens, and every evening the earth assumed a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: greater magnitude amongst the fixed stars. It was distant yet, but the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: goal was cheeringly in view.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I can't believe that yonder little speck of light contains my mountain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of Montmartre," said Ben Zoof, one night, after he had been gazing long
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and steadily at the far-off world.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You will, I hope, some day find out that it does," answered his master.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I hope so," said the orderly, without moving his eye from the distant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sphere. After meditating a while, he spoke again. "I suppose Professor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette couldn't make his comet go straight back, could he?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hush!" cried Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof understood the correction.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No," continued the captain; "it is not for man to disturb the order of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the universe. That belongs to a Higher Power than ours!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XIV. THE PROFESSOR PERPLEXED
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Another month passed away, and it was now September, but it was still
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impossible to leave the warmth of the subterranean retreat for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: more airy and commodious quarters of the Hive, where "the bees" would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: certainly have been frozen to death in their cells. It was altogether
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quite as much a matter of congratulation as of regret that the volcano
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: showed no symptoms of resuming its activity; for although a return of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the eruption might have rendered their former resort again habitable,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any sudden outbreak would have been disastrous to them where they were,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the crater being the sole outlet by which the burning lava could escape.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A wretched time we have had for the last seven months," said the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: orderly one day to his master; "but what a comfort little Nina has been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to us all!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, indeed," replied Servadac; "she is a charming little creature. I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hardly know how we should have got on without her."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What is to become of her when we arrive back at the earth?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Not much fear, Ben Zoof, but that she will be well taken care of.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Perhaps you and I had better adopt her."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ay, yes," assented the orderly. "You can be her father, and I can be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: her mother."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac laughed. "Then you and I shall be man and wife."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We have been as good as that for a long time," observed Ben Zoof,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: gravely.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: By the beginning of October, the temperature had so far moderated that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it could scarcely be said to be intolerable. The comet's distance was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scarcely three times as great from the sun as the earth from the sun, so
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that the thermometer rarely sunk beyond 35 degrees below zero. The whole
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: party began to make almost daily visits to the Hive, and frequently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proceeded to the shore, where they resumed their skating exercise,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rejoicing in their recovered freedom like prisoners liberated from a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dungeon. Whilst the rest were enjoying their recreation, Servadac and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the count would hold long conversations with Lieutenant Procope about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their present position and future prospects, discussing all manner of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: speculations as to the results of the anticipated collision with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth, and wondering whether any measures could be devised for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mitigating the violence of a shock which might be terrible in its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequences, even if it did not entail a total annihilation of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: themselves.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was no visitor to the Hive more regular than Rosette. He
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had already directed his telescope to be moved back to his former
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observatory, where, as much as the cold would permit him, he persisted
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in making his all-absorbing studies of the heavens.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The result of these studies no one ventured to inquire; but it became
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: generally noticed that something was very seriously disturbing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the professor's equanimity. Not only would he be seen toiling more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frequently up the arduous way that lay between his nook below and his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: telescope above, but he would be heard muttering in an angry tone that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: indicated considerable agitation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: One day, as he was hurrying down to his study, he met Ben Zoof, who,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: secretly entertaining a feeling of delight at the professor's manifest
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discomfiture, made some casual remark about things not being very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: straight. The way in which his advance was received the good orderly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: never divulged, but henceforward he maintained the firm conviction that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: there was something very much amiss up in the sky.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To Servadac and his friends this continual disquietude and ill-humor on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the part of the professor occasioned no little anxiety. From what, they
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: asked, could his dissatisfaction arise? They could only conjecture that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he had discovered some flaw in his reckonings; and if this were so,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: might there not be reason to apprehend that their anticipations of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coming into contact with the earth, at the settled time, might all be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: falsified?
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Day followed day, and still there was no cessation of the professor's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: discomposure. He was the most miserable of mortals. If really his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: calculations and his observations were at variance, this, in a man of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his irritable temperament, would account for his perpetual perturbation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But he entered into no explanation; he only climbed up to his telescope,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: looking haggard and distressed, and when compelled by the frost to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: retire, he would make his way back to his study more furious than ever.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: At times he was heard giving vent to his vexation. "Confound it! what
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: does it mean? what is she doing? All behind! Is Newton a fool? Is the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: law of universal gravitation the law of universal nonsense?" And the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little man would seize his head in both his hands, and tear away at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: scanty locks which he could ill afford to lose.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Enough was overheard to confirm the suspicion that there was some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: irreconcilable discrepancy between the results of his computation and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: what he had actually observed; and yet, if he had been called upon to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: say, he would have sooner insisted that there was derangement in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the laws of celestial mechanism, than have owned there was the least
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: probability of error in any of his own calculations. Assuredly, if the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: poor professor had had any flesh to lose he would have withered away to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But this state of things was before long to come to an end. On the 12th,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof, who was hanging about outside the great hall of the cavern,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: heard the professor inside utter a loud cry. Hurrying in to ascertain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Eureka!" again shrieked the little man.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Without availing himself of this polite invitation, Ben Zoof betook
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself to his master. "Something has happened to the professor,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But, however great was his desire to ascertain what this discovery
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: implied, his curiosity was not yet destined to be gratified. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not vouchsafe any reply to Servadac's inquiries, and withdrew to his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: study.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: From that day Rosette, for some reason at present incomprehensible,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quite altered his behavior to Isaac Hakkabut, a man for whom he had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: always hitherto evinced the greatest repugnance and contempt. All at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: once he began to show a remarkable interest in the Jew and his affairs,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: paying several visits to the dark little storehouse, making inquiries as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the state of business and expressing some solicitude about the state
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the exchequer.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The wily Jew was taken somewhat by surprise, but came to an immediate
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: conclusion that the professor was contemplating borrowing some money; he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was consequently very cautious in all his replies.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was not Hakkabut's habit ever to advance a loan except at an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extravagant rate of interest, or without demanding far more than an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: adequate security. Count Timascheff, a Russian nobleman, was evidently
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rich; to him perhaps, for a proper consideration, a loan might be made:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac was a Gascon, and Gascons are proverbially poor; it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would never do to lend any money to him; but here was a professor,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a mere man of science, with circumscribed means; did _he_ expect to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: borrow? Certainly Isaac would as soon think of flying, as of lending
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: money to him. Such were the thoughts that made him receive all Rosette's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: approaches with a careful reservation.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was not long, however, before Hakkabut was to be called upon to apply
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his money to a purpose for which he had not reckoned. In his eagerness
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to effect sales, he had parted with all the alimentary articles in his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cargo without having the precautionary prudence to reserve enough for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his own consumption. Amongst other things that failed him was his stock
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of coffee, and as coffee was a beverage without which he deemed it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: impossible to exist, he found himself in considerable perplexity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He pondered the matter over for a long time, and ultimately persuaded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself that, after all, the stores were the common property of all,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and that he had as much right to a share as anyone else. Accordingly, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made his way to Ben Zoof, and, in the most amiable tone he could assume,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The orderly shook his head dubiously.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A pound of coffee, old Nathan? I can't say."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why not? You have some?" said Isaac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then let me have one pound. I shall be grateful."

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hang your gratitude!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Only one pound! You would not refuse anybody else."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That's just the very point, old Samuel; if you were anybody else,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Excellency."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh, his Excellency will do me justice."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Perhaps you will find his justice rather too much for you." And with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this consoling remark, the orderly went to seek his master.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette meanwhile had been listening to the conversation, and secretly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rejoicing that an opportunity for which he had been watching had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: arrived. "What's the matter, Master Isaac? Have you parted with all your
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: use. In my little black hole I cannot live without my coffee."

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No doubt."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: "Merciful heavens!" began the Jew.

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: exertions, he said, "The old reprobate, the rascal has cheated us! His
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: steelyard is wrong! He is a thief!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Servadac looked sternly at Hakkabut.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How is this, Hakkabut? Is this a fact?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No, no--yes--no, your Excellency, only--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "He is a cheat, a thief!" roared the excited astronomer. "His weights
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: deceive!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Stop, stop!" interposed Servadac; "let us hear. Tell me, Hakkabut--"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The steelyard lies! It cheats! it lies!" roared the irrepressible
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Tell me, Hakkabut, I say," repeated Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Jew only kept on stammering, "Yes--no--I don't know."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But heedless of any interruption, the professor continued, "False
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: weights! That confounded steelyard! It gave a false result! The mass was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wrong! The observations contradicted the calculations; they were wrong!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: She was out of place! Yes, out of place entirely."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What!" cried Servadac and Procope in a breath, "out of place?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, completely," said the professor.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Gallia out of place?" repeated Servadac, agitated with alarm.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I did not say Gallia," replied Rosette, stamping his foot impetuously;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: "I said Nerina."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh, Nerina," answered Servadac. "But what of Gallia?" he inquired,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: still nervously.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Gallia, of course, is on her way to the earth. I told you so. But that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Jew is a rascal!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: It was as the professor had said. From the day that Isaac Hakkabut had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: entered upon his mercantile career, his dealings had all been carried
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: on by a system of false weight. That deceitful steelyard had been the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mainspring of his fortune. But when it had become his lot to be the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: purchaser instead of the vendor, his spirit had groaned within him at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: being compelled to reap the fruits of his own dishonesty. No one who had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: studied his character could be much surprised at the confession that was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extorted from him, that for every supposed kilogramme that he had ever
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sold the true weight was only 750 grammes, or just five and twenty per
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cent. less than it ought to have been.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The professor, however, had ascertained all that he wanted to know. By
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: estimating his comet at a third as much again as its proper weight,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: he had found that his calculations were always at variance with the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: observed situation of the satellite, which was immediately influenced by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the mass of its primary.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: But now, besides enjoying the satisfaction of having punished old
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hakkabut, Rosette was able to recommence his calculations with reference
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to the elements of Nerina upon a correct basis, a task to which he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: devoted himself with redoubled energy.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It will be easily imagined that Isaac Hakkabut, thus caught in his own
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: trap, was jeered most unmercifully by those whom he had attempted to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: make his dupes. Ben Zoof, in particular, was never wearied of telling
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: him how on his return to the world he would be prosecuted for using
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: false weights, and would certainly become acquainted with the inside
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of a prison. Thus badgered, he secluded himself more than ever in his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: dismal hole, never venturing, except when absolutely obliged, to face
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the other members of the community.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the 7th of October the comet re-entered the zone of the telescopic
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: planets, one of which had been captured as a satellite, and the origin
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the whole of which is most probably correctly attributed to the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disintegration of some large planet that formerly revolved between the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: orbits of Mars and Jupiter. By the beginning of the following month half
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of this zone had been traversed, and only two months remained before
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the collision with the earth was to be expected. The temperature was now
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rarely below 12 degrees below zero, but that was far too cold to permit
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the slightest symptoms of a thaw. The surface of the sea remained as
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: remained unaltered in their critical position.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was about this time that the question began to be mooted whether it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would not be right to reopen some communication with the Englishmen at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gibraltar. Not that any doubt was entertained as to their having been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: able successfully to cope with the rigors of the winter; but Captain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac, in a way that did honor to his generosity, represented that,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: however uncourteous might have been their former behavior, it was at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: least due to them that they should be informed of the true condition of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: things, which they had had no opportunity of learning; and, moreover,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that they should be invited to co-operate with the population of Nina's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hive, in the event of any measures being suggested by which the shock of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the approaching collision could be mitigated.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The count and the lieutenant both heartily concurred in Servadac's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sentiments of humanity and prudence, and all agreed that if the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the present, while the surface of the sea presented a smooth and solid
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: use of the steam launch, for which only a few tons of coal had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reserved, just sufficient to convey them to Gourbi Island when the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wind would make that quite unavailable. It was true that with the return

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: atmosphere of Gallia, which would result in wind, but for the present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
