title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: making its way to Gibraltar.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The only question remaining was as to the possibility of going on foot.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The distance was somewhere about 240 miles. Captain Servadac declared
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself quite equal to the undertaking. To skate sixty or seventy miles
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: a day would be nothing, he said, to a practical skater like himself. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whole journey there and back might be performed in eight days. Provided
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with a compass, a sufficient supply of cold meat, and a spirit lamp, by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which he might boil his coffee, he was perfectly sure he should, without
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the least difficulty, accomplish an enterprise that chimed in so exactly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: with his adventurous spirit.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Equally urgent were both the count and the lieutenant to be allowed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to accompany him; nay, they even offered to go instead; but Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: his own orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Highly delighted at his master's decision, Ben Zoof expressed his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was no delay. The departure was fixed for the following morning, the 2nd
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of November.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although it is not to be questioned that a genuine desire of doing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: an act of kindness to his fellow-creatures was a leading motive of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac's proposed visit to Gibraltar, it must be owned that another
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: idea, confided to nobody, least of all to Count Timascheff, had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: starting, he asked him privately whether there was a French tricolor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: among the stores. "I believe so," said the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then don't say a word to anyone, but fasten it up tight in your
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: knapsack."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof found the flag, and folded it up as he was directed. Before
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proceeding to explain this somewhat enigmatical conduct of Servadac,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it is necessary to refer to a certain physiological fact, coincident
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but unconnected with celestial phenomena, originating entirely in the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: frailty of human nature. The nearer that Gallia approached the earth,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the more a sort of reserve began to spring up between the captain and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff. Though they could not be said to be conscious of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it, the remembrance of their former rivalry, so completely buried in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: oblivion for the last year and ten months, was insensibly recovering
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: its hold upon their minds, and the question was all but coming to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the surface as to what would happen if, on their return to earth, the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: handsome Madame de L---- should still be free. From companions in peril,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would they not again be avowed rivals? Conceal it as they would, a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: coolness was undeniably stealing over an intimacy which, though it could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: never be called affectionate, had been uniformly friendly and courteous.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Under these circumstances, it was not surprising that Hector Servadac
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: should not have confided to the count a project which, wild as it was,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: could scarcely have failed to widen the unacknowledged breach that was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: opening in their friendship.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The project was the annexation of Ceuta to the French dominion. The
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Englishmen, rightly enough, had continued to occupy the fragment of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Gibraltar, and their claim was indisputable. But the island of Ceuta,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which before the shock had commanded the opposite side of the strait,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and had been occupied by Spaniards, had since been abandoned, and was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: wish of Servadac's heart.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: may not occupy a grand and commanding situation? What a proud thing it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Next morning, as soon as they had taken their brief farewell of their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: upon England.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: within a mile and a half of the shore, when Ben Zoof, who had a very
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: keen vision, stopped suddenly, and said that he was sure he could see
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: something moving on the top of the island.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Never mind, let us hasten on," said Servadac. A few minutes carried
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them over another mile, when Ben Zoof stopped again.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What is it, Ben Zoof?" asked the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It looks to me like a man on a rock, waving his arms in the air," said
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Plague on it!" muttered Servadac; "I hope we are not too late." Again
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they went on; but soon Ben Zoof stopped for the third time.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It is a semaphore, sir; I see it quite distinctly." And he was not
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: mistaken; it had been a telegraph in motion that had caught his eye.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Plague on it!" repeated the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Too late, sir, do you think?" said Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, Ben Zoof; if that's a telegraph--and there is no doubt of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it--somebody has been before us and erected it; and, moreover, if it is
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moving, there must be somebody working it now."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: He was keenly disappointed. Looking towards the north, he could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: distinguish Gibraltar faintly visible in the extreme distance, and upon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the summit of the rock both Ben Zoof and himself fancied they could make
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: out another semaphore, giving signals, no doubt, in response to the one
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: here.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, it is only too clear; they have already occupied it, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: established their communications," said Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And what are we to do, then?" asked Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We must pocket our chagrin, and put as good a face on the matter as we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: can," replied the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But perhaps there are only four or five Englishmen to protect the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: place," said Ben Zoof, as if meditating an assault.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No, no, Ben Zoof," answered Servadac; "we must do nothing rash. We
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have had our warning, and, unless our representations can induce them to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: yield their position, we must resign our hope."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Thus discomfited, they had reached the foot of the rock, when all at
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: once, like a "Jack-in-the-box," a sentinel started up before them with
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the challenge:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Who goes there?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Friends. Vive la France!" cried the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hurrah for England!" replied the soldier.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: By this time four other men had made their appearance from the upper
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: part of the rock.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What do you want?" asked one of them, whom Servadac remembered to have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seen before at Gibraltar.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Can I speak to your commanding officer?" Servadac inquired.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Which?" said the man. "The officer in command of Ceuta?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, if there is one."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I will acquaint him with your arrival," answered the Englishman, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disappeared.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: In a few minutes the commanding officer, attired in full uniform, was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: seen descending to the shore. It was Major Oliphant himself.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac could no longer entertain a doubt that the Englishmen had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: forestalled him in the occupation of Ceuta. Provisions and fuel had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: evidently been conveyed thither in the boat from Gibraltar before the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea had frozen, and a solid casemate, hollowed in the rock, had afforded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Major Oliphant and his contingent ample protection from the rigor of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the winter. The ascending smoke that rose above the rock was sufficient
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: evidence that good fires were still kept up; the soldiers appeared to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: have thriven well on what, no doubt, had been a generous diet, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: major himself, although he would scarcely have been willing to allow it,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was slightly stouter than before.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Being only about twelve miles distant from Gibraltar, the little
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: garrison at Ceuta had felt itself by no means isolated in its position;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but by frequent excursions across the frozen strait, and by the constant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: use of the telegraph, had kept up their communication with their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fellow-countrymen on the other island. Colonel Murphy and the major had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not even been forced to forego the pleasures of the chessboard. The game
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that had been interrupted by Captain Servadac's former visit was not yet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: concluded; but, like the two American clubs that played their celebrated
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: game in 1846 between Washington and Baltimore, the two gallant officers
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made use of the semaphore to communicate their well-digested moves.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The major stood waiting for his visitor to speak.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Major Oliphant, I believe?" said Servadac, with a courteous bow.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, sir, Major Oliphant, officer in command of the garrison at Ceuta,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was the Englishman's reply. "And to whom," he added, "may I have the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: honor of speaking?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To Captain Servadac, the governor general of Gallia."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Indeed!" said the major, with a supercilious look.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Allow me to express my surprise," resumed the captain, "at seeing you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: installed as commanding officer upon what I have always understood to be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Spanish soil. May I demand your claim to your position?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "My claim is that of first occupant."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But do you not think that the party of Spaniards now resident with me
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: may at some future time assert a prior right to the proprietorship?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I think not, Captain Servadac."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But why not?" persisted the captain.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Because these very Spaniards have, by formal contract, made over Ceuta,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in its integrity, to the British government."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac uttered an exclamation of surprise.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And as the price of that important cession," continued Major Oliphant,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "they have received a fair equivalent in British gold."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah!" cried Ben Zoof, "that accounts for that fellow Negrete and his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: people having such a lot of money."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac was silent. It had become clear to his mind what had been the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: object of that secret visit to Ceuta which he had heard of as being made
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: by the two English officers. The arguments that he had intended to use
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had completely fallen through; all that he had now to do was carefully
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to prevent any suspicion of his disappointed project.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "May I be allowed to ask, Captain Servadac, to what I am indebted for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the honor of this visit?" asked Major Oliphant presently.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I have come, Major Oliphant, in the hope of doing you and your
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: companions a service," replied Servadac, rousing himself from his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reverie.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah, indeed!" replied the major, as though he felt himself quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: independent of all services from exterior sources.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I thought, major, that it was not unlikely you were in ignorance of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the fact that both Ceuta and Gibraltar have been traversing the solar
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: regions on the surface of a comet."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The major smiled incredulously; but Servadac, nothing daunted, went on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to detail the results of the collision between the comet and the earth,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: adding that, as there was the almost immediate prospect of another
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: concussion, it had occurred to him that it might be advisable for the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whole population of Gallia to unite in taking precautionary measures for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the common welfare.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "In fact, Major Oliphant," he said in conclusion, "I am here to inquire
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whether you and your friends would be disposed to join us in our present
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quarters."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am obliged to you, Captain Servadac," answered the major stiffly;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "but we have not the slightest intention of abandoning our post. We have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: received no government orders to that effect; indeed, we have received
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: no orders at all. Our own dispatch to the First Lord of the Admiralty
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: still awaits the mail."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But allow me to repeat," insisted Servadac, "that we are no longer on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the earth, although we expect to come in contact with it again in about
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: eight weeks."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I have no doubt," the major answered, "that England will make every
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: effort to reclaim us."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac felt perplexed. It was quite evident that Major Oliphant had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not been convinced of the truth of one syllable of what he had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: saying.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then I am to understand that you are determined to retain your two
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: garrisons here and at Gibraltar?" asked Servadac, with one last effort
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at persuasion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Certainly; these two posts command the entrance of the Mediterranean."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But supposing there is no longer any Mediterranean?" retorted the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain, growing impatient.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh, England will always take care of that," was Major Oliphant's cool
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reply. "But excuse me," he added presently; "I see that Colonel
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Murphy has just telegraphed his next move. Allow me to wish you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: good-afternoon."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: And without further parley, followed by his soldiers, he retired into
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the casemate, leaving Captain Servadac gnawing his mustache with mingled
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rage and mortification.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A fine piece of business we have made of this!" said Ben Zoof, when he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: found himself alone with his master.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We will make our way back at once," replied Captain Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, the sooner the better, with our tails between our legs," rejoined
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the orderly, who this time felt no inclination to start off to the march
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the Algerian zephyrs. And so the French tricolor returned as it had
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: set out--in Ben Zoof's knapsack.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On the eighth evening after starting, the travelers again set foot on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the volcanic promontory just in time to witness a great commotion.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Palmyrin Rosette was in a furious rage. He had completed all his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: calculations about Nerina, but that perfidious satellite had totally
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disappeared. The astronomer was frantic at the loss of his moon.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captured probably by some larger body, it was revolving in its proper
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: zone of the minor planets.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: CHAPTER XVI. A BOLD PROPOSITION
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: On his return Servadac communicated to the count the result of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: expedition, and, though perfectly silent on the subject of his personal
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: project, did not conceal the fact that the Spaniards, without the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: smallest right, had sold Ceuta to the English.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Having refused to quit their post, the Englishmen had virtually excluded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: themselves from any further consideration; they had had their warning,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and must now take the consequences of their own incredulity.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although it had proved that not a single creature either at Gourbi
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Island, Gibraltar, Ceuta, Madalena, or Formentera had received any
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: injury whatever at the time of the first concussion, there was nothing
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the least to make it certain that a like immunity from harm would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: attend the second. The previous escape was doubtless owing to some
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: slight, though unaccountable, modification in the rate of motion; but
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whether the inhabitants of the earth had fared so fortunately, was a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: question that had still to be determined.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The day following Servadac's return, he and the count and Lieutenant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Procope met by agreement in the cave, formally to discuss what would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the most advisable method of proceeding under their present prospects.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ben Zoof was, as a matter of course, allowed to be present, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Professor Rosette had been asked to attend; but he declined on the plea
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of taking no interest in the matter. Indeed, the disappearance of his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: moon had utterly disconcerted him, and the probability that he should
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: soon lose his comet also, plunged him into an excess of grief which he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: preferred to bear in solitude.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although the barrier of cool reserve was secretly increasing between the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: captain and the count, they scrupulously concealed any outward token of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: their inner feelings, and without any personal bias applied their best
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: energies to the discussion of the question which was of such mutual,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: nay, of such universal interest.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac was the first to speak. "In fifty-one days, if Professor
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Rosette has made no error in his calculations, there is to be a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: recurrence of collision between this comet and the earth. The inquiry
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that we have now to make is whether we are prepared for the coming
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shock. I ask myself, and I ask you, whether it is in our power, by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: any means, to avert the evil consequences that are only too likely to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: follow?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff, in a voice that seemed to thrill with solemnity, said:
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "In such events we are at the disposal of an over-ruling Providence;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: human precautions cannot sway the Divine will."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But with the most profound reverence for the will of Providence,"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: replied the captain, "I beg to submit that it is our duty to devise
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: whatever means we can to escape the threatening mischief. Heaven helps
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: them that help themselves."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And what means have you to suggest, may I ask?" said the count, with a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: faint accent of satire.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac was forced to acknowledge that nothing tangible had hitherto
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: presented itself to his mind.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I don't want to intrude," observed Ben Zoof, "but I don't understand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: why such learned gentlemen as you cannot make the comet go where you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: want it to go."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You are mistaken, Ben Zoof, about our learning," said the captain;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "even Professor Rosette, with all his learning, has not a shadow of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: power to prevent the comet and the earth from knocking against each
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: other."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then I cannot see what is the use of all this learning," the orderly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: replied.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "One great use of learning," said Count Timascheff with a smile, "is to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: make us know our own ignorance."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: While this conversation had been going on, Lieutenant Procope had been
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sitting in thoughtful silence. Looking up, he now said, "Incident to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: this expected shock, there may be a variety of dangers. If, gentlemen,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: you will allow me, I will enumerate them; and we shall, perhaps, by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: taking them _seriatim_, be in a better position to judge whether we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: can successfully grapple with them, or in any way mitigate their
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequences."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: There was a general attitude of attention. It was surprising how calmly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: they proceeded to discuss the circumstances that looked so threatening
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and ominous.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "First of all," resumed the lieutenant, "we will specify the different
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ways in which the shock may happen."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And the prime fact to be remembered," interposed Servadac, "is that the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: combined velocity of the two bodies will be about 21,000 miles an hour."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Express speed, and no mistake!" muttered Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Just so," assented Procope. "Now, the two bodies may impinge either
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: directly or obliquely. If the impact is sufficiently oblique, Gallia may
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: do precisely what she did before: she may graze the earth; she may,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: or she may not, carry off a portion of the earth's atmosphere and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: substance, and so she may float away again into space; but her orbit
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: would undoubtedly be deranged, and if we survive the shock, we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shall have small chance of ever returning to the world of our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: fellow-creatures."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Professor Rosette, I suppose," Ben Zoof remarked, "would pretty soon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: find out all about that."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But we will leave this hypothesis," said the lieutenant; "our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: own experience has sufficiently shown us its advantages and its
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: disadvantages. We will proceed to consider the infinitely more serious
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: alternative of direct impact; of a shock that would hurl the comet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: straight on to the earth, to which it would become attached."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A great wart upon her face!" said Ben Zoof, laughing.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The captain held up his finger to his orderly, making him understand
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: that he should hold his tongue.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It is, I presume, to be taken for granted," continued Lieutenant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Procope, "that the mass of the earth is comparatively so large that, in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the event of a direct collision, her own motion would not be sensibly
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: retarded, and that she would carry the comet along with her, as part of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: herself."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very little question of that, I should think," said Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, then," the lieutenant went on, "what part of this comet of ours
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: will be the part to come into collision with the earth? It may be the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: equator, where we are; it may be at the exactly opposite point, at our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: antipodes; or it may be at either pole. In any case, it seems hard to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: foresee whence there is to come the faintest chance of deliverance."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Is the case so desperate?" asked Servadac.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I will tell you why it seems so. If the side of the comet on which we
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: are resident impinges on the earth, it stands to reason that we must be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: crushed to atoms by the violence of the concussion."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Regular mincemeat!" said Ben Zoof, whom no admonitions could quite
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: reduce to silence.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And if," said the lieutenant, after a moment's pause, and the slightest
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: possible frown at the interruption--"and if the collision should occur
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at our antipodes, the sudden check to the velocity of the comet would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: quite equivalent to a shock _in situ_; and, another thing, we should run
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the risk of being suffocated, for all our comet's atmosphere would be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: assimilated with the terrestrial atmosphere, and we, supposing we were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: not dashed to atoms, should be left as it were upon the summit of an
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: enormous mountain (for such to all intents and purposes Gallia would
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be), 450 miles above the level of the surface of the globe, without a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: particle of air to breathe."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But would not our chances of escape be considerably better," asked
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff, "in the event of either of the comet's poles being the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: point of contact?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Taking the combined velocity into account," answered the lieutenant,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I confess that I fear the violence of the shock will be too great to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: permit our destruction to be averted."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A general silence ensued, which was broken by the lieutenant himself.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Even if none of these contingencies occur in the way we have
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: contemplated, I am driven to the suspicion that we shall be burnt
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: alive."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Burnt alive!" they all exclaimed in a chorus of horror.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes. If the deductions of modern science be true, the speed of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: comet, when suddenly checked, will be transmuted into heat, and that
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: heat will be so intense that the temperature of the comet will be raised
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to some millions of degrees."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: No one having anything definite to allege in reply to Lieutenant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Procope's forebodings, they all relapsed into silence. Presently Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Zoof asked whether it was not possible for the comet to fall into the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: middle of the Atlantic.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Procope shook his head. "Even so, we should only be adding the fate of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: drowning to the list of our other perils."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then, as I understand," said Captain Servadac, "in whatever way or
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in whatever place the concussion occurs, we must be either crushed,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: suffocated, roasted, or drowned. Is that your conclusion, lieutenant?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I confess I see no other alternative," answered Procope, calmly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But isn't there another thing to be done?" said Ben Zoof.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What do you mean?" his master asked.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why, to get off the comet before the shock comes."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "How could you get off Gallia?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That I can't say," replied the orderly.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am not sure that that could not be accomplished," said the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: lieutenant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: All eyes in a moment were riveted upon him, as, with his head resting
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: on his hands, he was manifestly cogitating a new idea. "Yes, I think
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: it could be accomplished," he repeated. "The project may appear
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: extravagant, but I do not know why it should be impossible. Ben Zoof has
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: hit the right nail on the head; we must try and leave Gallia before the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: shock."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Leave Gallia! How?" said Count Timascheff.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The lieutenant did not at once reply. He continued pondering for a time,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: and at last said, slowly and distinctly, "By making a balloon!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Servadac's heart sank.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A balloon!" he exclaimed. "Out of the question! Balloons are exploded
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: things. You hardly find them in novels. Balloon, indeed!"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

text: "Listen to me," replied Procope. "Perhaps I can convince you that my
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: idea is not so chimerical as you imagine." And, knitting his brow, he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: proceeded to establish the feasibility of his plan. "If we can ascertain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the precise moment when the shock is to happen, and can succeed
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: in launching ourselves a sufficient time beforehand into Gallia's
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: atmosphere, I believe it will transpire that this atmosphere will
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: amalgamate with that of the earth, and that a balloon whirled along by
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the combined velocity would glide into the mingled atmosphere and remain
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff reflected for a minute, and said, "I think, lieutenant,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: I understand your project. The scheme seems tenable; and I shall be
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: ready to co-operate with you, to the best of my power, in putting it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: into execution."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Only, remember," continued Procope, "there are many chances to one
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: against our success. One instant's obstruction and stoppage in our
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: passage, and our balloon is burnt to ashes. Still, reluctant as I am to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: acknowledge it, I confess that I feel our sole hope of safety rests in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: our getting free from this comet."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "If the chances were ten thousand to one against us," said Servadac, "I
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: think the attempt ought to be made."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But have we hydrogen enough to inflate a balloon?" asked the count.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Hot air will be all that we shall require," the lieutenant answered;
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "we are only contemplating about an hour's journey."
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah, a fire-balloon! A montgolfier!" cried Servadac. "But what are you
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: going to do for a casing?"
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: _Dobryna_; they are both light and strong," rejoined the lieutenant.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Count Timascheff complimented the lieutenant upon his ingenuity, and Ben
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: cheer.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Truly daring was the plan of which Lieutenant Procope had thus become
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the originator; but the very existence of them all was at stake, and the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: design must be executed resolutely. For the success of the enterprise it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: at which the collision would occur, and Captain Servadac undertook the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: professor.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: To Lieutenant Procope himself was entrusted the superintendence of the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: construction of the montgolfier, and the work was begun at once. It was
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to be large enough to carry the whole of the twenty-three residents in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the volcano, and, in order to provide the means of floating aloft
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: combustion for a while, and keep up the necessary supply of heated air.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The sails of the _Dobryna_, which had all been carefully stowed away in
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Hive, were of a texture unusually close, and quite capable of being
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made airtight by means of a varnish, the ingredients of which were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: rummaged out of the promiscuous stores of the tartan. The lieutenant
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: himself traced out the pattern and cut out the strips, and all hands
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were employed in seaming them together. It was hardly the work for
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: little fingers, but Nina persisted in accomplishing her own share of it.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Russians were quite at home at occupation of this sort, and having
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: initiated the Spaniards into its mysteries, the task of joining together
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the only two members of the community who took no part in this somewhat
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: tedious proceeding.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A month passed away, but Servadac found no opportunity of getting at the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: information he had pledged himself to gain. On the sole occasion when he
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: had ventured to broach the subject with the astronomer, he had received
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: for answer that as there was no hurry to get back to the earth, there
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: need be no concern about any dangers of transit.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Indeed, as time passed on, the professor seemed to become more and more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: inaccessible. A pleasant temperature enabled him to live entirely in his
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: bided his time. He grew more and more impressed with the importance of
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: finding out the exact moment at which the impact would take place,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: but was content to wait for a promising opportunity to put any fresh
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: questions on the subject to the too reticent astronomer.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Meanwhile, the earth's disc was daily increasing in magnitude; the comet
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: traveled 50,000,000 leagues during the month, at the close of which it
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: was not more than 78,000,000 leagues from the sun.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A thaw had now fairly set in. The breaking up of the frozen ocean was a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: magnificent spectacle, and "the great voice of the sea," as the whalers
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: graphically describe it, was heard in all its solemnity. Little streams
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: of water began to trickle down the declivities of the mountain and along
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: the shelving shore, only to be transformed, as the melting of the snow
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: continued, into torrents or cascades. Light vapors gathered on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: horizon, and clouds were formed and carried rapidly along by breezes to
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: which the Gallian atmosphere had long been unaccustomed. All these
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were doubtless but the prelude to atmospheric disturbances of a more
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: startling character; but as indications of returning spring, they were
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: greeted with a welcome which no apprehensions for the future could
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: prevent being glad and hearty.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: A double disaster was the inevitable consequence of the thaw. Both the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: pedestal on which the ships had been upheaved was gradually undermined,
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: like the icebergs of the Arctic Ocean, by warm currents of water, and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: on the night of the 12th the huge block collapsed _en masse_, so that on
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: except the fragments scattered on the shore.
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Although certainly expected, the catastrophe could not fail to cause a
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: sense of general depression. Well-nigh one of their last ties to Mother
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: Earth had been broken; the ships were gone, and they had only a balloon
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: to replace them!
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: be impossible. His oaths were simply dreadful; his imprecations on the
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: accursed race were full of wrath. He swore that Servadac and his people
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: were responsible for his loss; he vowed that they should be sued and
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

text: made to pay him damages; he asserted that he had been brought from
title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules

title: Off on a Comet! a Journey through Planetary Space
author: Verne, Jules
